loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Sixty-two-year-old Mary is engaged in farming. She owns and tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Mary primarily grows rice crops to sell. Mary also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells her pigs at the market. Mary earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. 

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Hotamjon

texts.en:
Hotamjon is a devoted father who has dedicated himself to his livestock. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family, composed of his wife and 3 children.  Hotamjon raises livestock for sale. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family, which really needs it. Today Hotamjon looks for support from IMON International to obtain the necessary loan to purchase cows to raise.  With this loan his beloved family will benefit as much as he will.   
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Briggiti Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briggiti, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  17 años de edad el mismo que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo es empleado público.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse algo propio se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta  donde llegan sus clientes cuando tiene mercadería nueva, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también en ocasiones le envían desde los Estados Unidos ya que allá tiene familiares. Lleva seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años.
 
Sus sueños es ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The Montecristi village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.
Here we met Briggiti, a 47-year-old woman. She and her husband have a 17-year-old son who is in his last year of high school. Her husband is a civil servant.
In order to earn something for herself, our friend sells all sorts of clothes door to door. Customers also come to her house when she has new merchandise, and she tells us that she also takes special orders from her customers. She works every day, and offers eight-day credits to her customers. She travels to Guayaquil to purchase her goods and sometimes receives shipments from the United States, where some of her relatives live. She's been making a living this way for six years and it's going rather well.
She will use this loan to buy more goods to sell, including pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She's been a member of the village bank for two years.
Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and get a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
In the photo is Susan, 52, married and a mother of four.  She does dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for three years has four workers who assist her in her tasks.  She was previously involved in horticultural farming. 
 
Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to get business loans which she has used to boost her business.  She needs 100,000 Kes to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Seraphine Kavithe

texts.en:
Seraphine is a 51-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 13 years to 30 years. She describes herself as innovative and patient. She operates a general store where she sells bananas, potatoes, bread, beverages and other items. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located within a shopping centre in Thika. She describes her biggest business challenge as low sales volumes especially when the neighbouring schools are on vacation, since they are her major customers. 

Seraphine will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase bananas to increase her stock and meet the high demand for bananas by her customers. Her business goal is to grow her business to a wholesale and become the supplier of bananas in her area. She wants to build her own business premises. She hopes that in the future she will be able to teach her children business skills that will help them thrive in self-employment.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Kerin Fernando

texts.es:
Kerin, es soltero vive con su madre, él se dedica a vender sorbetes, paletas y sorbeletas,en el centro de la ciudad, de lunes a sábado, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar producto como, paletas, sorbetes, vasitos, de esa forma tendrá surtido el negocio, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
El propósito de Kerin es mantener su negocio  y de esa forma ayudarle  a su madre para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Kerin is single and lives with his mother. He sells sorbets, popsicles, and ice cream bars in the center of town. He sells Mondays through Saturdays and has no set schedule.

He needs the loan to buy products such as popsicles, sorbets, and cups. This will stock his business so he can serve his customers. Kerin's objective is to maintain his business and thus help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: Compra de paletas, sorbetes, vasitos.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida, tiene un hijo de 11 meses con su pareja, ella se dedica a las labores del hogar, su negocio es un taller de ebanistería donde hace muebles finos de madera, como:  Roperos, mesas, divisiones, closet, puertas, muebles de cocina, etc.
Desde hace 7 años estableció este  negocio al que le dedica tiempo completo. 
Este negocio a crecido con la ayuda de ODEF, quien le ha financiado  2 prestamos anteriormente, uno de L.50,000.00 y L.20,000.00, los que a pagado muy bien, ya que sus  ventas han incrementado  e igual que sus ingresos  lo que le ha permitido  mejorar  su  nivel de vida de su familia.
Su tercer prestamos actualmente es de L.20,000.00, lo solicitó para compra de materia prima (madera), con el fin de expandir su negocio en la comunidad y obtener mayor venta.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, age 37, lives in the village of San Juan Pueblo in Atlántida.  He has an 11 month old son with his life partner.  She devotes herself to the household chores.

His business is a cabinet making shop.  He makes fine wooden furniture like wardrobes, tables, dividers, closets, doors, and kitchen furniture, etc.  He established his business seven years ago, and he works there full time.

This business has grown with the help of ODEF.  They have given him two previous loans.  One was for 50,000 lempira and the other was for 20,000 lempira, which he has paid back very well. His increase in sales as well as income have allowed him to improve his family’s standard of living.

His third loan is currently for 20,000 lempiras.  He requested it to buy raw material (wood) in order expand his business in the community and to get greater sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material (wood).

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 48-yearld mother of eight. She lives in the Negev region. Amna opened a small mini market with snacks and toys. Her store serves the neighborhood and caters to children during their school breaks and after school, providing snacks and treats.

Amna needed this loan to restock for the new school year, purchase a refrigerator, and expand her line of merchandise.

In the future she wants to further expand and include dairy products such as yogurts, milks and cheeses.

loans.use: to restock for the new school year, purchase a refrigerator, and expand her range of merchandise.

loans.name: Abakundakurima /kzh Group

texts.fr:
Félix fait partie du groupe Abakundakurima/Kzh. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 9 mois à 12 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Félix est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz. Dans les prochaines années,Félix voudrait être le fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits,Félix prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Felix is part of the Abakundakurima / Kzh group. He is 33 years old and is married with four children ranging from 9 months to 12 years old, and of whom one attends school. His own education level is 6 years of primary school.

Felix is a rice farmer. It is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected rice seedlings.

In coming years, Felix wants to become the supplier of rice for the region. With the profits, Felix plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her decorative embroidery business. She has great technical skills and can craft beautiful embroidered clothes for her clients. Due to her good quality services, her embroidered clothes are in high demand among her clients. With this loan, Farzana will buy embroidery material, such as beads and thread, in bulk quantity to be able to prepare even better looking clothes and increase her sales and profits.

Farzana's husband also operates a decorative embroidery business. Both she and her husband together earn reasonably good profits, which helps them fulfill the basic needs of their family. Farzana has given birth to five children, three of whom are studying, while the other two remain at home. She is a great wife and very caring mother and is raising her children very well.

Farzana is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident about her business's continued success as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto nació en la comunidad de Paucarbamba y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero y aun no tiene hijos.  

Augusto desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, él se dedica a  la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Augusto requiere el préstamo para comprar insecticidas y abono.  
 
Augusto se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Augusto pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in the community of Paucarbamba and lives in the same community where he was born. He is 26 years old, single, and has no children. Augusto goes about his business in the city of Ollantaytambo. He works in agriculture and with livestock. He has worked at this business for several years and is doing well, thanks to his hard work.

Augusto needs a loan to buy insecticides and fertilizer. He is thankful for the opportunity provided to him through this organizations and is committed to repaying the loan on time. He belongs to the Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar (Immaculate Conception of Pachar) Community Bank in the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: buy insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 36 years old and single.

He earns a living through flower farming in the Philippines. Ruel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  He has been farming flowers for four years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Ruel is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to repair and renovate his family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juana Eduriges

texts.es: Juana Eduriges tiene 36 años de edad, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida, es una mujer emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante ella y sus hijos. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, cremas, ropa en general y prendas de oro y plata. Sueña con lograr incrementar su inventario cada día más y brindarle a sus clientes una excelente atención ofreciéndole variedad de producto.
texts.en: Juan Eduriges, 36, works selling general merchandise.  She has had this livelihood for more than three years.  She is an enterprising woman who has learned how to get herself and her children ahead.  The objective of the loan she is requesting is to buy footwear, perfume, creams, clothing in general, and gold and silver accessories.  She dreams about managing to increase her inventory more every day and giving her customers excellent service by offering them a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy footwear, perfume, creams, clothing, and gold and silver accessories.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica hace varios años a la siembra de granos básicos de maíz y frijoles el oficio lo aprendió de su padre no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales  para poner la energía eléctrica en su casa, ya que es muy importante para su familia y podrán poner ventas de helados como: charamuscas, choco bananos, gaseosas de esa forma cada día tendrán ingresos.
El sueño de Oscar es tener éxito en sus cosechas y que este año poder sacar lo suficiente para venderlo y dejar para los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his wife and children. He has been working for several years in cultivating corn and beans. He learned this livelihood from his father. He doesn’t have a set schedule.

He will use the loan to buy materials for installing electricity in his house. This is very important for his family and they can start selling cold items, like homemade popsicles, chocolate-covered bananas, and soft drinks. In this way they would have income every day.

Oscar’s dream is to be successful in his harvests and that this year he will harvest enough to sell and have money left for his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials for installing electricity in his house

loans.name: Norma Jhaquelin

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal Los Laureles, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, en su entorno se encuentran,  grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas y viejas hacienda, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de ganado y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Norma tiene 27 años, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 10 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Norma trabaja como empleada domestica, actividad que la desempeña desde una muy corta edad, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. En su casa se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos y también cría y vende pollos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the "Los Laureles" communal bank, and lives on the outskirts of Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  This is a place with a cold climate, surrounded by old estates and large pastures of cattle farms. Its people have small businesses, raise livestock, and farm, while maintaining the traditions of their peoples. 

Norma is 27, separated, and has two children, ages 10 and 1. Her eldest daughter goes to a small school in the city.  She owns the house where they live. 

Norma works as a housekeeper, an occupation she has worked at since she was very young. She works all day long, from Monday to Friday. In her home, she looks after her children, and also raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs.

This is her third loan with the communal bank, and she will use it to buy chickens and chicken feed. Her goal is to enlarge her home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Doncellas es un grupo pequeño, integrado por 5 mujeres que se conocen muy bien y los 5 ciclos que llevan con el crédito nunca han batallado con los pagos.
Julia es una mujer joven y sobresaliente de 27 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 1 años y un bebe de 7 meses. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ya tiene 2 años con ella y el crédito lo utilizara para surtir más su negocio por la temporada navideña.
Julia nos menciona que quiere poner una pequeña papelería, ya que ahorita su negocio esta dando muchos frutos, además de que le gustaría seguir con este giro.
texts.en: Doncellas is a small group made up of five women who know each other very well. They have never had any problems with payments the five times they have obtained loans. Julia is a young and outstanding 27-year-old woman. She lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children of 10 and 1 years and a baby of 7 months. She has a grocery store in her house. She has had it for two years, and she will use the loan to stock her business some more for the Christmas season. Julia says that she wants to put in a small stationery store, since right now her business is doing really well and she would like to continue in this way.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store some more for the Christmas season

loans.name: Keyly Geraldina

texts.es:
Keyly es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Keyly se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Adobo de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Keyly trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y verduras, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Keyly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos andamios y mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, verduras, leche, menestras y otros, de esta manera Keyly tendrá mejor acondicionado su negocio y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran convertirse en una buena profesional y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Keyly is an 18-year-old, single young woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her parents and siblings. Keyly is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with dreams of succeeding. Thanks to the hard work and support of her parents, Keyly is currently able to study Systems Engineering. In her free time, Keyly likes to watch television and on special occasions she cooks the delicious Adobo de Pollo (a typical chicken dish) to share with her family. 

Through her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Keyly works in her own small grocery store. She works 10-hour days each day and believes that her success so far is due to the competitive prices she offers and the kind way she treats her customers.

Keyly is very grateful to Kiva lenders and the help offered to her that will let her buy two shelving units and merchandise such as rice, sugar, vegetables, milk, vegetable soup, and others. In this way, Keyly will keep her store better set up and she will be able to serve more customers. Keyly plans to continue working hard toward her dream of becoming a professional and little by little moving forward.

loans.use: to buy two shelving units and merchandise.

loans.name: Wangnigninan-A Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNINAN-A est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Ruffine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 55 ans est veuve, mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Ruffine vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Ruffine. Ruffine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux besoins de son enfant, Ruffine vend du maïs, du gari (farine de manioc)et la bouillie accompagnée de gâteaux à base de blé depuis quatorze ans. Ruffine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ruffine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNINAN-A un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, du gari.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: A mother of four children and is aged in mid 30s, Mary is a local farmer from Battambang province. She struggles for a living via rice farming ad grocery iterms sellling. She has involved in current business for 11 years, earning about 31,000 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Mary with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of two, she is leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash, seed, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes to gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash, seed, and to pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 29 years old married to Edwin and blessed with three children aged between eight and six months years old.She has been in shop business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES.15,000.

This being her first loan with VFK,she intends to buy more stock of sugar,salt,baking flour,maize flour and cooking fat.


She anticipates to help the husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.She dreams of become the best entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the shop

loans.name: Nazenim

texts.en: Nazenim is married and the mother of three children. All of her children are married. Nazenim was born in 1964. She and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land of Fuzuli city region. Now they living in the Baku region. She has been in the cosmetics sales business for many years. Nazenim sells cosmetic products  shampoo, perfume, pomade, lipstick, etc. in own home. Today she wants to increase her business. Now Nazenim has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan of 1500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).She wants to buy shampoo,perfume,cosmetics and beauty products to increase business and in the future she want to have her own beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy shampoo,perfume,cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en: The pictures and stunning town of Sipoteni is favorable for the A.’s store, located on the hillside overlooking the regional center of Ungheni, which is on the border with Romania. Most people from higher up the hill and those directly below welcome the option of a nearby grocery store as a source of food and household supplies that doesn’t require a descent into the lower part of town. Starting in 1995, the store began serving the local people, originally offering mostly snack foods and beverages and developing from there to carry more goods. They want to have a better variety of perishable products (milk products and frozen goods), but first need another refrigerator/freezer case to store and display them. Gheorghe would also like to expand his grocery store into a comfortable relaxing bar. He is planning on   providing outdoor seating for customers in the spring and with this loan is planning to construct a covered porch and a separate window for patrons to order from instead of coming inside every time for a new drink.  He would like a loan to finance the purchase of the needed construction materials and the refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is 51 years old. She is married and has a child. She provides for her family by selling milk, cheese and cream. In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
This business is the only source of income for her and her family .
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow in order to improve the production of cheese, milk, cream.
She has runs this business for 15 years. 
Ofelya is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ahmedbeyli village.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: A great seed seller is Rosemary Okoje. She is 40 years old, and is married with eight children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells seed yams to the people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $550 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more seed yams to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng H. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a market vendor selling Prahouk ( a kind of fermented fish, whose flavor is very popular with Cambodians), while her husband works in a farm planting crops and raising pigs. Together, they generally make up to $7 each day. This loan will be used to purchase more Prahouk for her inventory; any remainder of the money will be used to buy pigs and feed to supplement their livestock raising micro-business.

loans.use: To purchase more Prahouk (fermented fish), pigs, and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Eva Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana is 19 years old, she belongs to a big, modest family but became an orphan as her mother passed away more than 3 years ago. Her father, who owns a small haberdashery, could not confront expenses and education of her 5 younger siblings on his own, so Yovana decided to move from Ayaviri, her birthplace, to work in order to help her family financially.

At the moment she sells furniture from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., 6 days a week and in her free time she makes crafts and knits garments of alpaca wool. Her clients seem very pleased with her harmonious work so she has many orders and need the money to buy material for her crafts and knitting. She is asking for a loan of US$200 so she can meet the demands from her clients and with this additional work earn enough to support her younger brothers. She promises to pay back the loan in 6 months and hopes for support so she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer. Yovana es una joven D. 19 años D. edad, proviene D. una amplia y modesta familia, quedó huérfana D. madre hace más D. 3 años y su padre con su pequeño negocio D. venta D. mercerías no podía afrontar solo los gastos D. su hogar y educación D. sus 5 hermanos menores con el afán D. apoyar a su familia y en busca D. un mejor porvenir decidió salir D. su pueblo natal Ayaviri con el fin D. generar mayores ingresos económicos en beneficio D. su familia.

Actualmente se desempeña vendiendo muebles D. 7:00 D. L. mañana a 7:00 D. L. noche durante 6 días a L. semana.En sus horas libres se dedica al trabajo D. artesanía, oficio que aprendió D. su madre, teje chompas a base D. lana D. alpaca y los ofrece a sus clientes estos quedan muy satisfechos y complacidos por el trabajo tan armonioso que realiza y ahora tiene gran cantidad D. pedidos pero no tiene suficiente capital para comprar sus materiales.L. solicitud que hace es por un monto D. 200 dólares, dinero que utilizará para comprar sus materiales y cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes a su vez este trabajo le generará un ingreso económico adicional con el que podrá apoyar a sus hermanos menores; elL. promete hacer L. devolución del préstamo en un lapso D. 6 meses.Ayudemos a Yovana a incursionar y crecer este negocio. ElL. espera nuestro apoyo

loans.use: Desea el préstamo para comprar  materiales  para la elaboración  de sus trabajos

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Hoàng Thị Châu, 47 years of age, is a hard working & diligent person. Ever since she joined TYM fund, her family financial situation had changed for the better. This time she requests a loan of 375 USD to buy more pet birds to raise. More and more people are keeping pet bird as a hobby, this is good for her business. The investment will be fruitful. Her husband, Lê Bá Bông, is very supportive of her.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Châu, 47 tuổi, là con người chịu khó, siêng năng trong công việc. Từ ngày tham gia vay vốn trả dần gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD về để mua thêm chim cảnh. Nhu cầu chơi chim cảnh của các hộ gia đình đang ngày càng phát triển gia đình chị Châu đầu tư vốn vào loại hình kinh doanh này càng có hiệu quả cao. Chồng chị, anh Lê Bá Bông cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ thực hiện dự án

loans.use: Buy birds

loans.name: Mabel Nely

texts.es:
Mabel Nelly, 38, has three children, ages 22, 20 and 2 years old. She has been a member of Banco Communal Solución for 8 years. During this time, she saved enough money to build a second floor in her house. She also bought appliances and cooking utensils but the most help she received from Banco Comunal was advice on how to educate her children with love and care.

In her business, Mabel sells fruit - an activity she learned from her mother when she was a little girl. Mabel buys prickly pear cactus, which is a fruit native to the region and sells it wholesale at markets in Lima. In these same markets, she also buys fruits like papaya, apples, pepino, and others that are in high demand to sell in Ayacuchan markets.

However, Mabel has another business where she sells auto spare parts from her home. She started this business 10 years ago because her husband was a mechanic. At the time, she thought about supplying the parts that her husband needed. This is how Mabel started delivering parts from Lima. Now, her store has spare parts and auto lubricants.

The loan she needs amounts to 3000 Peruvian sols. The total will be invested in boxes and barrels of car lubricants like oil from Shell. Her savings will then be used to build a third floor in her house and for her own savings. Her dream is to buy a cart to transport her load and to have her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Mabel Nelly tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 2 años. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Solución desde hace 8 años y en este tiempo ha ahorrado lo suficiente para construir el segundo piso de su casa. Además compró sus artefactos y utensilios de cocina, pero lo que más la ayudo fueron los consejos que le dieron en su Banco Comunal sobre cómo educar a los hijos con cariño y amor.

El negocio de Mabel es la venta de fruta, actividad que aprendió de su mamá cuando era una niña. Mabel compra tuna, que es una fruta de la región y lo vende en el mercado mayorista de frutas de Lima, y a la vez, en este mercado compra frutas como papaya, manzana, pepino y otras frutas que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado ayacuchano y los vende.

Mabel además realiza otro negocio en paralelo, que es la venta de repuestos de autos, actividad que realiza en su casa. Hace 10 años inició este negocio porque su esposo era mecánico y pensó en proveer ella misma los repuestos que necesitaba su esposo. Fue así que Mabel comenzó a traer repuestos de Lima y ahora tiene su tienda de repuestos y lubricantes.

El préstamo que necesita es de 3000 soles, monto que será invertido en la compra de lubricantes como aceite Shell en cajas y en baldes. Lo que ahorre lo utilizará en la construcción del tercer piso de su casa y también para tener un capital propio. Su sueño es comprar un carro para transportar sus cargas y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: The loan she needs will be invested in boxes and barrels of car lubricants like oil from Shell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married. She is retired from her previous work and lives in Zaporozhye. Valentina’s retirement pay was very small which is why she decided to start her own venture to support her family. She now sells household items in one of the local markets. She has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, Valentina has about $2000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1600. Her monthly net profit is about $1200.

Valentina wants to continue to grow and expand her business. She is planning to use this loan of $1200 to increase her stock and hopefully open a new vending facility in the future. She always tries to do familiar things in a different and better way and is constantly looking for innovative methods to do business. Valentina is hoping to persist in her entrepreneurial exercise and achieve stability and success.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Zhulfi

texts.en: Zhulfi is a very low-income man. He is 52, married, and has five children. Zhulfi lives with his parents in the village of Saatli city in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. He has a herd of five cows. He started his business five years ago with one cow, and he has increased the number of animals in the herd to five. Now he has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a  $600 loan to build an open shed for his cattle.

loans.use: To build an open shed

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Eva M., who is married with three children, age four, fourteen, and twenty-one.

In 1996, Eva established a business selling fresh vegetables. She now requires a loan to purchase more stock of vegetables in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 26 years old, she lives with her significant other and have two kids ages 4 and 2. In some years, her older son will be attending school. For this reason, Graciela is already saving money.

Graciela proudly shares with us that she has her own house which she was able to get from her sacrifices and hard work. At first, was extremely difficult to find a steady job and financial stability. But throughout the years she's been able to improve her life.

Graciela currently owns a pantry where she sells foods for every day consumption: meats, breads, flour, oils, dairy products, yerba mate, among others. The business gives her good revenues, Graciela is great at managing money. Her business is one of the few ones in the area that offer a wide variety of goods.

Tanslated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela tiene 26 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y otro de 2 años, el próximo años su hijo mayor ya irá a la escuela por lo que Graciela ya tiene unos ahorros preparados para sus estudio.

Graciela cuenta orgullosa que ya posee su casa propia que pudo adquirir hace unos años gracias al sacrificio de su pareja y ella. En principio le costo mucho obtener un trabajo fijo y estabilidad económica, pero con los años logró ir superando cada obstáculo para poder salir adelante.

Graciela posee hoy día una despensa en donde se dedica a la venta de insumos y comestibles para el consumo diario como ser: carnes, panificados, harina, aceite, lácteos, yerba mate, entre otros. El negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias, además de que Graciela es muy buena administradora de su negocio y de su familia. Su negocio es uno de los pocos comercios mejor surtido de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase of meats and drinks

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia learned to work to achieve a stable economic environment for her family. She fulfills the roles of both mother and father for her three children, and because of them that she dedicates herself to selling beer and liquor both wholesale and retail. She also offers these drinks for social events in the city. She has a tent and chairs that she adapted as a work strategy with the aim of obtaining larger profits. Her wish is to improve and expand her small sales space, and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia, aprendió a trabajar para lograr una economía estable. Ella desempeña los roles de padre y madre para sus 3 hijos y es por ellos que se dedica a la venta de cerveza y licores al por mayor y menor, así mismo oferta estas bebidas para los eventos sociales de su ciudad, cuenta con una carpa y sillas que adaptó como una estrategia de trabajo a fin de obtener mayores ganancias.Su deseo es mejorar y ampliar su pequeño espacio de ventas y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Implementation of a small sales space

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is the mother of 3 children who are studying with the goal of entering the professional world. These children inspire Hermelinda to keep working. Only with your help will she be able to purchase natural fertilizers so that she can grow high quality crops to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

HERMELINDA, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios superiores en ciudades alejadas de su hogar con el fin de llegar a convertirse en profesionales y ayudar a sus padres.Son estos los motores que promueve el esfuerzo de Hermelinda, quien con unas ganas inmensas de seguir trabajando día a día requiere de vuestro apoyo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales para obtener productos de excelente calidad de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita M. is a married woman who lives in Thecho with her husband and one son. Both her husband and Ramita are engaged in making wax statues. They have five years of experience in this work . They learned this work from their suppliers. They sell their statues in Patan. The Patan area is a well-known place for idol-making work in Nepal. 
In order to sustain in their business they have to invest continuously in their business. So Mrs. M. is requesting her third loan of Rs 20,000 (US$30) to buy various types of raw material like wax and equipment for their work.
They have a 4-year-old son who is studying in boarding school. Mrs. M. and her husband are planning to save their income for their son’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Amina's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Amina is 33 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 17. She became a bites and tea seller in 2005. She works daily from 7AM to 9PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 (US Dollars) in sales.

Amina hopes for a loan to buy more bites to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling bread, clothing, charcoal, juice, soap, and perfumes.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more bites items

loans.name: Hue Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Huệ tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Với số vốn vay ban đầu 2.000.000đ chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư kinh doanh các mặt hàng phục vụ cho các em học sinh tại địa phương. Do có vị trí kinh doanh thuận lợi, giá cả hợp lý và thái độ phục vụ rất nhiệt tình cửa hàng của chị ngày càng thu hút được nhiều khách hàng hơn. Hàng ngày chị vừa bán hàng vừa đảm nhiệm công việc chăm sóc con cái còn anh  Toàn chồng chị đi làm thợ nhôm kính. Hiện nay công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang có rất nhiều thuận lợi vì vậy chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ  để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng văn phòng phẩm phục vụ cho các em học sinh và các đơn vị hành chính, các doanh nghiệp trên địa bàn xã Tam Hồng huyện Yên Lạc - Tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.
  Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. Hue joined the TYM fund in 2003. She used the first loan of 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy and sell office supplies to pupils in Tam Hong County, Yen Lac, Vinh Phuc. Thanks to the store’s position, her friendly attitude, and reasonabL. pricing, the store was a success. WhiL. working in the store, she could also take care of her children. Her husband is Mr. Toan, a glazier. Because the store shows potentials, Mrs. Hue plans to borrow 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand the product lines and introduce new products to customers. The family’s income is 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Kokouda

texts.fr:
Né à Kini Kondji le 27 septembre 1961 dans la préfecture de Yoto, monsieur B. Kokouda est marié et père de six enfants tous scolarisés. Il est revendeur de porte et de tôle dans la ville de Lomé. Il dispose de deux lieux de vente. Le premier est le marché local d’akodessewa et le second c’est à la devanture de sa maison.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 100 tôles et 20 portes afin de satisfaire les commandes qu’il a reçu depuis plus d’une semaine.
texts.en:
Born on September 27, 1961 in Kini Kondji (Yoto Prefecture), Kokouda B. is married and the father of six children, who are all in school. He is a retailer of gates and sheet metal in the city of Lomé. He has two sales outlets. The first is in the local market of Akodessewa, and the second is in the front display of his house. He is requesting this initial loan to buy 100 pieces of sheet metal and 20 doors or gates in order to satisfy the orders he received over a week ago.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gates and sheet metal

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas M. (pictured with her husband and children), 62, and her husband, Mr. El M., 59, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have ten children; three sons and seven daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home, and two work in a garment factory.

Slamas has been selling fish for the past four months, buying from her neighbors and reselling on the other side of the Mekong River. Prior to this, she was a cake seller. Her husband has been a fisherman since he was young and also works in construction. Slamas is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase fishing materials such as nets and a boat motor to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Lucrecia Adelina

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Lucrecia S. C. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos su hija mayor tiene la edad de 10 años y cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria y un niño de 2 años no estudia, su compañero de vida labora es comerciante, sus propósitos son que su negocio se mantenga activo y en sus deseos esta el luchar por sus hijas para que tengan una casa y así obtengan un lugar donde vivir para que el día de mañana no pasen necesidades de vivienda y un futuro en los estudios.



El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años su actividad económica es la de venta de frutas y verduras en la que vende cosas como: tomate, piña, banano, naranjas y otros, inicia su negocio por cuenta propia a la edad de 21 años vendiendo ahí mismo en el Mercado la Estación y empieza con los productos como: tomate, cebolla, chiltoma y es mas tarde consigue la afluencia de clientes y decide invertir en el banano y otros, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la comprar de mas productos ya que necesita abastecerse de zanahoria, tomate, cebolla debido a la elaboración de las diferentes comidas que se realizan para estos días festivos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia S. C. is 28 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. Her daughter is 10 years old and currently in elementary school, while her son is 2 years old. Her partner is a storekeeper. She hopes that her business will stay active, and she is determined to struggle so that her children can have a house in which to live. She hopes they never lack anything, and wants to see them pursue their studies in the future.

She has had this business for 7 years. She sells fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, pineapples, bananas, oranges, and other produce. She started her business on her own at the age of 21, working right in the La Estación Market, selling tomatoes, onions and sweet peppers. She later managed to obtain a solid client-base, so she decided to invest in bananas and other produce. This loan will be used as work capital to purchase more produce because she needs to stock up on carrots, tomatoes and onions since people use these ingredients for special meals during the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu Darshan Dhari 32 years old and is a resident of Kritipur. Kritipur is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Anu lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ram Bhakta Darshan Dhari, is a driver and drives his taxi around Kathmandu valley. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and her younger son is in grade 6.

Mrs. Anu DharshanDhari is engaged in making candles. In Nepal candle-making work is one of the successful businesses because people are now facing 10 hours of electricity blackouts so the demand for candles is increasing rapidly. So Mrs. Anu is requesting Rs 30000 loan to buy raw materials for her candle-making work.

She uses her income to provide a better education for her children and she also fulfills the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her candle-making work

loans.name: I Nyoman Suanda

texts.id: Keadaan ekonomi yang semakin menyudutkan masyarakat ke arah yang semakin berat membuat setiap orang mau tidak mau harus lebih tekun dalam berusaha. Termasuk salah satunya I Nyoman Suanda yang sudah menekuni usaha membuat batu bata merah yang biasanya digunakan untuk membuat bangunan. Usaha yang sudah digelutinya puluhan tahun ini memang dulu hanya dengan modal pas-pasan. Tetapi sekarang melihat permintaan akan batu bata yang meningkat karena ramainya pembangunan di daerah sekitarnya maka Nyoman Suanda berniat meningkatkan kapasitas hasil batu bata yang diproduksinya. DINARI merespon kebutuhan modal Nyoman Suanda setelah melihat permohonan yang masuk ke DINARI dimana rencananya pinjaman sebesar Rp.4.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan dan pembayaran cicilan setiap bulan ini akan digunakan Nyoman Suanda untuk menambah modal baik untuk membeli bahan baku batu bata maupun untuk membayar karyawannya sebanyak 2 orang. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perbulannya mencapai Rp.2.000.000,- dimana harga dari batu bata per buahnya adalah Rp.400,- dan Nyoman Suanda mampu menjual batu bata sebanyak 5000 buah setiap bulannya. Dari usahanya ini, Nyoman Suanda mampu menghidupi istrinya yang hanya sebagai ibu rumah tangga serta mampu juga menyekolahkan ketiga anaknya di bangku SD.
texts.en:
An economic condition that corners people to the toughest direction forces people to work even harder. I Nyoman Suanda, who produces red bricks for construction, is one of them. He started his business tens of years ago with limited capital. Now because of the increase of demand from the growth of the surrounding areas, Nyoman wants to increase his red brick production capacity. DINARI responded to Nyoman Suanda’s capital need after reviewing the proposal. The proposal stated that the 4,000,000 IDR loan, paid in 12 monthly payments, will be used to purchase raw materials and to pay his two employees. His sales in each month is 2,000,000 IDR in which he can sell 5,000 bricks at the price of 400 IDR each. From this business Nyoman Suanda can support his wife and send his three children to elementary school.

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials and pay two employee

loans.name: Julia Marcelina

texts.es:
Ahora que es temporada de verano, Julia se dedica a vender por las noches caramelos como ambulante. Ya lleva dos años con este negocio. Antes se dedicaba a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, pero abandono este negocio por quedar embarazada. 

Cuando era más joven ofrecía el servicio de limpieza y de lavado de ropa, pero no quería estar lejos de sus hijos ni dejarlos solos, ya que no había quien los cuidara, por eso desde aquel tiempo busca siempre negocio que le permitan cuidar de su familia. Y esta necesidad aumentó desde que su última niña de dos años nación con un problema salió con un problema en sus piernas que no le permiten caminar correctamente.

En un futuro, cuando sus hijos estén más grandes, desearía abrir un puesto en el mercado. Por ahora, trabajaba lo que le permite las obligaciones de su casa. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como obrero en una empresa.

caramelos y rehabilitación de su hija
texts.en:
Now that it is summer (in South America), Julia dedicates her time to selling caramels. She has been doing this for two years. She used to sell anticuchos (small pieces of grilled, skewered meat popular in Peru) from her home, but quit doing that after she got pregnant. When she was younger she worked cleaning and washing clothes, but she didn’t want to leave her children alone and there was no one else to watch them, so she had to look for a job that would allow her to care for her family. This necessity increased when her 2-year-old daughter was born with a problem in her legs that prevents her from walking correctly. In the future, when her children are older, she would like to open a store in the market. For now, she works as much as her familial obligations allow. Luckily she has the help of her husband, who works as a laborer for a company. [She will use the loan for] purchasing caramels and to help with the therapy for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy caramels to sell

loans.name: Toni

texts.en:
Toni is a 51-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Toni has owned a vegetable shop for ten years. He sells all type of vegetables. Toni has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and expand his business. This is the first time that Toni has requested a loan.

Toni is special in his work because he is known in his region and clients like going to his shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Toni decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand his vegetable shop

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene sells ice fish in the Okoko market. She has been in the business for the past 15 years. Irene is 46 years old and married with seven children. Irene lives in Okoko and she is requesting the amount of N50,000 to purchase more ice fish to sell. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and to Kiva for the financial help rendered to her for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es:
El señor Enoc H. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se esfuerza grandemente para salir adelante ya que requiere de mucho apoyo para continuar llevando el mantenimiento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día debido a su gran necesidad en su actividad, ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la reparación de cercos y corral para el ganado y de esta manera proceder con la comercialización de estos animales brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto depende de él siendo su actividad ganadera el único sustento que posee.
texts.en:
Enoc H. raises cattle for a living in the municipality of El Sauce. He strives very hard to keep going every day as he needs a lot of financial support to maintain his household. As his livelihood depends so greatly on his business, he is now requesting another loan from Ceprodel in order to make improvements to his cattle pens and fences. This will allow him to get on selling his animals and offering his family a better quality of life, as they depend heavily on his cattle raising, being their sole means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle pen maintenance

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina S., a 67-year-old dressmaker, is married with 2 children lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta city. She started her dressmaking business with a small amount of capital, now she plans to expand to cater to her growing customer base. She wants her business to grow and prosper and thereby give her family a better life.

loans.use: Buy cloth for her dressmaking

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nasreen Arshad Masih Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji, the wife of A. M., has lived in the mid-size city of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is not educated, because her parents couldn’t afford her educational expenses. Her husband drives a donkey cart that transports fruits and vegetables from one place to another. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband, because his old cart has become rough and rotted with wear.

Nasreen baji is the leader of a group of five women from her locality. Parveen baji, Shakeela baji, and Saima baji each want a loan to buy donkey carts for loading. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy beads, colored thread and cloth for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha A. is a divorced mother of two daughters, who are currently in primary school. She is twenty-eight years old and lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. Martha is a baker.  She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community and also hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients in Kumasi. She has been in business for fourteen years and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk. Martha wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Danela

texts.en: Danela M. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 27 years old, is married to Julito M., and has three infant children. Danela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, primarily selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Danela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to improve her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., who is twenty-six years old, owns and operates a shop out of her home where she sells a variety of items. She sells cooking ingredients, soft drinks, and some beauty supplies to neighbors who live near her house. She usually generates an income of $5 a day, which helps with her family’s needs, especially feeding her three teenage children who are in school. Her husband stays at home to help conduct her business operations. Em is handling her investment very well. Recently, some of her inventory was exhausted, so she needs to restock.  She is requesting a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's field partners, to purchase soft drinks, sweets for kids, and beauty supplies.

loans.use: To restock soft drinks, sweets for kids, and beauty supplies

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani O. runs a food stall in a canteen selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Lani has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha N., aged 28, and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun Hean, aged 35, have been married since 2000 and have one son and one daughter. Chantha also has his parents living with him. The family lives in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chantha has been a construction worker for 10 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 15 years. Chantha doesn’t have his own transport, so is requesting his first loan of $600 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Dori

texts.en:
Dori E. is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to build charcoal store .  Dori is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land, build and rent it out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: build charcoal store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des outils de travail

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is fifty years old. She is a widow and mother of seven children. She has been the sole bread winner of the family ever since she lost her husband. She sells smoked fish and tomatoes in one of the neighborhood markets. Many homes enjoy her fish because it has a great flavor and the price is fair. She wants to use her loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fishes in bulk.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, though the inhabitants are into farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activity. 

Paulina is a trader. She trades in cosmetics in a shop in her community. Paulina has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to procure all kinds of cosmetics to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena C. es una persona muy esforzada que se ha dedicado por ocho años al negocio de venta de calzados centrando sus ventas en el calzado para damas ofreciéndolos en el mercado la Terminal donde diario los ofrece y es visitada por sus clientes.
La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para realizar un crédito para la compra de los calzados y de esta manera continuar comercializándolos y contribuir al desarrollo de su negocio y por ende de su familia en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena C. is a strong and hardworking person. For 8 years she has worked selling women's shoes from the Terminal Market, running her business and serving her customers every day. She is working with the organization Ceprodel so that she can purchase more shoes and continue to grow her business, and in turn help provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her business, and continue to increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARUJA tiene 53 años, es divorciada, es padre y madre para sus tres hijos. Milagros tiene 25 años y estudia obstetricia, Yashira tiene 19 años y estudia contabilidad y Xiomara tiene 19 años y estudia ciencias políticas. La socia es docente cesante y actualmente se dedica a la venta y distribución de cerveza. La socia acomodo una parte de la casa para abrir su tienda donde almacena y vende la cerveza. La socia nos cuenta que al principio le iba muy bien vendía 300 cajas por día pero por su barrio abrieron tiendas de venta de cerveza y le hacen la competencia. Actualmente bajo el negocio y vende aproximadamente 100 cajas por día lo cual nuestra socia opto por abrir otro negocio de venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que tiene de venta de cerveza y le ha ido más o menos, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza y así de esta forma aumentar el capital del negocio.  
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Cusco. Antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our group member MARUJA is 53 years old and divorced. She is father and mother to her three children. Milagros is 25 years old and studies obstetrics. Yashira is 19 years old and studies accounting. Xiomara is 19 years old and studies political science. The group member is an unemployed teacher and currently works selling and distributing beer. The group member fixed a part of the house to open her store where she stores and sells the beer. The group member tells us that at first it was going well and she sold 300 cases per day. But they opened stores that sell beer in her neighborhood so now there is competition. Currently business has declined and she sells 100 cases per day. This is why the group member opted to open another business selling clothes. It’s been various years since she’s been selling beer and it has more or less gone well, thanks to all her hard work that she puts into her job. Our group member is a working mother, an entrepreneur that is getting ahead with her family amidst life’s difficulties. The group member needs a loan to purchase more beer and this way increase the business capital. The group member belongs to the “FUENTE DE VIDA” Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco. In the past it was the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the Vice Royalty of Peru, declared a World Heritage and the archeological capital of America. The group member is thankful for the opportunity given this way and promises to meet the corresponding payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The group member needs the loan to purchase more beer and this way increase the business capital.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa tiene puesto fijo, es una socia antigua con Emprender, este ultimo credito lo invirtio para la compta D. arbolitos D. pino para poder vender en las fiestas D. navidad. Mientras que en otras temporadas ella se dedica a vender frutas desD. hace ya bastante tiempo. La socia ya esta con Emprender 3 secuencias donD. ha demostrado ser una buena socia, muy responsable en sus pagos,  ella vive en casa D. sus padres, tiene  una hija, ella es separada del esposa, por lo tanto ella mantiene a su hija.
texts.en:
Nicolasa has a steady job and is a long-standing Emprender client. She used this last loan to buy Christmas trees to sell during the Christmas season. The rest of the time she is a fruit seller. She has been with Emprender for three cycles now and has proven to be a good member, very responsible with her repayments. She lives in her parents' home and is a single mother of one daughter, whom she supports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas trees.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es: María Elizabeth P. G. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo, quien es empleado de una empresa constructora, y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Residen en el municipio de San Martín, en el departamento de San Salvador. María posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos comestibles, detergentes, y todo lo relacionado con productos de primera necesidad, los cuales como su nombre lo indica son imprescindibles en los hogares. Desde hace varios años atrás ella ha trabajado mucho por mantener a flote su negocio, ya que es a través de este como junto a su compañero de vida logran solventar muchos gastos familiares. Es por esta razón por la cual María, solicita un préstamo, y de esta manera surtir la tienda, comprando mayor cantidad de productos que ya posee, y así mismo adquirir nuevos, tales como: hilos, cintas adhesivas, desinfectantes y otros productos más.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth P. G., 42, lives with her husband, who works in construction, and their three minor children, in the town of San Martín, San Salvador department. María has a small grocery store in which she sells food items, detergents, and everything you need to meet basic household needs; items that are indispensable in any home. She has worked for several years now trying to keep her business afloat since it is through it that she and her life partner strive to meet many of the family's expenses. For this reason, María is requesting a loan in order to stock her store. She will buy larger quantities of the items she already stocks and add some new ones like: thread, adhesive tape, disinfectants and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
Andrea P. de 20 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo tiene luz como servicio básico, su esposo es chofer de un taxi con el tiene 1 hijo de 4 años.

Ella comenzó desde muy pequeña ayudar a su mama en la tienda que ella tenía, cuando creció quiso tener su propio negocio y empezó vendiendo artículos de bazar.   

Ahora Andrea trabaja desde las 07h30 atendiendo la pequeña papelería que tiene vendiendo cuadernos, lápices, zapatos, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es que su negocio no es muy visible para los clientes.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos, cuadernos, ropa para temporada playera todo para su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener artículos para hogar.
texts.en:
Andrea P. is 20 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and receives electricity as its only basic service. Her husband is a taxi driver, and together, they have a child who is now four years old.

As a little girl, Andrea helped her mother in the store that she managed. When she got older, she wanted to have her own business and started selling merchandise at a bazaar.

Today Andrea begins work at 7:30am at her small stationery store where she sells notebooks, pencils, shoes, and other items. One of the drawbacks that she has to deal with is that her business is not very visible to her customers.

With this loan, Andrea will buy shoes, notebooks, and seasonal beach clothing for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and acquire products for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing, notebooks, and shoes

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Arturo P. I. se dedica al negocio de tapiceria el cual opera bajo el nombre de "DISEÑOS" el tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad ya que antes de tener su propio local el pudo aprender algo sobre este tipo de trabajo.
Y ahora con la experiencia que el maneja desde hace 14 años a podido tener una buena clientela por la calidad, elaboracion y diseños de sus manualidades.- 
su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí. 
Don Luis tiene 2 hijos a los cuales les a brindado todo el apoyo en sus estudios y en sus deberes. El Sr. I. trabaja arduamente dia a dia para poder generar mayores ingresos y asi poder mejorar su condicion de vida y la de sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Arturo P. I. manages an upholstery business that operates under the name “Diseños” (Designs). He has plenty of experience in this type of activity. Luis was able to learn about upholstery prior to having his own shop.

His business has been operation for 14 years. Luis has built up a good clientele because of the quality, craftsmanship, and design of his work. His shop is located in the neighborhood of Pueblo Nuevo in the City of Danlí.

Don Luis has two children to whom he extends his support for their studies and other activities. He works extremely hard each day to generate more income so that he can improve the living conditions for himself and his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, sponges, glue, springs, tacks, nails, and leather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for business.

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en: Aminat sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Sarongs are worn mostly by women and young ladies in Nigeria. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells motor spare parts. She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Thelma Janneth

texts.es: La Sra. N. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y venta de cosméticos donde tiene ocho años de dedicarse  a este oficio lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos como madre soltera. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos, este último para la instalación de un kiosko donde ofertará productos básicos para el hogar como una nueva opción para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. N. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y venta de cosméticos donde tiene ocho años de dedicarse a este oficio lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos como madre soltera. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos, este último para la instalación de un kiosko donde ofertará productos básicos para el hogar como una nueva opción para generar ingresos para su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosas, cosméticos y golosinas

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and onions at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock groundnut paste to sell.  Margret is 19 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot, build and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock groundnut paste to sell.

loans.name: Sodik

texts.ru: Шакиров Содик проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, "Экономист". Более 10 лет работал по профессии. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он в основном продает строительные материалы. В торговле ему помогает сын. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sodik S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a higher education as an economist. Sodik spent over 10 years working in that profession. Now he is involved in retail sales. He has a store, where he primarily sells construction materials. His son helps him with the sales. Sodik has been involved in this business for 15 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Johana Mercedes

texts.es: Johana tiene 30 años de edad. Tiene 1 hijo  y vive con ella y le ayuda en lo que puede con su negocio. Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería en general. El negocio se encuentra de forma ambulante, por lo que todos los días sale a vender los diferentes productos que tiene. Ella realiza su actividad por pedidos y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece su negocio cada vez está creciendo más, sus pedidos están aumentando y esto ha hecho que piense en ampliar. Johana es una mujer emprendedora y que toda su vida ha velado por el bienestar de los suyos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
30-year old Johana has one son who lives with her and helps with the business in whatever way he can. Johana sells general merchandise--every day she goes into the streets to sell whatever products she has.
