She takes orders, and because of the quality of her products, her business is continually growing and the number of orders increasing. This has made her think of expanding the business. Johana is an enterprising woman, and throughout her life she has watched out for her family. The loan she is asking for is to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. O. is married and has three children. She has a junior high education.  Grace E. cooks banku with two different kinds of soup such as okro and palmnut soup as well rice for sale at Abura.  Her husband is a chef.  Grace E. uses her income to help her husband to take care of her family.  Grace will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new revenue from her extended business, Grace E. plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 23 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 34 años y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor futuro. Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante su sembra, desde entonces se levanta todas las mañana para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivo de papa y alverja, para ser comercializadas en su totalidad en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayoría de sus tierras para el sembrado de alverja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Angélica is 23 years old and a loving cheerful mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Julio, age 34, and their two small children for whom she wants to provide a better future. Angélica and her husband work hard to succeed at farming. They wake up early every morning to water and care for their crop of potatoes and peas. Their entire harvest is sold in the city of Tarma, which is where they get the best prices for their products. What she likes most about her work is the freedom to move about her fields. She has been farming for six years and considers the most difficult part to be working the land. Over time she hopes to appropriate more land for growing peas since this crop has been selling well lately.

This is her second loan with MFP. Angélica knows that this loan will help her advance and develop her business, so she is determined to complete her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her Communal Bank, which explains why she is greatly admired. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria E. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: Food Vending and Video Rental businesses. She lives in Kapusu-an, Poblacion, Sibonga, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Food Vending and Video Rental businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7000. 

Victoria is now borrowing PHP 16000 to add to her business capital.  This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Victoria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

In the accompanying picture Victoria had already sold all of the food she prepared to sell for the day!

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her food sales and video rental business

loans.name: Falila

texts.fr: K. falila exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait ce commerce depuis  3 ans déjà.  elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de gagner une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un premier crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé.  ce deuxième prêt qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de s'approvisionner avec 18 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise. elle est mariée et elle a 2 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
K. Falila has a revenue-generating business involving charcoal. She has been in this business for three years already. She gets her supplies from the country's interior, and this enables her to earn a bigger profit margin on her sales. Falila has already had an initial loan from WAGES that she repaid. This second loan she is requesting is going to allow her to stock up with 18 sacks of charcoal and to ensure the transport of the merchandise. Falila is married and has two people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza I. is 45 years old and married with four children. From the time Firuza was married, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle as well as breeding sheep. She canvases farms and several settlements in order to find and buy cattle at the lowest price. Her monthly income is about 200-250 AZN.

Firuza currently has three cows and one calf to fatten and sell. She has applied for a loan of 800 AZN to buy more calves and sheep.

loans.use: To buy more calves and sheep

loans.name: Dzyunik

texts.en: Dzyunik A. lives in Tskhuk village in the Syunik region of Armenia. Dzyunik and her husband are farmers. To increase her family income and prepare for the upcoming winter, Dzyunik has applied for a loan to fund the purchase of some cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. is a farmer from Murang'a in central Kenya. Joseph is 44 years old and married with two children ages 5 and 10. Both children attend school.  He has been farming for the last 15 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces coffee, which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family. 

Joseph has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to start poultry farming. He says that this project will increase his sources of income, which  will enable him pay school fees for his children without straining. He hopes to expand his poultry farming in the future and benefit from the increased production of eggs and chicken manure.

Joseph is happy that Juhudi exists because it cares for the low income earners and he believes with Juhudi loans he will improve his quality of life for his family and himself.

loans.use: To start poultry farming.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria de 41 años de edad es soltera, trabaja para como Auxiliar de Enfermeria en el Hospital Asuncion desde hace varios años. Es madre soltera de 2 hijos: el mayor de nombre Oscar que estudia en la universidad y trabaja y le apoya a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y Yubelki de 11 años en primaria.

 Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de construir un porche en su casa, ya que su casita fue construida por medio de un proyecto con Caritas y con las lluvias se le moja la pared de enfrente y desea protegerla con esta construccion para que tenga mas vida util.

 Candelaria expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC y Kiva ya que con el credito anterior logro terminar su sueño de tener su casa propia, ya que logro instalar los servicios basicos (agua y luz) y construir su cocina para poder habitar su casita junto a sus hijos. Sin embargo, aun le falta acondicionarla, pero espera poco a poco hacerlo con el apoyo de AFODENIC y Kiva.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 41 years old, single, and has been working as a nursing assistant in Asunción Hospital for several years.  She is a single mother of 2 children: the eldest, Oscar, attends college and works, and he also supports his mother with household expenses, Yubelki, is 11 years old and in elementary school.

Candelaria is requesting her seventh loan with the goal of building a porch in her home.  Her house was built by a project with Caritas but the rain has wet the front wall, so she wants to protect her house with a porch to prolong its lifespan.

Candelaria is very grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva since her previous loan allowed her to complete her dream of having her own home.  She was able to install basic services (water and electricity), build her own kitchen, and live in her own house with her children.  Even though the house lacks protection, she hopes to gradually accomplish this with the help of AFODENIC and Kiva.

loans.use: Build a porch.

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
María Emilia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Reside junto a su familia en el sector Barsallo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza. 

Se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón en el mercado Moshoqueque. Ella adquiere el producto de los diversos pobladores de la zona y los ofrece en venta a las personas que requieren este producto como comerciantes y dueños de restaurantes. El negocio funciona en base a pedidos y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Ella desea contar con más capital para poder adquirir más mercadería y de ese modo satisfacer los pedidos con los que aún cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

María es una mujer responsable y que siempre busca el desarrollo de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María Emilia is 38 years old, single, and does not have any children to support. She resides with her family in the Barsallo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of the most populated districts in the region with high rates of poverty.

María buys and sells charcoal at the Moshoqueque Market. She acquires her products from different villagers in the area and then sells them to people who want to buy them, such as merchants and restaurant owners. Her business is based on the orders she receives and the income she generates enables her to assist her husband with covering the family expenses.

María wants to have additional capital so that she can acquire more inventory and fulfill the orders she has already received. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can keep up with customer demand.

María is a responsible woman who is always looking after the development of her family. The people who know María have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal so that she can fulfill her orders

loans.name: Cevigna Estela

texts.es:
Cevigna es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Olmos, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y sandalias en un puesto ubicado en el mercado D. su distrito. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida y con demanda permanente ya que su distrito está conformado por varios caseríos cuyos pobladores se dirigen semanalmente al pueblo central para adquirir diversos productos. Los ingresos que obtiene D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

Cevigna desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas prendas D. vestir para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y conocida en la zona, las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Cevigna is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells clothing and sandals in a stand located in her district's market. Her business has received a good reception and permanent demand because her district is maD. up for various villages whose residents arrive weekly to the central village to purchase various products. The income that she makes from this activity is used to help her husband and to cover her family's expenses. 

Cevigna wishes to expand her business by purchasing more clothing and increase her sales. For this reason she has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles. 

She is a very peaceful woman, known in the area by those who know her as a responsible and reliable person.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es una persona muy joven él vive solo en la  comunidad de tipa monte  provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba, Jaime  con  30 años de edad   desde muy pequeño por la pobreza y  abandono de sus padres empezó a trabajar en la agricultura con sus vecinos en el  lugar donde vive  ahí fue aprendiendo a cultivar papa  zanahoria y frejol  en el tiempo que creció.

En el lugar donde vive solo cosechan dos  veces al año con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando el desea invertir más en sus cultivos comprando mas abono orgánico y semillas para recuperar algo de lo perdido de su anterior  cosecha y de esa manera mejorar su  calidad de vida
texts.en:
Jaime is a very young person.  He lives alone in the community of Tipa Monte, in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  Jaime is 30 years old.  From a very early age, because of poverty and the abandonment of his parents, he started to work in farming with the neighbors in his community.  He learned how to grow potatoes, carrots and beans while he was growing up.

Where Jaime lives, they only harvest twice a year.  With his hard work and the loan he is requesting, he would like to invest more in his crops, buying more organic fertilizer and seeds to recover something of what he lost in his last harvest and thereby improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal Las Perlas de Manantay, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad.  Su esposo se desempeña como  empleado de una compañía.
La señora Juana tiene una vulcanizadora (centro de reparación de motocicletas) en su casa, negocio que viene implementando poco a poco,  también está  generando  trabajo a otras personas, trabaja junto a ella un joven a quien le paga los fines de semana.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles, comprará una plancha para el parchado, una comprensora, alicates, un paquete de llaves, una caja de parches,  un kilo de grasa, un desarmador grande, ½ docena de cámaras, y rodajes.
La señora Juana se ha trazado una meta, el de tener un autoservicio muy bien implementado, para poder darles estudios a sus hijos sin que nada les falte. Gracias a Manuela Ramos podrá alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Las Perlas de Manantay (Pearls of Manantay) communal bank in Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married and has three minor children.  Her husband is an employee of a firm.

Juana has a motorcycle repair shop in her home, a business she has been equipping little by little.  She is also generating work for other people; she employs a young man that works alongside her that she pays each weekend.

She will use this new 1500 sol loan to buy a patching iron, a compressor, pliers, a set of wrenches, a box of patches, a kilo of grease, a large screwdriver, half a dozen inner tubes and gears.

Juana has set a goal for herself: to have a very well equipped vehicle repair shop in order to provide schooling and everything else they may need for her children.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she will be able to reach her dreams.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts and other supplies.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 44 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 10 años expende comida a clientes fijos, que trabajan en diversos puntos de su ciudad, es entonces que todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para preparar los diversos platillos que le piden sus comensales.  Su buen gusto por la comida, le ha dado mucha ventaja, ya que así ha logrado ganar más clientes que requieren de su servicio, esto ha hecho que mejore sus ganancias. Disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite disponer de sus horarios, ahora su prioridad es lograr tener un restaurante. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles al por mayor que son los ingredientes que necesita para prepara sus platillos.
texts.en: Sara is 44 years old. She lives with her 3 children and her husband in a rental home. For over 10 years she has sold food to regular customers who work in different parts of the city. For this she wakes up very early every morning to prepare the various dishes ordered by her guests. Her good taste in food has helped her in many ways. It has allowed her to win more clients who need her services, and so improving her profits. She enjoys her work because it allows her to make her own schedule. Now her priority is to be able to get a restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She thanks those people who will become the agents of the loan she is requesting. The loan will very much help the progress of her economic activity. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of wholesale non-perishable food items. These are the ingredients she needs to make her dishes.

loans.use:
Comprar productos no perecibles.
Buy non-perishable products

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Producing Khmer noodles is part of 41-year-old Len S.’s daily routine. It is one snack food that is a necessary, vital product to people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she has been very widely known in this sector since before she was married. 

Her husband is skilled in making wooden furniture by hand in the village. Len S. is blessed with four children who live together in the family home. One of her daughters is married and currently lives in her new house. 

The core profit of Len S.’s house depends on her husband's jobs, and now he wants to add more capital as funds for expanding his business by purchasing some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling to people who need to repair and decorate their house. Because of this reason, Len S. has requested a loan to add to her personal money for her husband to buy some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is from the village of Imelda Labason Zamboanga Del norte. She is 49 years old. Melda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Melda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beef products in the local community. Melda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Melda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Doña Bertha M. V. es trabajadora de Una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el puesto de Analista de Cobranza desde hace 8 años.

Es casada, de 32 años de edad, tiene 2 personas que dependen de ella, y los dos son menores de edad y vive en la ciudad de Carazo en el Municipio de Jinotepe, desde hace 1 años.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción, para construir un baño, agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle brindado este crédito, ya que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha M. Velasquez is an employee of a company named Aqueducts and Sewers and she has worked as an accounts receivable analyst for the past 8 years. 

She is married, 32 years old, and she has 2 individuals who depend on her, both of whom are minors. She has lived in the city of Carazo in the municipality of Jinotepe for the past year. 

This is the first time she accesses a loan through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). She requests the loan to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. She is thankful to Ceprodel for having granted her this loan because it will help her improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to put in a bathroom.

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: K. K. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire M., âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous, sauf le cadet. Son mari est un chauffeur taximan. La cliente  K. K. est  vendeuse des bananes, huile de palme, etc. Elle s’installe à son domicile devant sa porte. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs des charbons, 1 bidon d’huile de palme, 1 bidon d’huile Rina.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, vêtir et scolariser ses enfants confortablement. La cliente K. K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe M. est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en:
K. K. is an entrepreneur, and president of the M. business group, which consists of 35 members. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of six children who all attend school except for the youngest. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

K. K. sells bananas, palm oil, etc. in front of her home. She started her business four years ago with her own capital received from her husband. She will use her new loan to buy two bags of charcoal, one can of palm oil, and one can of Rina oil. She plans to expand her business, clothe her children, and provide them with an education. 

K. K. wishes to thank Hekima for their assistance to underprivileged women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of charcoal, a can of palm oil, and a can of Rina oil

loans.name: Fidia Feliciano

texts.es: El Sr. Fidia Feliciano A.  es trabajador  activo de una entidad estatal  desempeñándose como Maestro de Educación Secundaria  tiene Veinte años  de trabajar para esta institución  es Acompañado actualmente, tiene un hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Fidia Feliciano A. is employed as a Secondary School Teacher at a state school.  He has been working for this institution for 20 years.  He has a life partner and a school age child.  

He has had two CEPRODEL loans that have been used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve his house.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him because they have made it possible for him to improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Florida is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Florida is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her small business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is 61 years old and her husband, Nolasco, is also 61. The couple has been farming for 40 years now. Nolasco also drives for a living. They have six children who have finished their college education. Esmeralda helps her husband earn a living by managing a variety store, which is adjacent to their house. They live together in the breezy town of Silang, Cavite.
When they are in season, Esmeralda trades bananas, pineapples and other crops from their farm in the nearby market. But while waiting for the harvest to come in, she attends to her general store (as shown in the picture). Monthly, she earns an estimated income of around 12,000 PHP. Esmeralda is proud to declare that her children finished college out of the couple's earnings. She was also able to purchase a jeepney, which they are now using to deliver fruits and other crops to the market.
To help her continue operation of her business, Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional grocery items for her store. She will use part of this loan to fund the next cropping of their pineapple farm. Esmeralda believes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her earning capacity as a microentrepreneur.
Esmeralda wishes to become wealthier so she can help her poor neighbors and relatives. Her usual prayers include good health and harmonious relationships amongst her children. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store and fund the next cropping of pineapples

loans.name: Vitalio

texts.es: El Sr. Vitalio se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de salchipapas desde hace dos años trabaja conjuntamente su esposa, el puesto de venta esta ubicado en la localidad de llaukenquiri, trabaja desde horas de la tarde hasta casi media noche, actualmente vive con su esposa en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros, con el dinero del crédito desean ampliar el negocio comprando una cocina mas grande  para la  elaboracion de salchipapaps y comprar material para construcción para mejorar su domicilio ya que están haciendo arreglar la habitación donde viven, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Vitalio has had a business making salchipapas (a Bolivian dish featuring sausages and fried potatoes) for 2 years.  He works together with his wife in a sales stall that is located in the town of Llaukenquiri.  He works from the afternoon until almost midnight.  He currently lives with his wife in a home owned by his in-laws.  With the money from the loan he wants to expand his business by buying a bigger stove to make his salchipapas, and also buy construction materials to make improvements to his home, since they are doing repairs to the house where they live.  He is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make salchipapas and to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS”  lo conforman  08  socias, una D. ellas es Bella María D. 44 años  el negocio que ella tiene es una bodega Bazar donD. ofrece toda clase D. productos a su clientela, ya tiene con su negocio 20 años y es una D. las bodegas mas frecuentadas del barrio donD. vive, ella recuerda sus inicios cuando en un lugar reducido y con muy pocas cosas por ofrecer  empezó  con su  pequeña bodega a pesar D. la competencia y  algunos desafíos logro seguir adelante hasta convertirse en una bodega granD. y surtida, esto le permitió  ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y apoyar a su esposo en la construcción D. su casa, su préstamo le servirá para  comprar productos D. belleza como perfumería y cosméticos acaba D. comprar una vitrina y quiere llenarla D. estos productos, esto le permite tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, a la vez que le genera mas ganancias, Bella María  es la secretaria del grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS” 

   * La Sra Bella Maria eta sentada en la mesa con blusa verD..
texts.en:
The group called “MADRES LADEREÑAS is maD. up of eight members.  One of them is 44 year old Bella María who has a store where she offers all types of products to her customers.  She’s had this business for 20 years and it’s one of the most frequented stores in her neighborhood.  She remembers when she started with just a few items and began despite the competition and challenges, but continued to move ahead until she was able to build a large and well stocked and assorted store.  This allowed her to help her children with their studies and help her husband build their house.  She will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products and cosmetics.  She recently bought a display case and wants to fill it with these items.  This will allow her to have a variety of items to offer her customers, and increase her income.  Bella María serves as the “MADRES LADEREÑAS” group secretary.

*  Bella María is seated at the table and is wearing a green blouse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her store

loans.name: Gladys Luisa

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un dependiente que está a su cuidado. Ella  vive en la zona D. la Chimba D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba. Gladys es una persona muy trabajadora, con su propio sacrificio tiene su propia casa, ella trabaja atendiendo una tienda D. barrio D. lunes a domingo sin descansar un solo día. Gladys pudo comprarse un Lote D. terreno ubicado a más D. 30 Km D. la ciudad pensando en su futuro para que tenga un lugar donD.  pasar tranquilamente su vejez.

Gladys necesita el préstamo para regularizar los papeles D. su lote D. terreno agricola y así comience a sembrar y  cultive su propio alimento. Ella está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio D. Kiva le pueD. dar la oportunidad D. hacer realidad su sueño.

Gladys entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre semilla y abono para el cultivo D. sus plantas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 57 years old, married, and has one dependent in her care.  She lives in Chimba neighborhood, in the city of Cochabamba.  Gladys is a very hard-working person who, through her own sacrifice, owns her own home.  She works in a neighborhood store from Monday to Sunday without resting for a single day.  With her future in mind, Gladys was able to buy a plot of land more than 30km from the city so that she would have a place where she could peacefully live out her old age.

Gladys needs this loan to put in order the legal papers relating to her plot of farmland so that she can start sowing crops and growing her own food.  She is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, will give her the opportunity to make her dream come true.

Gladys plans, in the future, to take out a further loan to buy seeds and manure for growing her plants.

loans.use: to pay to put the legal papers relating to her farmland in order

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
This is Clarita.  She is 50 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a retired electrician, and is mother to their 3 children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clarita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Clarita earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her business, Clarita is requesting a loan for Php 15,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Clarita’s dream is to be able to grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more inventory

loans.name: St. Noah Development Group

texts.en: Scolastic, 34 and living with her husband in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is very hardworking, charged as she is with the responsibility of looking after her five children whom she longs to see educated and self-sustaining. Scolastic has been selling fish for one year and is requesting a loan to buy more fish for resale.  Her dream is to buy a car for the transportation of her fish.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Mashohida

texts.en:
Mashohida is a hard-working woman who is engaged in processing fruit. Her family helps in this business. She sells her dried fruit in Khujand region and the neighboring region. In the season she purchases fresh fruit, about 4500-5000 kg, and after processing she gets 1000-1300kg dried fruit and 500 kg "ossicle". Mashohida would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots to process.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip, married and a mother of two daughters and two sons. Huda's husband (who is photographed here, as she is a conservative woman) owns an advertising agency. Huda took out a $1,000 loan as her husband is in need of a printer and fax machine. Huda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He opened the advertising agency to have a better income to support his family. Huda helps her husband manage the agency when he is away from the office.

loans.use: to buy a printer and fax machine

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 13 juin 2008. Le groupe est  constitué de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Agathe qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de restaurant. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 13 juin 2008. Le groupe est  constitué de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Agathe qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de restaurant. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.

loans.use: ACHETER DES PRODUITS POUR PREPARER LES REPAS QU ELLE VEND

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 57 years old and a widower. He has three children. Orlando is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn crops to sell. Orlando works hard to improve his business and support his children. 

He applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Orlando hopes to own and manage a bigger farm area in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El Señor Bernardino, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 6 hijos, una trabaja como niñera, otra ya esta casada y vive en la ciudad de Pedro Juan Caballero, otro estudia todavía y otro trabaja con él en la Olería. El señor trabaja en una Olería hace más de 10 años.
Él se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, ya que de a poco ha logrado ir creciendo pese a los contratiempos que han surgido. Uno de sus suenos es que todos sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien, con una profesión digna y decorosa. En cuanto a su trabajo, le gustaría poder tener un taller más amplio con lo cual podré atender a más clientes, y de esa forma generar más ingresos para su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Esta muy esperanzado en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Bernardino, aged, 48, is married and lives in the city of Concepción.  He has six children; one daughter works as a childminder; another daughter is married and lives in the city of Pedro Juan Caballero; one of his sons is still a student, and another works with him in his brick-making operation.  The Señor has been working in a brick-making operation for more than ten years.

He describes himself as a very hard-working and striving man, as he has slowly been able to grow in spite of the setbacks that have arisen.  One of his dreams is for all his children to grow into good people., with a dignified and decent profession.  As for his work, he would like to be able to have a bigger workshop with which he could serve more customers, and in this way earn more income for his family.

He is asking for the loan to buy raw materials for making bricks.  He is very hopeful about the loan, as obtaining it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Bat

texts.en:
Mr. Bat is 30 years-old.  He is a taxi driver who lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last April, he bought a new car for his business from another loan and he repaid it successfully and on time. He had been paying MNT37,700 everyday to the lender and now he has been saving this amount of money everyday due to having finished that loan.

Recently, he purchased a small sized piece of land in a suburb and he must build a timber fence there.  Therefore, he requested a loan to purchase some timbers to build a fence for his land. Currently, this family lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent.  They plan to build a house on their land after the fence is built.

loans.use: to purchase some timber to build a fence for his land.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old and married to Margaret, and they are blessed with one child.  He is a livestock trader in the busy market of Bissil Kajiando, Kenya where he sells livestock to butchers and supplies to KMC. He has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 30,000 per month.



David was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.He has got a good credit history in KADET and he is applying for his third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more livestock. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his child and boost his business.


He hopes to establish a dairy farm and be selling milk and meat at Kajiando, Kitengela and Isinya markets. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has three children.  She is 49 years old and lives in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

To earn a living, Jocelyn sells canned goods and other daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, softdrinks, etc.  She has had this business for 1 year.  Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP from this type of work. Jocelyn has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase soap, shampoo, toothpaste, softdrinks and other products for her store.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy daily use products to sell

loans.name: Omena Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Omena Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eunice is the facilitator of the Omena Group. She takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eunice will invest in animal rearing and ensure food security.
In 2012, the members of Omena Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
Eunice is pictured together with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gleiny Luz

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Gliny compró ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, calzado, fantasia y productos naturales, con los que le fue muy bien y ganó dinero. En la actualidad planea su segundo credikiva para comprar mercancia variada en mayor volumen, pues se prepara para la alta temporada de Diciembre y planea complacer a sus clintes y vender mucho para aumentar sus utilidades. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Es un gran apoyo financiero, estoy muy agradecida y espero seguir contando con Kiva y con la Fundación, para continuar incrmentando mis ventas y utilidades. "
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Gleiny bought clothes, cosmetics, perfume, footwear, novelty items, and natural products, which went well for her and she earned money.  Currently, with her second Kiva loan, she is planning to buy large quantities of a variety of merchandise, since she is preparing for the high December season and she plans to please her customers and sell a lot to increase her profits.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "It's a great financial help.  I'm very grateful and I hope to continue counting on Kiva and the Fundación to continue increasing my sales and profits."

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Benigno Julio

texts.es:
Julio pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco. 

Julio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Julio es la reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde brinda sus servicios de reparar computadoras. Desde hace 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Julio requiere el préstamo para comprar más repuestos como cables, lectores, memorias, microprocesadores, mouses, teclados otras cosas más. 

Julio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Julio belongs to the communal bank “Qorichaska del Cusco” and the members meet every 30 days in the city of Cusco in the province of Cusco.

Julio is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. He was born in the city of Cusco and he lives and does business in the same city he was born in. His main economic activity is the repair and maintenance of computers. He has a small workshop in his house where he offers repair services. He has been doing this work for 12 years and he is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

This time Julio needs a loan to buy spare parts such as cables, monitors, memories, microprocessors, mouses, keyboards and a few other things.

Julio is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy more replacements such as cables, monitors, microprocessors, mouses, keyboards and a few other things.

loans.name: Mabadiliko Group

texts.en:
Rexnald is the facilitator of the Mabadiliko group. Rexnald and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rexnald takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed his family and to have additional maize profit to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Rexnald had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Rexnald was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rexnald and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Rexnald will pay school fees for his children, loans and bills.

In 2012, the members of Mabadiliko group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Rexnald and his group members are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep in larger quantities. He will raise them and will sell them at a profit to local butchers. He also has a buffalo and earns additional income for the family by selling its milk.
 
Nasreen is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profit. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. In her spare time, she provides support to her husband in his livestock business. She provides the animals with food and cleans their living space.

She has given birth to seven children. One of them is enrolled in school and two are working to contribute to the family financially.

Nasreen has a lot of confidence in her husband and his business, and she is certain that after this loan investment, her husband’s business will grow and enable her family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 21 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has a two-month-old child. 

For the past five years she has been selling body cream and groundnuts in the market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers.
 
She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream and groundnuts for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream and groundnuts for her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Beatriz has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Beatriz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Beatriz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has two children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Angelina is a farmer who grows coconut trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for their coconut trees.
  
Angelina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Angelina hopes to expand her farm and continuously support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for their coconut trees.

loans.name: Venise

texts.en:
Venise, 23 years of age, is married and has two children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  Venise needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase ingredients to produce more goods. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 WST or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Venise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Venise's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to produce more goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia una mujer soltera de 35 años que sola ha podido salir adelante, trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para ir construyendo su patrimonio. Hace unos años adquirió su vivienda de interés social a la cual ha estado haciendo mejoras para acondicionarla a su gusto. En este momento quiere un préstamo para terminar de colocar el vitropiso por toda la casa por lo que necesita comprar el material, pegamento y pagar la mano de obra. Esto con el fin de ir mejorando su calidad de vida y utilizar su dinero en cosas que realmente son necesarias. Ella quiere formar su propia familia por tal motivo quiere ir preparando su casa para ofrecer un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en: Cecilia, 35, is single and has been able to get ahead on her own.  She has worked hard to own property.  A few years ago she bought a subsidized house which she has been remodeling to suit her taste.  Now she is requesting a loan to finish installing glazed floor tile throughout the house, so she needs to buy the material and glue, and hire workers for the job.  Her idea is to improve her lifestyle and use the money for things that are really necessary.  She would like to form her own family and wants to prepare her house so she has better assets to offer.

loans.use: To buy glazed tile and glue, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Chimusana Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Nelson from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. He is married with three children, two attending school.  Nelson runs a retail business selling clothes and blankets. The business has been in operation for 8 years. He says the main challenges faced are competition in the market. 

Nelson has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes and blankets for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to feed his family well. In the future Nelson is planning to own a shop and employ at least one person.

loans.use: To buy clothes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 30 years old. She is Married and has one child, age 5. Many years ago, she established her cow milk selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for there milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.
  
In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mercy, a 25-year-old farmer from Lolkeringet village in North Rift Valley region of Kenya. She resides with her 28-year-old husband, and they are blessed with two toddlers. Mercy has been actively involved in farming for the last four years. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at a local town. 

She enjoys practicing dairy farming most of all. However, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital to expand her small business. To solve this problem, Mercy is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow.

The dairy cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits. She believes the pasture she gives to her cow provides great-tasting dairy products that are more nutritious and flavourful than those processed and sold at shops. She will also be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. 

She is going to use the extra income to pay for the rising family expenses and also to grow her asset base in order to lead a financially secure life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rukiah

texts.en:
Rukia is a 45-year-old business lady from Busia, Kenya. She is a mother of seven, but her spouse passed away a long time ago.

For the last twenty-two years, she has been selling food in the area and that has kept her family going.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her poultry.

With the anticipated profits, Rukia will be able to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en: Roshan  is 57 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers

loans.name: Aferin

texts.en:
This woman supports to her family alone because she is widow. She is 41, has 5 children, widow . She began to sell the carpets 14 years ago. In the beginning in her business she borrowed $400 to buy 2 carpets. The second time she borrowed the loan 800$ and bought 20 Turkish carpets.
Now she needs a loan $1500 to open the own shop in the (trade) fair.
She is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Jamilli village. Aferin and her 5 children settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town.

loans.use: To open her own shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
My name is Gloria and I have dedicated myself to selling fresh seasonal fruits. I run my business in front of my house, and I also sell churros, drinks and candy. With this new income I can help my husband with family expenses, support my children's education and tend to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Gloria y me dedico a la venta de frutas de temporada, mi negocio esta frente a mi casa, tambien vendo churros, refrescos, dulces. Con los ingresos que percibo puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la familia, tambien apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios y me tiempo para poder atender mi casa.

loans.use: Buy fresh seasonal fruit, candy, churros, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 25-year-old man who has a small welding shop in Kirkuk. This is his first loan from AL-Aman, and he has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new welding machine. He lives with his family and is responsible for them. He will be married in the next couple of months.

This man is very active. He works 12-hour days. With the loan, he is looking to increase his income and buy more assets for the shop.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new welding machine

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona Aguillera D. G. loves in the "Centro" neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. She is 53 years old and married to Mr. Leoncio G.. They have 5 children, of which two are teachers who help their parents with the household expenses. Her husband is a bricklayer (housing construction), and he too helps out in the restaurant. At this moment, only one of her children lives at home, the rest have formed their own families and lives on themselves.

After getting married, many years ago, Ramona moved from a small village to the city to look for better job opportunities. In the beginning, life was difficult, but when time passed, the young couple was able to save some money and buy some land to build their own house, where they currently live.

In order to increase their income, they started selling "panchos" (hot dogs) and soft drinks on the sidewalk of their home. Later, with the profits, they were able to build a small booth and nowadays they have a well equipped restaurant where more than 20 persons come to eat every day.

Ramona tells us proudly that everything they have achieved, they have done honestly. She wants to continue expanding her business, and therefore she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to sell, like soft drinks, juices, candies, and beer, as this is what is most in demand by her customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra Ramona A. D. G. resiD. en el barrio Centro D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa, la misma tiene 53 años está casada con el sr Leoncio G. tienen 5 hijos D. los cuales 2 son docentes y ayudan a sus padres con los gastos D. la casa; su esposo se dedica a la albañilería (construcción D. casas) y también ayuda en el comedor con su apoyo. Actualmente sólo uno D. sus hijos vive con ella, ya que todos han formado sus familias y tienen ya sus casas propias.

Varios años atrás y luego D. casarse, Ramona, emigro D. un pueblo pequeño hasta la ciudad, en busca D. mejores oportunidades laborales. En el principio fue difícil, pero con el correr del tiempo la joven pareja pudo ahorrar y comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, donD. viven actualmente.

Para poder aumentar los ingresos, ellos empezaron a vender panchos (hot dogs) y gaseosas en la vereda D. su casa, luego con las ganancias pudieron montar una casilla y hoy día ya tienen un comedor bien equipado donD. dan D. comer a mas D. 20 personas por día.

Ramona cuenta orgullosa que todo lo que lograron hasta ahora lo hicieron D. forma honesta. Ella desea seguir expandiendo su negocio, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías para la venta, como gaseosas, jugos, golosinas y cerveza, pues estas son las D. mayor demanda por los clientes.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juices, candies, and beer.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista A. is 72 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible single mother, and the founder of the company Cerrito de Carapeguá. She sells bed-covers and ponchos, manages a mini-grocery store, and raises livestock.

Despite her age she remains active and continues to work with great enthusiasm. She recently survived an unfortunate experience in which she was assaulted and beaten in her own home; it has been a struggle for her to recover, as she was left bedridden and responsible for two small grandchildren.

Today Evangelista's life is returning to normal. She continues to care for her two grandchildren and sell artisans' goods.

loans.use: To purchase more ponchos.

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en: Mrs. R. Sa Em was married in 1995 and has two children, one daughter and one son. Her neighbour taught her to weave in 1988 and she started her own silk weaving business that same year. Neither husband nor wife had enough money to even finish primary school. However, with their current business they have been able to send their children to study at school in the village. She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times previously. She has requested this loan of $100 in order to purchase silk material and sewing thread.

loans.use: to purchase silk material and sewing thread

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Ms. Teresa de Jesus Hernández is a single mother with 3 children, who need to continue their studies at their young age and are not yet able to work.

At present Ms. H. has a business selling clothes in the central market of Chinandega which she was able to start after she decided to request a loan from Ceprodel. Before that she was a domestic worker.

Ms. H. today marks 2 and a half years of completing loans with Ceprodel, which she states has lead to major achievements in her business such as growing sales. For that reason she has decided to continue working with the financing that Ceprodel offers to be able to maintain her 3 children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Teresa de Jesus Hernández es una madre soltera que posee 3 hijos de los cuales tiene la necesidad de mantener sus estudios por su corta edad ya que aun no tienen capacidad para trabajar.

Actualmente la Sra. H. posee un negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado central de Chinandega el cual para poder llegar a tener este negocio inició como trabajadora domestica hasta que decidió realizar un prestamo a Ceprodel.

La sra. H. hoy en dia posee 2 años y medio de realizar prestamos con ceprodel por lo que afirma ha alcanzado grandes logros en su negocio como lo es el incremetno de las ventas y por este motivo ha decidido seguir trabajando con el financiamiento que Ceprodel le otorga para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ekamah

texts.en: Mrs. Ekamah runs a restaurant business. She is 47 years old, married with three children. She is from Edo State and a member of LAPO. She needs the loan of $275 to buy more drinks and food to sell. She learned her business for 3 years and has been in it since 1989.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
I live in a brick mud house with my family in Multan, Pakistan. I have four kids: two girls and two boys. I am a textile designer and create embroidered clothes. My husband is a daily wage laborer. My eldest son now also works transporting goods on a donkey cart. My son would like to buy an additional donkey cart for his business. He feels that his income would double, and we would be able to repair our house.

This is a group loan, and the women in it have been together for more than one year. Waloo M.’s husband runs a small restaurant. Sajida B. and Jindo M. would use their loans to buy bull carts.

We all are mutually responsible for this loan; if one defaults, the others make up the difference.

loans.use: Buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
The cleaning products shop that Flor and her husband have operated for four years belonged to her father. He kept it open for forty years but, after an illness, he had to turn it over to Flor to run.

Flor used to live and work in Venezuela with her husband and two daughters. She worked an administrator for a realty company there. She decided to return to Peru with her family because she lost her job. Her husband got a job as a driver for a poultry processor and from time to time, they gave him chickens. When her husband was injured in an automobile accident, Flor was obliged to go to work and what could be better than selling the extra chickens around the house.

For eight years, Flor earned a living selling chickens until her father asked her to take charge of the cleaning product shop. Flor says that things are going very well now and her husband helps her tend the shop. She hopes to open another shop in another market in the near future because the money that she earns isn't enough to pay for both her daughters' schooling and medicine for her husband who suffers from diabetes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El puesto de artículos de limpieza que Flor T. y su esposo manejan desde hace cuatro le perteneció a su papa. Fue el quien durante cuarenta años mantuvo abierta y vigente la tienda, pero que a causa de una enfermedad la tuvo que dejar a cargo de Flor.

En un inicio Flor trabaja y vivía en Venezuela con sus dos hijas y esposo. Estuvo diez años trabajando para una inmobiliaria como administradora. Decidió regresar al Perú con su familia porque perdió su trabajo allá. Su esposo consiguió un trabajo como chofer de una avícola en Lima y cada cierto tiempo le regalaban pollos. Fue cuando su esposo sufrió un accidente automovilístico que ella se vio obligada a trabajar y nada mejor que vendiendo pollos que muchas veces le sobraba en casa.

Durante ocho años se dedico a la venta de pollos hasta que su papá le encargo a tienda de productos de limpieza. Actualmente, Flor asegura que le va muy bien, su esposo la ayuda en la atención de la tienda. Ella desea en un futuro cercano abrir una tienda más en otro mercado pues el dinero que le brinda su trabajo no es suficiente para el estudio de sus hijas y también para las medicinas de su esposo, quien sufre de diabetes.

loans.use: Open another store.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Francisco is a person who has always devoted himself to working in factories in the area of production. One of his dreams is to improve the living conditions within his own home, allowing his children to live in a more dignified manner.

He has two children, both of whom are in school, who he hopes to see get ahead and forge a better future.

The loan that Francisco seeks would be for the installation of bathroom/sanitary facilities in his house. This would provide for more privacy as well as a more sanitary existence for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco es una persona que se ha dedicado por siempre a trabajar en fábricas en el área de producción, uno de sus sueños es lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar y de esa manera conseguir que sus hijos vivan dignamente dentro de su casa. El tiene dos hijos ambos estudiantes y cuenta con que los dos muchachos saldrán adelante para forjarse un mejor futuro en la vida. El préstamo que esta solicitando don Francisco es para invertirlo en la instalación de servicios higiénicos en su casa. Esto permitirá a sus familiares contar con un lugar donde ellos puedan hacer sus necesidades fisiológicas y en esa medida logrará que su hogar cuente con mejores condiciones sanitarias.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of sanitary facilities for the home.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza belongs to the Las Dalilas ("The Dahlias") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 44 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is an independent laborer. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles), Maritza decided to invest in a restaurant business. She now has a restaurant called La Gruta ("The Grotto") that she opens for business on Saturdays and Sundays so that her customers can enjoy her delicious stews, excellent service and great music. She takes charge of every detail so that her customers are well looked after and will come back often.

With this loan of S/.1,000, to be repaid in 4 months, Maritza will buy materials to expand her business. Having a restaurant was one of Maritza's biggest dreams because she loves to cook and be with people. Now she can say that she is more independent than before and she'll continue working with Manuela Ramos because it supports the economic growth of women.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Lobo Caño Mz. 114 Lt. 16, del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 44 años,es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente., Es así que Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comidas. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante D. nombre La Gruta, que todos los sábados y domingos abre sus puertas para atender a sus clientes con los ricos potajes y la excelente atención y la buena música que hay. Para ello Maritza se encarga al milímetro D. supervisar y preparar todo para que sus clientes seas bien atendidos y queden satisfechos y vuelvan muy pronto.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el compra D. materiales para ampliar su negocio. Maritza, cumplió uno D. sus grandes sueños, tener un restaurante, ya que le gusta mucho cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente, ahora pueD. decir que es mas independiente que antes, y seguirá trabajando con Manuela Ramos por que aporta al crecimiento económico D. las mujeres.

loans.use: Buy materials to expand restaurant business.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun N. is a 40 years old and a widow. She has four children, three of whom work as construction workers while the fourth attends primary school. They live in the Province of Pursat.

Mrs. Noun earns $2.50 per day growing and selling vegetables. She requests a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds for her small farming business. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy and raise piglets to sell for additional income. This loan will enable her to expand her business and better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds for her small farming business, and purchase piglets for rearing with the remainder of the loan.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda Del Ca

texts.es:
Yolanda started the business when her father passed away and she was the only support for the family. At that time she was separated from her husband and had two small children. She began approximately 12 years ago, with the money that she obtained from her mother. They invested it in a business and began to sell clothes, subsequently making trips to Villa-Hidalgo, Moroleón, Mexico, and Aguascalientes where they could obtain clothes at better prices. They began to supply linens also, selling in installments with system of advance payment to assure the recovery of the sale. They also began to sell through a system of shows and have achieved growth in their business little by little.

She needs a loan of $975 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to fix the room where she has her inventory, since the rains and excess humidity have damaged the wall and the ceiling. With the support of this credit she is going to be able to fix it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda inició el negocio cuando falleció su padre y era el sostén de la familia, en ese tiempo ella estaba separada de su esposo y tenia a sus dos hijos pequeños. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 12 años, con el dinero que le entregaron a su madre, lo invirtieron en un negocio empezó a vender ropa, posteriormente a hacer viajes a Villa-Hidalgo, Moroleón, México, Aguascalientes donde podía conseguir ropa a mejore precios y empezó a surtir blancos también, vendiendo en pagos con sistema de anticipo para asegurar la recuperación de la venta, y también empezó vender por sistema de tandas y ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para arreglar el cuarto en donde tiene su inventario, ya que por las lluvias y el exceso de humedad se le daño la pared y el techo y con el apoyo de este crédito lo va a poder arreglar.

loans.use: To repair and remodel her stock room.

loans.name: Hidaya's Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 24 years old. She is married with one child aged 9 months. She is a teacher and bites seller. She started this business in January 2008. She works daily from 8AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 (US Dollars) in sales.

Hidaya hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling soft drinks, bites, and porridge.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Supiya

texts.en:
A widow and mother of two children, Supiya opened her business selling clothing for women seven years ago to support her family. She fought to provide for her family and educate her children, who are working adults today thanks to her example.
