Sacrificial and hardworking, she supported not only her two children but her elderly parents as well.

Supiya has invested countless hours and efforts to develop her business and establish a strong client base. Now her adult son (who is pictured in the photo) is helping his mother with her business. With the beginning of a new season, Supiya wants to add new seasonal stock to her goods. She is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) that she promises to repay over ten months. With this loan, she will be able to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.

Supiya and her friendly family would like to express their gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase of new women's clothing to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou Mané, 70 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Demba  Alette à Bourcounda depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer ses activités de commerce et d’élevage en achetant du riz, du sucre, des bœufs et autres provisions. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Salimatou Mané, age 70, is married and has nine children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Saré Demba Alette in Bourcounda for three years. She wants to bolster her work in commerce and in raising livestock by buying buffaloes and some rice, sugar, and other provisions. Her income enables her to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small-scale commerce and raising livestock

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil H. is 28 years old and lives with his elderly parents.  He is not married yet.  

He likes his livestock business very much.  He has 2 calves for fattening, which is how he supports his family.  He also works as a teacher in the local school, but his salary is too small even to cover his basic needs, and Ramil needs to think about his parents too.  That's why, seven years ago, he decided to start his own business.  

To expand his business Ramil has applied for a $1,200 loan to purchase four calves.  Ramil wishes to marry his fiance, but he wants to wait to increase his income during the winter season as it is the high period when people need meat.  

Your help will support Ramil's current and future families.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” del  distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Bertonio Nº 288.
Tiene 49 años, es conviviente y madre  de 5 hijos que mantiene aun, su esposo no la apoya por lo que tiene que trabajar sola. Julia dice que tuvo su esposo a los 16 años y ya no pudo estudiar. . Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que obtuvo por primera vez compro verduras y frutas para vender y repartir por mayor en Cusco.

 Ella actualmente continua con este negocio, viaja los días Lunes  a Tacna a traer verduras y frutas, los días viernes lleva a Cusco y cuando le sobran sus productos vende los días Miércoles y Domingos en Juli.

Con este préstamo solicitado de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara verduras y frutas por cajas.
texts.en:
Mr. Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” from the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno - she lives at the Jr. Bertonio Nº 288. She is 49 years old, married and mother of 5 children whom she still supports. She does not receive any help from her husband and has to do the work by herself. Julia says she got married when she was 16 and could not continue her education. With the S/: 300.00 new soles loan she first got, she purchased greens and fruits and sold them in Cusco. Currently, she is still involved in this business; she travels to Tacna on Mondays to buy greens and fruits and sells them on Fridays in Cusco. Whenever there is anything left she sells them in Juli on Wednesdays and Sundays. She will apply the S/: 1200.00 new soles, 4-month term loan, she is requesting to purchase boxes of vegetables and fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Catherine Lugo  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Catherine is the leader of this 4-member group. She is a 45-year-old, single mother of 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. She states that two of her children are currently enrolled in school, and that she does not take care of any additional family members.

She rents (and thus resides in) a one-room house, where she lives with five other people. Though they have electricity, they have no piped water at the house. Her family eats three meals per day.

She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Specifically, she fries a wide variety of foods, which she supplies to shops around town. Catherine notes that she works seven days a week. Notably, she has been a client of MCDT for five years, and this is the eighth loan she has sought through the organization. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder in bulk so as to minimize transportation costs. In the future, Catherine aspires to open up a more permanent bakery shop.

loans.use: To cut down on transportation costs by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil) in bulk

loans.name: Sout

texts.en:
Sout S., who is married and living in Kampong Cham with her husband and children, has been selling rice since 2000 to earn a living, making upwards of $5 a day; her husband operates a motor-taxi and raises domestic animals to earn additional income.

Sout is requesting a loan to purchase rice for resale, confident that this will allow her to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Amanecer se conforma de la siguiente manera;
Fidelia Amparo F.; ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, actualmente tiene una caseta donde vende golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Centro Educacional Juan Lindo de la aldea de Quebrada Larga, Jamastran, ella es casada y su esposo es propietario de transportes que viajan de Danli a Quebrada Larga y viceversa, ellos tienen 2 hijos que toda via dependen de ellos al 100%, con los ingresos que les generan sus negocios ellos pueden sacar adelante su familia y cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar.
Ana H.: ella se dedica a la venta de agro-insumos, tambien vende tarjetas y recargas de llamadas para celulares actividad que realiza hace 3 años, ella es madre de tres hijos y vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar, el trabaja como conductor de una empresa de transportes, ellos con sus trabajos sacan adelante su familia.
Elizabeth H.: ella de dedica al comercio desde hace 5 años, ella vende golosinas como ser: refrescos, churros, galletas, bombones etc. su negocio esta ubicado en quebrada larga, Jamastran, los fines de semana se dedica a la produccion de nacatamales y pan, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo migro a USA y ella tiene que sacar adelante su hogar sola. ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando.
texts.en:
The El Amanecer (The Sunrise) group is made up of the following people: Fidelia Amparo F.—She has worked in business for the past 10 years. She has a booth where she sells candy located in the Juan Lindo educational center in the Quebrada Larga neighborhood of Jamastran. She is married and her husband owns a transportation company that travels back and forth between Danli and Quebrada Larga. They have 2 children who depend on them 100%. With the money their businesses generate, they are able to care for their family and cover their household expenses. Ana H.—She works selling agricultural supples. She also sells and recharges phone cards for cellular phones, which she has done for the past 3 years. She is the mother of 3 children and lives with her common-law husband who works as a driver for a transportation company. With their jobs they help their family get ahead. Elizabeth H.—She has worked in business for the past 5 years. She sells sweets like: soft drinks, churros, cookies, candies, etc. Her business is located in Quebrada Larga in Jamastran. On the weekends she makes nacatamales (a type of large tamale) and bread. With her income she pays for all of the household expenses since her husband left for the United States. She has to help her family alone. She is a single mother with two children who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cornmeal, meat, vegetables, cheese, tortillas, salsa, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Meer Ahmad

texts.en: Meer Ahmad is the son of N. M.. He lives in district 16 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a family of four, and his son is going to get married. Meer Ahmad needs money for his son’s wedding expenses. As many people know, Afghan people have different customs and they are obligated to spend more money on weddings, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. He would like to say that this loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Serghei

texts.en: L. Serghei’s business is at the initial stage. Until present, he worked for his sister, who manages a business with retail marketing of various goods, as the sender. Now he has created a family and he has started his own business. The business location is in Cirnesti village, Nisporeni district. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a refrigerated display case, scales, shelves, and goods. Purchase of goods per month will be 15,000 lei; monthly income of 20,000 lei achievements. Future plans are enlarging his assortment and expansion of business using profits earned.

loans.use: purchasing a refrigerated display case, scales, shelves and goods

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Dina B. from Mwanza. She is married and has been running a pharmacy business since 2006. Dina sells different medicines which are used as treatment for different sicknesses.  She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Dina currently earns about 270USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more medicine to resell to customers.   In the future, she plans to expand her business. Dina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to resell to customers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Mrs Marina P. is married to Russel P., a driver, and they are blessed with three children. They currently live in Sipac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Marina is a responsible member of Kiva partner, PMPC – she has made her payments religiously and regularly, and therefore has no record of default. She has had a sari-sari ('various kinds') store business for almost a year, which she manages well.

Now Marina is requesting 5000 PHP for her second loan so that she can buy additional stock for her grocery store. Her dream is that her business will succeed, the store building become secure and stable, and that she could meet her customers' needs completely. Her hope is that all her children finish their education and get a job some day.

loans.use: To purchase items, such as household and food supplies, for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina A. bakes and sells bread in Ola, Cape Coast. Rosina has received senior high school education. She is single and has two children. Rosina has been baking and selling bread for 10 years. She is responsible for taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other bread-making ingredients to increase production. She hopes to use the  profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy flour and other bread-making ingredients

loans.name: Ailas Anwar Group

texts.en:
Bhagan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Rani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Noreen maria baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy material beads, colored thread, and clothes for her decorative embroidery business.

Ailas baji is the wife of Mr. A.. They have lived in a mid-size city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. She is the group leader of the ladies mentioned above. Her husband works in a factory for a monthly wage. Ailas baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates an embroidered clothing business to pay their utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy clothing and colored thread for her business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials to make embroidered clothing.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Gilberto is 41 years old, a bricklayer, and is married to Mrs. Benicia who is 34 and works as a housekeeper in their city, Itá.  The couple has a daughter named Monserrat who is six years old and is in elementary school. 

Juan Gilberto travelled to Buenos Aires and started his career as a bricklayer there 18 years ago.  He chose this path because his father got sick at a young age, and he could not go to college.  He has known this profession almost all of his adult life.  After 15 years he returned to Paraguay.  He currently has many clients and he works constructing, painting and repairing houses. 

Juan is applying for this loan to buy the tools he needs to carry out his work.  With the purchase of these tools he will be able to increase his income and the well being of his family.

loans.use: The purchase of tools for his business

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle S. owns and operates a business peddling fish and aquatic resources in her community. She is 36 years old, married to Danielo S., and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. Merle has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Merle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merle is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Samuela

texts.en: Samuela G. Y. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 41 years old, is married and has five school-aged children. Samuela operates a business raising crops for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Samuela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Danti

texts.en: Danti D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 26 years old. Danti is married and has two infant children. Danti owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Danti joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sofarania

texts.en: Sofarania S. (0) is a 47-year-old man living in the town of Utualii. He is married and has eleven adult children. Sofarania owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. Sofarania joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Sofarania is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be his 6th from SPBD. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Kitere Abakyara Tukwatanisa Angellica Rusoki Group

texts.en: Angellica R. is the President of Kitere Abakyara Tukwatanisa group. She is forty-eight years old business woman and married with nine children of whom five are going to school and she is more so managing to take care of four dependents. She deals with poultry business, so far ten years operating the business. She is using the loan to purchase chicken, drugs, feeds, etc for her poultry. She hopes of boosting her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and more so a cow

loans.use: To purchase chicken, drugs, feeds, etc for her poultry. She hopes of boosting her business.

loans.name: Nafi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nafi M. F. is a villager in Trapaing Leuk village in Takeo province. She is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old.

Mrs. Nafi M. F. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem with her business because her field is infertile, which affects her crop. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and a pump to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Tom Kompheak, is a teacher who makes a small salary to help support the family. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers and pump to support her field

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba N. vend de la glace, de la crème glace et du produit détergent depuis trois ans a Camberene, une banlieue situé à quelques kilométrés au nord de Dakar.  Ce crédit représente son premier prêt d'U-IMCEC.  Elle envisage une augmentation de 20.000 frs par mois  de ses bénéfices.  Elle est marie et habite avec son mari et ses trois enfants.  

Madame N. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba N. has been selling ice, ice cream, and detergents for three years in Camberene, a suburb located a few kilometers north of Dakar. This loan represents her first U-IMCEC loan. She envisions an increase of 20,000 francs a month in her profits. She is married and lives with her husband and her three children. Ms. N. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (program for child and family development) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children born of destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 56-year-old divorced mother of four children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, but the majority of its inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation, in addition to other business activities. 

Nana sells livestock. She buys live animals, such as goats and sheep, from nearby communities, and she sells them to butchers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to sell livestock on larger scale.

loans.use: To buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, todos en edad escolar, en el caserío Salitral, distrito D. Motupe, ubicado a una hora y quince minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Hace dos años aprendió el oficio D. estilista en un instituto D. L. ciudad D. Motupe y con recursos propios instaló una peluquería en su domicilio, allí atienD. a sus clientes durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe le sirven para apoyar L. economía diaria D. su familia.

Debido a L. calidad del servicio que brinda su negocio ha ido creciendo, Agustina piensa en ampliarlo pero no cuenta con el capital que necesita para lograr su objetivo, por lo que se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en mobiliario para su establecimiento.

Su más granD. sueño es poder implementarm su establecimiento y convertirlo en un salón D. belleza completo. ElL. es una mujer creativa y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Agustina is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and her four children, all school-aged. They live in the hamlet of Salitral, a district of Motupe, located one hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago she learnt the stylist traD. at an institute in the city of Motupe and with her own resources she set up a hairdresser's in her home, where she attends her clients all day. This income supports the daily needs of her family. Due to the quality of service that she brings to her business, it has been growing to the point where Agustina is thinking of expanding it, but she does not have the capital to achieve her goal. This is why she has seen it necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 800 nuevos soles which she intends to invest in furnishings for her business. Agustina's greatest dream is to be able to convert her residence into a complete beauty salon. She is a very creative and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furnishings to expand her hairdresser's

loans.name: Basilia De

texts.es: Basilia tiene casa propia, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, tiene 46 años de edad. Cuenta con el negocio de venta de almuerzos en el mercado Uruguay con 32 años de experiencia, el cónyuge es transportista asalariado, cuenta con 17 años de experiencia. Tiene competencia en el mercado, ya que la venta la realiza en un puesto fijo del mercado ubicado en la zona. El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación (compra de insumos, ollas, menaje y otros). Es su segundo crédito en la institución, cuenta con crédito en otras entidades financieras, este último con buen comportamiento crediticio.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, has her own home, is married, and has two children. She has sold prepared meals in the Uruguay market for the past 32 years. Her husband has been a salaried truck driver for the past 17 years. She has competition in the market since she sells from a fixed point in the market in the area. The funding will be used as working capital (to buy ingredients, pots, kitchenware, etc.) This is her second loan with the institution; she has credit with other financial entities in which her credit history is good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Nuestra socia KARLA tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Cynthia tiene tres años y Rodrigo tiene tres meses de nacido. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de víveres. La socia tiene un stand en el mercado “San Pedro” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cuatro meses que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite y muchas cosas más. 

La socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Karla is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, Cynthia who is 3 years old and Rodrigo who is 3 months old. Karla balances her housewife activitives with her business selling first necessity products. She has a stand at the San Pedro market in Cusco, Peru. She's been doing this for four months and she's doing really well, thanks to all her effort and dedication to work. She is a hard working and entrepeneur mother that is always putting her children first. Karla is asking for this loan in order to buy more food products like rice, sugar, milk, crackers, oil and many other things. She is a local to Cusco and belongs to the Comunal Bank "Fuente de Vida'. She is thankful for having this opportunity and is committed to pay the loan back.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 23 años, es madre de dos hijas, ambas menores de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, además se dedica a la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), gelatina y hielo, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja para una empresa de seguridad. Flor forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de venta de perfumes.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para ser vendidos entre sus vecinos y amistades. La meta de Flor es tener un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Flor, 23, is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has two, minor daughters. She sells beauty products. In addition, she also sells chupetes (popsicles), gelatin snacks, and ice from her home. Her husband, who works for a security agency, supports her activities. Flor has been a member of the "Las Flores" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in her perfume sales business. Now, she needs 800 soles to buy beauty products that will be sold among her neighbors and acquaintances. Flor's ultimate goal is to have a Minimart.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor B. A., tiene la edad de 44 años, es soltero, y tiene 5 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 20,16,13,9 y 5 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para darle mayor seguridad al local,a la maquinaria y a los vehículos de los clientes que se van a reparar y así poder brindar un servicio de mayor calidad. Don víctor cuenta con un local donde realiza la reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas y vehículos.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro dar mayor seguridad al cliente y así aumentarla demanda de trabajo y aumentar sus ingresos y así tener una mejor estabilidad en su trabajo, y  poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Víctor B. A. is 44 years old and is single. He has 5 children who are his main priority. His children are 20,16,13,9 and 5 years old, respectively. Victor has a shop where he repairs and maintains motorcycles and other vehicles. He wants a loan in order to buy materials to make his shop safer. This would safeguard his equipment and his customers' vehicles, allowing him to provide better service. This is the first time that Victor has requested a loan through FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the opportunities that are being offered to him. In the future, he hopes to provide more security for his customers and in this way increase demand for his work and increase his income. This would give him more job stability and he would be able to offer his children a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his mechanic shop

loans.name: Elba María

texts.es:
En el Barrio Costa Hermosa del municipio de Soledad, Atlántico, vive una mujer inspiradora de tenacidad y esfuerzo propio que en condición de jefe de hogar ha sacado a sus 3 hijos adelante ; ella es Elba María Bastos, gran emprendedora de negocios que desde que asumió la obligación de ser madre inició vendiendo refrescos embotellados y helados y con el producto de sus ganancias y su persistencia en el ahorro logró dotar su negocio de su primer enfriador y cajas de refrescos que vendía al detal y progresivamente al por mayor. Con este negocio logro educar a su primer hijo en estudios superiores; pero gradualmente la jornada laboral extendida a la que se sometió la llevó al cansancio extremo y decidió cambiar su actividad por la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que realiza en los fines de semanas y para la que compró un carro de perros calientes. En la actualidad tiene un negocio vende carne asada, perros calientes, hamburguesas, que combina con diversos insumos, como parte de su potencial innovador y que se han convertido en las delicias del barrio Costa Hermosa, donde vive gente trabajadora que aprecia la calidad de sus productos, la higiene con la que trabaja porque saben que ella cuida de su salud. Ella simultáneamente vende mercancía cosmética, aprovechando la admirable capacidad mercadológica que la caracteriza. 

Elba María nunca ha dejado de ahorrar, trabaja con el crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace un año, cuando fue recomendada por su hermana que también recibe beneficios de los servicios de esta organización. En la actualidad aspira a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para incrementar la venta de comidas rápidas en la época carnavalera e invertir mercancía cosmética sobre pedidos. Su sueño a corto plazo es comprar un local propio aspira a acceder al proyecto de viviendas en Villas e San Pablo y con su Asesora Aury Perez están en estos trámites y en especialmente intenta aplicar al subsidio estatal para ese fin. Asocia el éxito de su negocio con la disciplina, la persistencia y esto lo a demostrado , porque con él que ha logrado sostener su hogar y continuar con la educación de sus hijos y acceder a cursos de conducción, pagarle la carrera de procesos industriales y continuar preparándolos para que sean mayores la oportunidades a las que ellos puedan acceder.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Costa Hermosa, municipality of Soledad, Atlantico, lives an inspiring woman with tenacity and initiative, and being the head of household, she has managed to get her 3 children ahead in life. She is Elba María Bastos, a great entrepreneur that ever since she assumed the responsibility of being a mother, she started selling bottled drinks and ice cream. With her profits and persistence in saving, she managed to obtain her first refrigerator for the business, and crates of drinks that she would sell first at retail, and progressively at wholesale. With this business, she was able to provide a higher education for her first son, but the extended labor required led her to extreme exhaustion; she decided to change her business to selling fast food, an activity that she does on the weekends and for which she bought a hot dog cart. In her current business, she sells carne asada (grilled steaks), hot dogs, hamburgers, which she combines with other consumables as part of her innovative potential; her food has become a delight in the Costa Hermosa neighborhood, a community of hard working people that appreciate the quality of her products, and the cleanliness of her operation since they know health is a priority for her. She also sells cosmetics products, taking advantage of the admirable marketing skills that characterize her. Elba María has never stopped saving; for a year now, she works with loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; she was recommended by her sister who also benefits from the services of this organization. She currently aspires to get a loan of $2,000,000 (Colombian Pesos) to increase the sales of fast food during carnival season, and to increase cosmetic merchandise sold to order. Her short-term dream is to buy her own establishment, and she also aspires to participate in the housing project Villas de San Pablo; she is going thru the process with help from her advisor Aury Perez and she is planning to apply for government assistance. She attributes the success of her business to discipline and persistence, demonstrated by her, since she has been able to provide for her home, take driving lessons, afford the education of her children, pay for an industrial engineering education, and continue to prepare her children so they can have more opportunities available to them.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy consumables to prepare and sell fast food; also buy cosmetic products sold to order.

loans.name: Limne Gricelda

texts.es:
la sra. Limne Gricelda Z. C. tiene dos años de haber iniciado con una pequeña pulpería, tambien los fines de semana elabora y vende Nacatamales y Rosquillas.
Limne hace nacatamales y rosquillas una vez por semana, anteriormente elaboraba estos productos dos veces por semana y en ocasiones hasta tres veces por semana, pero desde que inicio con la pulpería, decidió bajar la producción de los mismos ya que era bien maltratado para ella por las recalentadas que se daba en el fogón y el horno.
Sus clientes la prefieren por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que ella les ofrece, además los nacatamales y las rosquillas que elabora son de muy buena calidad y de buen sabor.
texts.en:
Limne Gricelda Z. C. started a small local store two years ago and on weekends, she also makes and sells nacatamales and rosquillas (two typical foods in Nicaragua).

Limne makes nacatamales and rosquillas once a week. Before, she used to make these items twice per week and sometimes up to three times per week. However, since opening her store, she decided to cut back on making them, since she had to reheat them over the fire or in the oven.

Her customers prefer her because of the attention that she provides to them and for the prices that she offers. In addition, the nacatamales and rosquillas that she makes are tasty and good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, sodas, coffee, churros, spices, eggs, tortillas, toilet paper, pastas, sauces, cookies, sugar, rice, and butter

loans.name: Jaír Javier

texts.es:
Jair Javier V. Beltrán vive en el muy alegre barrio Simón Bolívar de la ciudad de Barranquilla, es comerciante  de electrodomésticos como lavadores, equipos de sonido y televisores. Tiene 15 años de estar negociando estos artículos  y comenzó desde hace 10 años cuando tenía 20 años de edad,  ayudando a su mamá a vender y ahora  fue ella quien lo remitió a la Fundación. Este es su tercer financiamiento  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a  $1.300.000 que quiere invertir en la compra de equipos de sonido, lavadoras y televisores que le han encargado.
Jair viaja mensualmente a Maicao, una ciudad fronteriza cerca de Venezuela para traer electrodomésticos que le dan una utilidad a su negocio pues conoce muy bien este mercado; el  también tiene a un tío que vive en Aguachica en el departamento de Cesar a quien envía electrodomésticos por encomienda y Jair va una vez al mes a este municipio a traer el dinero producto de su venta. Las utilidades que ha recibido con los créditos otorgados por la Fundación, le han servido para ayudar al sostenimiento del hogar donde vive junto a sus padres y una abuela: su mamá tiene un negocio y su papá trabaja en la soldadura y reparaciones de canecas de aluminio en una empresa que se envasa la leche.
El sueño de Jair es que su negocio crezca incluso en otros municipios a través del mismo sistema de encomienda. También tiene una meta de tener una casa propia. A Jair le gusta mucho el fútbol y es un asiduo juniorista (entusiasta por Junior, el equipo de fútbol de Barranquilla).
texts.en:
Jair Javier V. Beltrán lives in Barranquilla’s very cheerful Simón Bolívar neighborhood. He is a home appliance merchant. He sells such items as: washing machines, sound systems and television sets. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. He started 10 years ago, when he was 20 years old, helping his mother sell; it was she who sent him to the Fundación. This is his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he is asking for $1.300.000 to buy sound systems, washing machines and television sets that he has pending orders for. Jair travels monthly to Maicao, a city on the border with Venezuela, to bring appliances that produce good profits for his business; he knows this market very well. He also has an uncle that lives in Aguachica, Cesar department, to whom he sends appliances on consignment. Jair travels to this city once a month to collect earnings from his sales. The profits he has earned through loans from the Fundación have helped him to support his home where he lives with his parents and grandmother. His mother has a business and his father works as a welder repairing aluminum trash bins for a milk bottling plant. Jair’s dream is that his business expands into other municipalities through his consignment system. He also has as a goal to have his own home. Jair loves football and is an avid Juniorista (fan of Junior, Barranquilla’s team).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sound systems, washing machines and television sets.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 42 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been selling timber for twenty years to earn a living. He also practices farming for commercial purposes to get enough money to support his family and to pay school fees for his children. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offered him on business management, for he has become focused and his business has grown. He hopes to expand his business and increase his turnover in the future. He has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to buy more timber for selling.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Damaris del Socorro S. S., habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y  junto a su esposo procrearon 6 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son mayores y sobreviven de forma independiente, los otros 4 dependen económicamente de sus padres, el señor labora como guarda de seguridad y le apoya económicamente a los gastos del hogar a la señora S..

Ella realiza acarreos de las mercaderías de las tiendas del mercado oriental propiamente en el sector ferretero, tiene un equipo de personas que son las que llevan a cabo estos trabajos. En el diario vivir de la señora, en el Mercado Oriental, ha observado la necesidad de inaugurar una cafetería, que ofrezca los servicios de refresquería y comidas rápidas, esta ambición la tiene  a un futuro cercano, y para llevar a cabo esto, ella solicita de un préstamo que le ayude a elevar las ordenes de acarreo, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de una camioneta usada que le favorezca a incrementar los ingresos mensuales y así planificar la apertura de la cafetería, agradecería que se le apoyara, a mejorar día con día sus niveles económicos y tras esto la mejoría continua de sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro S. S. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She’s married and has 6 children, two of whom are adult and live independently and four that still depend on their parents. Her husband is a security guard and contributes to household expenses. She works hauling merchandise among the stalls in the Oriental market, specifically in the hardware section; she has a crew that work for her. In her daily experiences in the Oriental market she has noticed that there is a need to open a café that would offer fast food and refreshments. This is a goal for the near future. In order to accomplish this, she needs to increase her hauling orders so she is asking for funds to buy a used pick-up truck that would help her increase her monthly income so that she can plan to open her café. She would appreciate funding that would daily improve her income leading to subsequent improvement of living conditions for herself and her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pick-up truck.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq A. is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in Gaza. He opened a computer store in 2008 after realizing that there were no stores of this kind in the area. He hopes that, through this loan, he will be able to buy new computers to sell, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new computers to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza D. P. is from Panagaan, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Liza is a PDP-LP member. (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). To make living, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is a farmer. She has managed her business for more than a year and she earns approximately $150 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in business activities. She has a new loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC to be used as additional working capital for her business. This is her 1st loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
59-year-old Cecilia J. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five adult children. Cecilia owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cecilia also owns a farm where she plants and harvests rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years already.

In 2009, Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Cecilia has successfully repaid her first loan from CEVI. Cecilia is now requesting her second loan, for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo de 58 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Tiene 4 hijos. El es odontólogo comunitario en las Orquídeas. 

Hace años atrás el estudio odontología pero decidió utilizar sus conocimientos para la comunidad, y dar sus servicio odontológico a un bajo precio. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Para tener mas implementos y ayudar mas a la comunidad necesita comprar un compresor y macillas. 

En el futuro quiere seguir ayudando a la gente en su negocio de odontología.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is 58 years old and lives in the urban area of Las Orquídeas (which originally was a field full of orchids) in Guayquil. He has four children. Ubaldo is a dentist who practices in the community of Las Orquídeas.

He studied dentistry several years ago, so he decided to utilize his knowledge to benefit the community by providing dental services at a low price. Ubaldo works from 9am until 5pm. In order to have the equipment he needs to help the community, he needs to buy a compressor and dental putty.

In the future, he wants to continue helping people through his dental practice.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a compressor & dental putty

loans.name: Janeth Ramona

texts.es:
Janeth de 31 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). Ella es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa que ayuda a las mujeres para que puedan trabajar vendiendo productos por catalogo). 

Ella tiene una tienda pequeña de productos Yambal, comenzó vendiendo a sus amigos y conocidos, poco a poco con perseverancia por sus hijos ella empezó a vender a mas personas. Ahora ella vende en su tienda de productos perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. Para tener mas ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes y desodorantes. 

En el futuro quiere comprar vitrinas para sus productos.
texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with mountains and dirt roads). She sells beauty products from Yambal (a company that helps women by having them sell product from its catalog). She has a small store with Yambal products. She started out selling to friends and acquaintances, and little by little with perseverance and thoughts of her children she started selling to more people. Now she sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, and other items in her store. To increase her income she wants to purchase more perfumes and deodorant with the loan. In the future she wants to purchase display cases for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, lotions and deodorants

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent has been operating his mixed farm for the last ten years in the outskirts of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya. His farm produces pineapples, coffee, tea, milk and maize, which he sells locally. He has also employed a farmhand from his community.

Vincent is 50 years old and married with 6 children, ages ranging between 7 and 18. All the children are currently attending school. He solely depends on the income from his farming activities to cater to the basic needs of the family. He however faces the challenge of drought, which affects his produce and the poor road network.

Vincent has a clean record with Juhudi Kilimo after he successfully completed his previous loan of KES.45,000. He has requested this loan of KES.60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He believes that with this loan, he will be able to generate more income for the family through the sale of milk, and this will improve their living standards and help pay school fees.

He would like to stock more quality dairy cows in future. He appreciates Juhudi's efforts of not just availing loans but also caring about the social being of the clients.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: M. ablavi est une dame  très dynamique. elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier de hedzranawoé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé. son stock de charbons de bois est épuisée, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner très rapidement pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients; elle sollicite donc son premier crédit de WAGES pour l'achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ablavi M. is a very energetic woman. She lives with her husband and children in the Hedzranawoé district. Her line of business is selling charcoal. She has operated this business since 2005 and obtains her supplies in Lomé’s local markets. Her supply of charcoal is exhausted and she would like to stock up very quickly so that she can satisfy her customers. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 20 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman M. is 25 years old. He owns a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices and tea. He also sells detergents. Mehman started this business a year ago with a small inventory of foodstuffs. Over time he expanded his business and now has become very successful.

Mehman is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Natty Jesusa

texts.es: La señora Natty vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada, sus hijos están en edad escolar. La señora tiene un almacén de abarrotes y su esposo trabaja en el transporte publico, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia. El crédito que solicta será utilizado para la construcción de un cuarto de baño. Natty es cliente de Impro con un historial de 8 créditos.
texts.en:
Natty lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area, on the eastern slopes of the city of La Paz. She's married with school-aged children. She has a grocery warehouse and her husband works in public transit. They use their income to support the family. Natty plans to use her loan to construct a bathroom. She is an Impro client who has had eight loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Mrs. Hul Thol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Angk Svay Chek village in the Takeo province make up this village bank loan. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Hul T., 54, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a fisherwoman. She has some problems because she does not have enough fishing supplies to use. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Hul T. is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and a fishing boat. She is a widow who lives in a two-member household.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and a fishing boat

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita Vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace uno 30 años que  vino al departamento de Santa Cruz, tiene un hijo a  su cargo, su esposo se dedica al transporte, su actividad es la venta de refrigerio ambulante como sándwich en la ramada (mercado muy conocido  de la ciudad) , el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su casa, que esta en obra bruta y necesita comprar pintura mosaico, etc., esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Margarita lives in the village of La Guardia, located 20 km from the town of Santa Cruz. A native of the Cochabamba department, she moved to the Santa Cruz department around 30 years ago. She has a child who depends economically on her, her husband engages in transportation and she is a street vendor selling snacks such as sandwiches in La Ramada (a very well-known market in town). The loan she is requesting will be used to finish building her house: as the initial works have been completed, she now needs to buy paint, tessellated pavement and so on. She is really thankful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly A. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates motorcycle taxi business using a "tricycle", or motorcycle with sidecar. Rolly has had this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Rolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed maintain his tricycle. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of his tricycle. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of a motorcycle taxi with sidecar

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela B. is a married woman who lives in Dacongcogon, Barangay Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, buying and selling rice and a catering/food vending business. Her husband, Ricardo B. Sr., who is 62 years old, also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 31 to 43 years old. 

Rafaela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rafaela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $200, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is again borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and the payment of debts. Rafaela B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Helen Ninoska

texts.es:
Helen tiene 18 años, estudia II año de Ingeniaría Agropecuaria, vive en Ocotal,  sus padres son Comerciantes y ella los ayuda en sus negocios, ellos tienen un Cafetín y un Cyber, decidió estudiar esta carrera por influencia de su hermana, quien obtuvo una beca para estudiar Técnico Forestal.
Ella realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.
Su Principal objetivo es culminar su carrera y ser una empresaria independiente.
texts.en:
Helen, 18, is a second year Agronomy and Cattle Raising student.  She lives in Ocotal.  Her parents are merchants and she helps them in their businesses.  They have a snack bar and an Internet Café.  She decided to study this career influenced by her sister who got a scholarship to become a Forestry Technician.

She negotiated the loan to buy supplies for a university project:  to grow cabbage.

Her main objective is to finish her career and be an independent businesswoman.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
residen en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, ella trabaja D. 7:00am a 8:00 pm atendiendo su negocio donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, su ventaja en que el lugar no hay otra tienda por lo que no tiene competencia.
Ella actualmente tiene la necesidad D. invertir en el negocio y comprar ropa, para intentar un nuevo comercio dentro D. su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para esta inversión, y así ir creciendo y diversificando el negocio.
Su visión es tener un negocio amplio y lleno D. mercadería como un mini súper para atender a todos los clientes y vecinos cercanos.
texts.en:
Maria Angela lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  She works from 7.00am to 8.00pm serving in her business where she sells convenience store items.  Her advantage is that there is no other store in the area so she has no competition.

Maria Angela currently needs to invest in her business and would like to buy some clothes to try out a new sideline within her business.  She is requesting a loan to make this investment so that she can continue growing and diversifying her business.

Her vision is to have a large business which is full of merchandise like a mini supermarket so that she can serve all her customers and neighbors.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other necessary products for her store

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Mrs. Ritchel F. is from the barangay (village) of Bañadero in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married and blessed with two young children. To make a living, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store and a restaurant. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 2 years. She is earns at least Php6,000.00 per month from her businesses. 

Just this year, Ritchel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Ritchel is requesting a first loan of Php 25,000.00. She will use the loan fundsfor additional capital for her sari-sari store and restaurant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions of her family, especially meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for their sari-sari store and restaurant

loans.name: Sreyleang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyleang V., 19 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophol Ut, 22, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have no children yet. Sreyleang and her husband are garment factory workers. Presently, Sreyleang lives with her parents; she wants to build her own house to live in. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to use for the project.

loans.use: To build her own house

loans.name: Tesoros De Amacuzac Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Tesoros de Amacuzac se ubica en la comunidad de Amacuzac en el Estado de Morelos en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su famoso Rio cuyo nombre es Amacuzac en este se practican Deportes extremos como Rápidos en Kayak y Competencias en lanchas. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes  y es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito.Olga Damiana O. Vázquez es Tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos negocio que inicio hace 20 años, la Sra. inicio su negocio por que su necesidades económicas  crecían por la llegada de sus hijos, ya que el ingreso de su esposo ya no era suficiente para solventar los gastos de la familia,  solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía, va a comprar cosméticos, tiene 39 años, estudio una carrera técnica para secretaria Ejecutiva,  es casada y tiene un total de 3 hijos de 18,15 y 13 años respectivamente, sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran los artículos que necesitan,  al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente muy contenta porque va a poder pagar sus pedidos, quiere este crédito para agrandar su negocio, con las ganancias espera pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group, called Tesoros de Amacuzac, is located in the Amacuzac community in Morelos state, Mexico. This community is known for its famous river, the Amacuzac, where extreme sports are practiced, such as kayaking the rapids and speedboat competitions. The group is made up of 10 members, and this is the second time that they have requested a loan. 
Olga Damiana O. Vazques is the group treasurer. She sells cosmetics, a business that she started 20 years ago. She started her business when her economic needs grew after her children arrived, since her husband's income was not enough to cover the family's costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise. She will purchase cosmetics. She is 39 and studied to be an executive secretary. She is married with 3 children ages 18, 15 and 13. Her customers prefer her because she always finds the items that they need. She is very happy to have requested this loan because she will pay her orders. She wants this loan for expanding her business. With her earnings, she hopes to pay her children's school costs.

loans.use: she will purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ruth Magaly

texts.es:
Ruth nació y vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo pero algunos no como Ruth que se dedica  a la venta de ropa y productos en general.  Ruth requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa y otros productos.   
  
Ruth pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Ruth was born in and lives in the historical city of Cusco in the Cusco, Perú, department. People in the city of Cusco devote themselves to different types of businesses and providing services. The businesses are strongly related to tourism. However, some of them, like Ruth's, is not.  Ruth sells clothes and general products.

Ruth needs the loan to buy more clothes and other products. Ruth belongs to the “Hijas de María” (María’s Daughters) Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is in its third year, and it is going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other products

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: El  señor Milton es chofer y trabaja con su movilidad como radio-taxi; el crédito lo requiere para comprar llantas, batería y radio de comunicación. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Milton es soltero.
texts.en: Mr. Milton is a taxi driver and works with his radio taxi. He is requesting the loan in order to buy tires, a battery and a radio. The taxi is his main source of income. He is single and lives in his parents’ house in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.

loans.use: To buy tires, battery and radio for his radio taxi

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maribel. La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 2 hijos de (14,  5),  la socia es asesora de ventas de claro, ella también puso en su casa un negocio de internet y un locutorio, la socia desea invertir el préstamo esta vez en la compra de papeles y de una impresora a color, ella tiene un pequeño ahorro y sobre este ahorro aumentaría este monto para realizar la compra. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una impresora a color y de papeles para la impresora.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, married, and has two children (ages 14 and 5). Maribel works as a sales representative for Claro (a telecommunications company), but she also manages an Internet café and call center from her home. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of paper and a color printer. Maribel has some money saved up, but she needs a little bit more in order to make this purchase. The funds will be used to buy a color printer and the paper to go with it.

Maribel is happy to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase a color printer & paper

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Aisha M., who is in her early thirties, is single with three children. She has been running a food sales business for five years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy plates, chairs and food. She has successfully repaid her loan. Aisha hopes for a loan to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks and ice cream. Her dream is to one day build her own house and to have her children obtain higher education.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group, Faith, which consists of 20 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the photo, Aisha is 1st on the right, 3rd row with a  white head scarf.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Savany's Group

texts.en:
The three people who make up this group loan will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can improve their family's standard of living. 

Mr. Savany is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. He is a teacher and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice yield and with the rest of the rice, he supports his family.

 In the rice field, he has some problems because his field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mr. Savany is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. His wife, Mrs. Im, is a laborer in Thailand. He is the father of four children, one of whom is a silk weaver, while the others are studying in a local public school. 

Mrs. Khoeun Nut is the group guarantor, so she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola Margarita M. López es una mujer empoderada de 40 años que desde hace 5 años elabora tortillas en su casa de habitación, sin embargo además de vender tortillas poco a poco fue introduciendo nuevos productos y ahora vende también elotes, tamales, frijoles cocidos y hasta artesanías que trae de sus viajes a Chinandega. Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materia prima en especial maiz, leña...etc. y así hacer crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola Margarita M. López is an empowered women who is 40 years old and has been making tortillas and selling them out of her home for five years.  Gradually she has introduced new products into her tortilla business such as corncobs, tamales and cooked beans, and even crafts that she brings from her trips to Chinandega.

She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients such as corn, firewood, etc. to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Snith

texts.es:
Snith M. de 31 años es una joven muy alegre y cordial que tiene una droguería en la cual vende medicamentos y productos de tocador;  sus principales productos son los medicamentos genéricos con los que inició hace 8 años  cuando decidió comprárselo a un arrendatario del local de su madre cuando este no quiso continuar;  sus clientes son vecinos del sector y  transeúntes. Snith además de ser una mujer de negocios goza del reconocimiento de sus clientes, vecinos y amigos quienes suministran buenas referencias personales y familiares y este es el reconocimiento que ha ganado en virtud  de sus valores. El credikiva es su  es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , con el cual comprará  productos de aseo personal y en general artículos que rotan muy fácilmente en la droguería.
Snith está muy contenta con su negocio, porque con él  genera los principales  ingresos familiares,  y es la  fuente de empleo con la que cuenta para alcanzar el sueño de  ver a sus  2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, con mejores oportunidades educativas y laborales, pues son ellos quienes la motivan a salir adelante en la búsqueda de brindarles todas las oportunidades de las que ella sea capaz. Su mayor desafío en la actualidad es conseguir su casa propia y para ello está preparándose para acceder al programa Sueños y Oportunidades liderado por la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo  con el cual se postula para  lograr su propósito, pero mientras cultiva sus sueños  se esmera   en su negocio que hoy le genera una utilidad no menor de un 30% .
texts.en:
Snith M. is 31 years old.  She is a very cheerful and friendly young woman who owns a drugstore where she sells medicines and personal care products.  Her main products are generic medicines which are what she started out selling eight years ago when she decided to buy the business from the then tenant when he decided he didn't want to continue in it.  Her customers are neighbors and passersby.

In addition to being a businesswoman, Snith enjoys the recognition of her customers, neighbors and friends who provide good personal and family references.  This is recognition that she has earned.

This Kiva loan is Snith's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy personal care products and other products that she sells a lot of in her drugstore.  Snith is very happy with her business because it is her family's main source of income and it is the work through which she is reaching her dream of seeing her two children, aged 11 and 5, enjoy better educational and work opportunities since they are what motivate her to get ahead in her search to provide them with all the opportunities she can.

Snith's biggest challenge right now is obtaining her own home and, for this reason, she is preparing to access the 'Dreams and Opportunities' program led by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which she will apply to achieve her goal.  While she is developing her dreams, she takes care of her business which currently makes her profits of no less than 30%.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and other products that she sells a lot of in her drugstore

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión esta formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros, son personas muy trabajadoras se dedican a diferentes actividades como al comercio, cría de animales o a la agricultura. Nuestras socias nos demuestran que son personas luchadoras ya que con su sacrificio aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir adelante.

La Señora Mónica T. vive en la comunidad de 3 de Noviembre en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años, es casada y tiene un niño de 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus suegros en donde comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Mónica se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y como pasa en casa cría y vende pollos y cuyes, inicio con esta actividad desde que se caso. También le gusta tejer a crochet, realiza chalinas (vestimenta tradicional), esto aprendió sola y por habilidad.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 ciclos y fue invitada por su suegra, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda.

En esta ocasión nos acompañan en el foto dos niños que son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en: The Nueva Ilusión (New Illusion) community bank consists of 11 women who live in the parish of Cumbre, which has a cool climate and the people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors. The members are very hard-working women who make a living in various activities such as commerce,  livestock or agriculture. They have shown themselves to be fighters willing to sacrifice to support their household finances and make headway. Mónica lives in the Third of November community in Cumbre, is 19, married and has a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker. They do not have their own home so they live in her in-laws' house and share in the household expenses. Mónica dedicates herself to caring for her son and raising and selling chickens and guinea pigs, which she has been doing since she got married. She also enjoys crocheting, making traditional garments, which she learned to do herself. She has been a member of the community bank for the past two loan cycles and was invited to join by her mother-in-law. She plans to use the money from the loan to purchase chickens and guinea pigs.
