Her goal is to have a store. The two children in the photo belong to two of the members.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 30, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Sokha is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband grows rice to sell, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 15 USD on food and 40 USD on the other necessary expenses. Sokha is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to hire people to help plow and grow rice. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to hire people to help plow the rice fields

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería. Ingresó a la venta de cosméticos por la invitación de una amiga por su buen desempeño fue escalando cargos ahora es supervisora de la zona “C” le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad de los créditos, por las capacitaciones y se puede ahorrar.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the Communal Bank “Amaqella”. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Rosaura sells cosmetics and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. She got involved in selling cosmetics after being invited by a friend. As a result of her good performance, Rosaura was able to climb the ranks and is now the supervisor of District “C”.

She enjoys FINCA Peru because of the convenience of the loans, the training seminars, and having the ability to save.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 28 years old. She has two children who are three and seven years old. Her husband is a welder. 

Helene sells second-hand clothes and she has done this business for the past eight years. This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. 

She needs a loan to open up a general store in which she plans to sell different kinds of items including sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt and soap. She plans to save all her profits in order to start building her own house.

loans.use: to buy various items for her general store.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta is 53 years old and married. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.  She has been growing rice and corn crops for over 20 years. According to Inocenta, her recent monthly earnings from farming are 4500 PHP.

Inocenta has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm provisions.  In the future, Inocenta hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm provisions

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí se reúnen 13 mujeres, dentro del comité denominado Virgen del perpetuo Socorro. Ellas se unieron tras escuchar hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Todas son conocidas en el barrio y alrededores por su forma de trabajar. Su objetivo común es generar mas ingresos para darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus familias.
La Sra Anselma se dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Comenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que todos los días ella se levanta a muy tempranas horas para poder comprar las verduras que va a vender. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que le gustaría poder darles un estilo de vida diferente, es decir, sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas de todo tipo para luego venderlas, Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la Fundación, pues sabe que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Thirteen women who form the committee called “Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro” (Our Lady of Perpetual Help) meet in the city of Paraguarí.  They came together after hearing talk about the enterprising women’s program.  They are all known in the neighborhood and surrounding areas for their way of working.  Their common objective is to generate more income to provide their families with better lifestyles.

Anselma sells vegetables.  She comments that this is very demanding work since she rises early every day to be able to buy the vegetables she will sell.  She says that everything she does is for her family’s wellbeing because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle, that is to say, one without deprivations.

She requests the loan to buy all types of vegetables to later resell.  She is very grateful for the opportunity the Fundación grants her because she knows that the loan will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en: Selline is 33 years old, married to David, and they have four children. She has a grocery business that she operates. She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy onions, tomatoes, mangoes and oranges to add to her stock. She hopes to own a big grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, mangoes and oranges to add to her stock.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 42 years old, married to Rehab. They are blessed with three children. He has been a taxi driver as a primary business and has been running a butchery as his secondary business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET. He will use the loan to repair his car and buy more cows for slaughtering.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes are concentrated on his children’s education and improving the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To repair his car and buy more cows for slaughtering.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas y almuerzos caseros, en su negocio ubicado en un barrio al sur de la ciudad y que le genera ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su hogar, idea con la cual lo emprendió para generar una segunda alternativa de ingresos y apoyar los gastos familiares.  Primero emprendió su aventura de negocios con la venta de almuerzos diarios, que creció en clientela y en utilidades, luego adicionó la alternativa de comidas rápidas negocio que trabaja los fines de semanas y en los que vende de contado y a créditos en plazos cortos. Su meta más adelante es tener un restaurante posicionado y generando empleos a personas que también necesitan ingresos para su hogar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, para la preparación de sus alimentos con el fin de ganar descuentos y disminuir los costos del transporte diario, por efectos de su compra. Así mismo con este recurso, planea mejorar las condiciones locativas en los cuartos de cocina y baño, e invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas plásticas para impactar el servicio de manera efectiva.
texts.en: Isabel sells all types of fast food and home-cooked lunches in her business located in a neighborhood on the south side of the city. It generates income to contribute to the running of her household. She got started with this idea in order to have a second alternative for income and to contribute to the family’s expenses. She first started her adventure in business by selling daily lunches, which grew in customers and profits. She soon added the alternative fast food business, in which she works during the weekends and from which she sells for cash and also on short-term credit. Her goal is to eventually open a restaurant and create jobs for people who also need income for their households. This loan in cooperation with Kiva is the first loan she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy materials and ingredients in larger volume for the preparation of her foods, with the goal of getting discounts and lowering the cost of daily transportation. With this loan she also plans to improve the conditions of her kitchen and bathroom. She will purchase plastic tables and chairs, which will have a positive impact on her service.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients in larger volume, to improve conditions in her kitchen and bathroom, and to purchase plastic chairs and tables

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been practicing farming for the last ten years in Kimana, Oloitoktok.  She is 38 years old and married to Peter.  They have four children all in school.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.  This will be her first loan.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy pesticides and seedlings. 

In the future, Beatrice hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Buya

texts.en:
Buya is a divorced man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. For the past six months, he has operated a business selling goats at the market and from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his business. He dreams of purchasing more goats in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente; Manuel se dedica a la siembra de maíz, a la vez es empleado de un beneficio de café, trabaja como vigilante, labora de lunes a sábado desde hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de polines, lamina y teja para instalar el techo a un baño en su vivienda, esto le ayudara para mantener más ordenado su casa y que su familia este en mejores condiciones de vida.
La aspiración de Manuel es proveer a su familia el sustento diario y poder también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family of three children and his wife. Only one of the children depends on him financially. Manuel works growing corn and is also employed on behalf of a café working as a watchman working from Monday through Saturday, and has been doing this for 6 years.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy wooden beams, sheet metal and tiles in order to install a roof for the bathroom for his house. This will help him put his house in order and his family will have better living conditions. Manuel’s dream is to provide his family with their daily bread and to also be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, sheet metal and tiles in order to install a roof

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, es casada y socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Margarita es feriante de carne, desde muy pequeña trabaja en la ferias junto con sus padres antes tenía poco capital, ahora trabaja sola y tiene su propio capital, le encanta Finca por las capacitaciones que recibe, las que le ayudaron a poder aumentar su negocio, el ahorro es muy importante para ella, el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de carnero, chancho y un poco de ropa, su meta es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) Communal Bank. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 2, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Margarita is a meat vendor. Ever since she was young, she has been working in the open-air markets with her parents. Before, she had very little capital. Now that she works for herself, she has her own capital. She loves Finca because of the training she receives, which has helped her expand her business. Saving money is very important for her. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing mutton, pork, and some apparel. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of meat, such as mutton and pork.

loans.name: Fernando Mauro

texts.es:
Fernando de 25 años, vive una zona urbana llamada “Milagro”.
Su negocio es una peluquería, inicio este negocio hace 5 años, trabajo como empleado en una peluquería y luego con un pequeño capital pudo adquirir su propio negocio.
Su actividad la realiza solo, de lunes a sábado de las 9:00am hasta las 18:00pm, los domingos descansa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de vitrinas, sillones, tijeras y para el aumento de su negocio.
Su sueño es que pueda salir adelante con su negocio y con la bendición de Dios la compra de un vehículo.
texts.en: Fernando, 25, lives in an urban zone called "Milagro."  His business is a barber shop.  He started it five years ago.  He worked as an employee in a barber shop and then with a little capital was able to acquire his own business.  He works alone Monday through Saturday from 9am until 6pm; he rests Sundays.  He's asking for the loan to buy display cases, armchairs and scissors to increase business.  His dream is to be able to get ahead with his business and with God's blessing to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy display cases, armchairs and scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase water pipes and fertilizer

loans.name: Macodou Dieng

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui exerce dans le commerce  de produits cosmétiques et l'élevage de moutons.Il s'approvisionne en gros  dans les grands magasins de la capitale et revend ses produits cosmétiques en détails.Son commerce génère ainsi des revenus assez consistants dont il réinvestit une partie dans l'embouche ovine.Il achète des moutons qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de six mois.Cette activité d'élevage est très rentable et lui permet de participer grandement à la prise en  charge des dépenses d'entretien de ses parents et de ses frères et sœurs.Pour augmenter ses bénéfices dans l'embouche ovine,  il sollicite un prêt de 500 000f  afin d'acheter 10 moutons. Son ambition est de développer d'avantage cette activité.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young bachelor whose business activities are trading in cosmetics and raising sheep.

He buys cosmetic products wholesale from big stores in the capital and resells them retail. His trading generates enough revenue for him to reinvest some of it to fatten sheep.

He buys sheep to be fattened and resold within six months. This activity is very profitable and enables him to contribute significantly in managing household expenses for his parents, brothers and sisters.

To increase profits in his sheep-fattening business, he is requesting a 500,000 francs loan to purchase 10 sheep. His ambition is to further develop this business activity..

loans.use: buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia nació en la ciudad D. Cusco y vive en la comunidad D. Pachar, ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada y fruto D. unión tiene seis hijos.  

Eusebia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Pachar, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Eusebia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes. 

Eusebia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Eusebia pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción D. Pachar” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Eusebia was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the community of Pachar, she is married and has six children.

Eusebia performs her daily and economic activities in the city of Pachar, she raises small animals like chickens and cuyes.  She has done this for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts in her work.

She requests a loan to buy more small animals like cuyes.

Eusebia is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and is committed to make the payments according to schedule.  Eusebia belongs to the community bank " Immaculate Conception of Pachar" from the Arawiwa Association of the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy small animals like cuyes.

loans.name: Daisy Jepkosgei

texts.en: Daisy is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 to 17 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothing for young ladies and babies. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes to run many more boutiques in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has two children. For the past 2 years, Geraldine has been selling ready-to-wear products and delivering them to her customers. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase ready-to-wear products. Geraldine  has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months. In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Karla Yarenci

texts.es: La Sra. Karla y su esposo son una pareja joven que  gracias  a  su  esfuerzo  han logrado  salir  adelante , el  actualmente   trabaja  teniendo  mas de  un  año  de  antigüedad  laboral,  y  ella  lo  apoya   vendiendo  ropa  nueva,  nos  comenta  que  actualmente  sus  ventas  se  incrementaron satisfactoriamente  ya  que  se les   ocurrió  promocionar  su mercancía  en  Internet, es  por  ello  que  ella  se acerco  con nosotros  ya que requiere  realizar  la compra  de ropa para  continuar  brindando a sus  clientes  el  excelente  servicio  que  la a caracterizado, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Karla  and her husband are a young couple who, thanks to their hard work, have been able to get ahead. Her husband has worked for one year, and she supports him by selling new clothing. She tells us that her sales are currently growing nicely, since she promotes her merchandise on the internet. For this reason she has turned to us, since she needs to make a purchase of clothing in order to offer her characteristically excellent customer service. She is grateful for this support with her project.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.en: Dominga plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying vegetables and fruits. She has had her business for six years, starting after the first loan she received from Esperanza. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and five of the eight children they have. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business. She plans to continue to enjoy work most of the time. She is dreaming of seeing her children become professional and good people. Dominga is excited to be taking out her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business. Dominga is the coordinator of her group El Samaritano ("The Samaritan").

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Soukeye

texts.fr: Madame    Soukeye   est   une  femme   Sénégalaise   mariée   qui   évolue   dans     le  secteur    de   l’aviculture   depuis   très   longtemps.	Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de poulets. Elle  capitalise une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Elle est mère de famille et grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité  elle parvient  a participer a la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille (nourriture et transport).Elle est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite présentement un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de poussins à élever. Son principal objectif  consiste à élargir son activité et étendre son poulailler. Par conséquent elle pourra  avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne et participer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle projette d’élargir au maximum  son poulailler.

loans.use: acheter des poussins a élever et qui seront déstinés a la vente

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph who is one of our borrowers. He is an established farmer living in Kitale, where he has been involved in farming for 18 years, and which has been his main source of income. He produces and sells milk, and crops like maize. He has a passion for farming because of the returns he gets and it is a source of livelihood for his family. His biggest challenge is seasons of long rains which spoil crops on the farm, and also pests.

Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have good terms of loan repayment. This loan will help him to pay school fees for his children, and will also uplift their living standards. He really appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for adding value to his farmwork.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hery Lanto Evelyne

texts.fr:
Hery lanto a 33ans. Elle habite dans une zone rurale. Elle fait partie de ces personnes très zélées lorsqu’il s’agît de travailler. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de  taxi-bus et a 3 enfants, âgés de 14, 10 et 4ans, tous scolarisés. Son objectif est de devenir un revendeur en demi-gros. 
Elle a ouvert son magasin général en octobre 2014. Lors de son ouverture, son locale était encore étroit et elle manquait de matériel. Mais elle est assez déterminée pour son extension et développement.

loans.use: acheter des sacs de riz, de légumes secs, des poissons séchés, farines, sucres, charbons

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is married with five children.Two are in secondary school and other two are in primary school. He lives in Vituka in Temeke District of Dar es salam. Ally sells maize in retail. He buys the maize in large quantities from nearby regions, stock them and resell them in retail. Ally is planning to improve his business by having enough stock of maize especially in this rain season. Because roads to up country are not easily passable during rain seasons,it is better to have enough stock now.
  Extra stock demands some more packaging materials, carriage costs and storage costs.
To make his plan work Ally is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Mrs. Hortencia lives in a low-income area. The need to have an income to support her family and her partner’s unemployment situation made her decide to start selling kitchen goods and bed spreads. She has three daughters, who are 12, 11, and 6 years old, and a 9 year-old son. She lives in Unión Libre with Francisco Ibarra, who helps her sell products door-to-door. Little by little, sales have increased, and Hortensia has reinvested in her business yet she does not have enough to cover her clients demand.

Hortencia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$300, which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to increase her sales and income. She plans on paying back the loan in a 3-6 months term. You can help this family get ahead, now is the moment to contribute.

La señora Hortencia vive en un lugar de muy bajos recursos, la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para mantener a su familia y la falta de empleo de su pareja hicieron que ella se dedicara a la venta de productos de cocina y colchas. Ella tiene tres hijas de 12, 11 y 6 años de edad y un hijo de 9 años, vive en unión libre con Francisco Ibarra, quien le ayuda a vender sus productos casa por casa. Poco a poco las ventas se han incrementado y Hortencia ha reinvertido en su negocio, pero no le es suficiente para satisface las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Hortencia requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizara para la compra de mercancía, para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, ella palea devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, hoy es el momento de cooperar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is a young woman of 38 years. She hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria has three (3) children, and has been a LAPO client for over 7 years; she had proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($650) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 27 years old, married with three children. Her husband works in the countryside harvesting sugar cane. Teresa works selling fruits and vegetables to the people of her community. She does not have a shop, but carries her produce around with her to sell around the town. With this loan, she will be able to install a place in her house from where she can sell her produce. She is part of the group called Tierra Nueva 2 (New Land 2), together with Zenaida Solano Molina, who raises pigs, and Maria Trinidad M. Solano, who has a grocery shop. They would like to increase their inventory with the loan, enabling them to increase their sales and earnings.

Teresa tiene 27 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha de la caña. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como vendedor ambulante entre los habitantes de su comunidad, con el préstamo quiere instalar un local en su casa. Forma parte del grupo llamado Tierra Nueva 2, junto con: doña Zenaida Solano Molina (crianza de puercos), María Trinidad M. Solano (tienda de abarrotes). Ellas quieren aumentar el abastecimiento de sus negocios con el préstamo y así aumentar las ventas y las ganancias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dewi

texts.id:
The economic difficulty is affecting Nyoman Dewi and family. Without giving up; having capital, enthusiasm and hard work, with the loan of Rp 1.400.000 (about USD175), purchased 3 piglets using Rp 600.000 (USD75), each at Rp 200.000. The remainder will be use for feed and supplies. Pig usually is ready for slaughter at 6 months, generating gross income of Rp 2.200.000 (USD275) from cost of Rp 1.000.000 (USD125). With the earnings she can save for a plot of land for retirement as all her children are already married. With this loan from DINARI, she hopes to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kesulitan ekonomi sangat dirasakan Nyoman Dewi dan keluarganya. Namun Nyoman Dewi tidak putus asa.Bermodalkan semangat dan kerja keras Ni Nyoman Dewi meminjam uang dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.400.000,-.dan membeli 3 ekor babi penggemukan dengan harga Rp.600.000.Harganya perekor Rp. 200.000, sisa uangnya dipakai untuk modal pakan .Babi bisa dipanen setelah berumur 6 bulan . Pendapatan kotor Rp.2.200.000,- pengeluaran pakannya Rp.1.000.000,-.Jadi penghasilan bersih yang diperoleh oleh Ni Nyoman Dewi Rp 600.000- per 6 bulan. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh Ni Nyoman Dewi ditabung untuk bisa membeli sepetak tanah untuk hari tuanya karena semua anak-anaknya sudah berumah tangga. Harapan Ni Nyoman Dewi supaya Dinari bisa terus memberikan pinjaman untuk usahanya ini.

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets (Membeli pakan ternak dan bibit babi untuk penggemukkan)

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Oeun was married in 1995 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She started her business in 2003. Her husband is a construction worker. He sometimes goes to work far from home and does not come home very often. Her two daughters are studying at the primary school in the village. The youngest son is at home.

She is requesting a loan of $100 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to purchase additional vegetables and resell them in her village.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling vegetables in village

loans.name: Faasagaone

texts.en: Faasagaone is a 32 year old lady and is married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy new fishing gear, such as the spears, goggles, fishing nets and a new canoe, for her husband. The rest of the loan was used to buy metal iron roofing material, cement, and timbers for repairing the roof and the old floor of her house. Her husband is a very good fisherman and he’s the one who work at the business while she provides financial help through her loans. She sells strings of fish around the village  three days per week and makes a profit of $140ST($56USD) per day but more at the Sunday morning fish market. Her business is growing very well and is very helpful to the family needs.

loans.use: To buy new fishing gear and for home improvement

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio C. D. is married and has a 2 year old daughter. He got married very young, and he started looking for a job in order to support his wife and daughter. However, his search was not successful. His parents, with whom they live at the moment, recommended and helped him in 2004 to open a stand to sell fruits and vegetables, and that is how he started his own business, with which he hopes to get ahead and be able to buy a house for his wife and daughter. Currently he has a steady list of clients that buy different products from him.

Julio wishes to expand his business by buying more fruits and vegetables of the season. That is why he is requesting a $475 loan which he will repay in 5 months. With this money, Julio will be able to buy not only more merchandise, but also expand his business so that he can offer a better service to his clients. With your help Julio will be able to save enough money so that he can offer a house to his wife and daughter where they all can live and grow old together.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio C. Díaz, está casado y tiene una hija de 2 años. Sin embargo Julio se casó muy joven, es por eso que comenzó a buscar trabajo para poder mantener los gastos de su hija y de su esposa. Sin embargo la búsqueda era fallida. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, que es con quien está viviendo actualmente, que en el 2004 le recomendó y ayudó a hincar un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, fue como comenzó a hacerse de su propio negocio, para poder salir adelante y en un futuro poder tener una casa para él y su esposa e hija. Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes que cada vez le van solicitando diferentes cosas.

Julio Desea crecer su negocio comprando más frutas y verduras de la temporada. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Julio podrá surtir su negocio además de ampliarlo un poco para así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Julio podrá juntar dinero para poder ofrecerle una casa a su esposa e hija. Y así crecer juntos.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for his busines

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: M. Marifat is 48 years old. She lives in the B.Gafurov region and she is married and has 5 children. She dreams of a happy future for her children so she works hard to make that dream become a reality. Mrs. M. was previously engaged in selling food products but had  stiff competition so she decided to change the direction of her business and start a new business selling  house wares. She opened a small trade outlet where she sells her products. Now Mrs. M. requests the loan of 3100 STJ to replenish her inventory.

loans.use: To replenish her inventory

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs. Patricia is is a mother and sole support of her family. She specializes in hairdos for dancers, so her work is well paid. She works on her own beauty salon and also makes house calls.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Patricia madre de familia es el sustento de esta, es especialista en peinar a bailarines, razon por la cual es bastante cotizado su trabajo, atiende en su propio salon y a domicilio.

loans.use: Buying materials for beauty shop (Compra de material para el salon de peinados)

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.es:
Fatima and Carmen belong to the communal bank called 'Torcaza'. Fatima has been a member for 1 year and Carmen for about 8 months.

Fatima is 28 years old and single. Fatima goes to the different fairs in the region where she purchases cereals, cheeses, and small animals which she then sells at the local supermarket called Nery Garcia. Also, Fatima has been selling clothes in the supermarket called Las Americas for the past month.

Carmen is a 30 year-old single mother. She has one daughter. Carmen owns a pharmacy located in the central square in the city of Ayacucho. She has been doing this for the past 7 months.

Fatima and Carmen need a loan of about $150 usd each. This money will be used to purchase clothes such as pants, shirts, intimate apparel, beauty products and medicine.

Fatima and Carmen wish to one day own a huge super-store, to help their sisters and to fully stock the pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Fátima y Carmen pertenecen al Banco Comunal Torcaza hace 1 año y 8 meses respectivamente.

Fátima es soltera y tiene 28 años, Fátima viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra cereales, quesos y animales menores, que vende en el mercado Nery García. Además Fátima vende ropa en el mercado Las Américas, actividad que esta realizando hace 1 mes.

Mientras que Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Carmen tiene una farmacia ubicada en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 7 meses.

Fátima y Carmen necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, medias, productos de tocador y medicinas.

Los sueños de Fátima y Carmen son tener una tienda grande, ayudar a sus hermanas e implementar más su farmacia.

loans.use: Fatima and Carmen need a loan of about $150 usd each to purchase clothes such as pants, shirts, intimate apparel, beauty products and medicine.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Señora Blanca P. Aranda lives with her husband (señor Genaro Mariscal) and their two daughters in their own home. It is located in the Tacagua zone in the Ciudad de La Paz in Ladera Oeste. Blanca is a domestic employee (a cook) in a private home, and her husband makes a living by repairing appliances in a shop in their zone.

Their objective is to provide their daughters with a space. The credit will go towards refurbishing their two rooms since they lack plaster and interior paint. This is the fourth time she is requesting a loan and the socio-economic anaylisis done qualifies her favorably to be approved for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca P. Aranda vive con su esposo (el señor Genaro Mariscal y sus dos hijas) en casa propia, el domicilio esta en la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz (Ladera Oeste). La señora Blanca es empleada domestica (cocinera) en un domicilio particular y su esposo se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos en un taller de su zona.

A objeto de brindar un espacio para sus hijas, el crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de dos habitaciones ya que carece de revoque y pintura interior. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder al crédito solicitado.

loans.use: Refurbishment of her home

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul G. is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised seven children, only three of whom are still under their care. For 15 years, Shamigul has been working in the local market in the city selling green gram, buckwheat, and peas. These legumes are very popular in Tajikistan where they can be cooked into soups and cereals, both of which are very nourishing, healthy and tasty. Her business is very stable and generates the main source of income for the family, because Shamigul's husband is currently unemployed.

Today, she is requesting 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for 6 months. The loan shall be spent to increase her stock of green gram, buckwheat and peas for selling. Shamigul thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy green gram, buckwheat, and peas to increase her stock of the goods

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji and her husband, M. L., live in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan; they have been married for the last 40 years. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. Her first son and daughter are married. The next eldest son completed his 10th standard and the next eldest daughter completed her 7th standard. Razia baji has run her own vegetable shop for the last 10 years and earns a good profit; her husband runs his own tea stall. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she wants a loan to buy more materials to expand her vegetable business.

Razia baji's loan group includes four more members. Safia baji wants a loan to buy buffalo and Sardaran baji seeks a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Zubaidan baji would like a loan for her barber saloon. Najma baji wants a loan for her husband’s business; he is an electrician and wants to buy some electric tools.

The funds from this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans; if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu Iddi is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is married and has three children. She runs a salon business in Buguruni in Dar-es-Salaam, Tanzania. Her business is three years old. Her business dream is to run a big and more modern beauty salon, but capital is a limiting factor. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase piglets, build a pigpen, and buy supplies to grow rice.

loans.name: Eliécer Francisco

texts.es: El joven Eliécer C. tiene la edad de 25 años habita en la ciudad de Managua, actualmente vive  con su mamá, es soltero. Se desempeña como cocinero en el Hotel Campo Real desde hace tres años y medio, éste joven estudia los domingos para salir adelante, y también sacar adelante a su mamá y hermanos, por situaciones difíciles no ha podido terminar un cuarto que con mucho esfuerzo empezó a construir, y así tener un poco de independencia, el sueño de este joven es llegar a ser un profesional y así darle una vida mejor a su familia. Este joven solicita el crédito para poder terminar de comprar los materiales de construcción  y terminar de construir su habitación
texts.en:
Eliécer C. is a young man who is 25 years of age and lives in the city of Managua. Currently, he lives with his mother and is single. He works as a cook at the Campo Real Hotel where he has been for three years, and he studies on Sundays in order to get ahead. He wants to help his mother and siblings get ahead also and, due to some difficulties, he has not been able to finish a room that he started to build with much effort so he could have a little independence. This youngster’s dream is to get to become a professional and to provide a better life for his family. This young man requests a loan so that he can finish buying construction materals and finish building his room.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish building a bedroom.

loans.name: Bahram

texts.en:
Bahram B. is the loving father of three sons. He works as a postmaster, but this job is not permanent and it comprises only 10% of his income. His wife is housewife. 

For almost 10 years, Bahram has had his own business raising livestock. He buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them. He started his business with a small amount of money. He was also able to use money he made to expand his business. 

He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. Because meat is very popular, Bahram would like to purchase four calves, fatten them, and then sell them during winter season. Bahram would like to be able count on you for your help!

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Ta Thi B. is 61 years old.  She has 5 children and 3 of them are grown-up.  She lives in Tam Dong Commune, Me Linh District, Ha Noi.  In 2005, she joined TYM and accessed her first loan to invest in her business. Now, her main income comes from traditional medicine. For the next  loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9 million  to invest in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Alice Nanfuka ‘S Group

texts.en:
Alice is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45-year-old widowed mother of 5 children, aged 6 to 19 years. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a two-roomed house with six people and she is the only the breadwinner at home They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She runs a stall at her home. Alice works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for one month and has applied for her first loan. She wants to use the loan to buy more produce for her stall.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her stall in order to prepare for the Christmas season

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim L., 57, is a widow who lives in Kampong Cham with her child. She is a true entrepreneur who operates a grocery store from her home. She sells various kinds of goods and is able to make approximately $7.50 USD every day. She is aided by her child, who works as a worker and make $5.00 USD each day. 

Mrs. Kim L. would like to take a loan of $1000 USD to rebuild her store, add groceries to her inventory, and purchase rice to resell.

loans.use: To rebuild her store, add groceries, and purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Rochelle Anne

texts.en:
Rochelle is a young mother. She is only 20 years old and married to Noel. They have a seven-month-old daughter named Quinnie Fhail and they are currently living in the rural village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela. The place has rough road conditions, and residents need to take a ferry boat to go to the town proper of Tumauini. According to Rochelle, they have a happy family despite the challenges that they are experiencing.

Rochelle runs a small store in their village that offers basic commodities for household needs. Due to her early marriage, she needs to be more patient and responsible to assist her husband in providing the needs of their family. She works hard for the improvement of her store which is already one year old. Her husband is a part-time worker in the printing and art design business in their village.

Rochelle Anne wants to receive a loan of PHP 4, 000 that she will use to increase merchandise such as coffee, sugar, salt, canned goods, and other basic commodities. She is also planning to use the loan to start a small canteen business, selling snacks to earn extra income. She believes that “Time is gold” that is why she chooses to maximize her time in the business and starts from 5:00 in the morning, working until 8:00 in the evening.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and start a new canteen business

loans.name: Zubridin

texts.en: A. Zubridin lives in Shahristan, the high-mountain region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Zubridin works in the livestock business and because he is experienced, he also works on the collective farm. He has one cow and four rams. Zubridin wants to have a big flock so he works hard to accomplish his dream. Zubridin has worked in livestock for 5 years and his sons help him in this family business. Zubridin is applying for a business support loan of 1500 STJ for 6 months to build a new barn.

loans.use: To build a barn

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.en:
Lidia Marina A. C. is a married, 45-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has four children ranging in age from 14 to 20, all two years apart. They all presently work and live at home with the family.

Lidia Marina operates a small butcher stand that sells pork. She would like to borrow money in order to purchase two more pigs for sale. For this reason, Lidia Marina seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has previously received loans from Fundación León, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the stand’s monthly revenue. Lidia Marina dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and save enough money to provide a sound education for her children.

Lidia Marina A. C. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: To purchase two pigs

loans.name: Calisto Simeao

texts.pt:
Calisto nasceu em inhambane tem 38 anos de idade estudou ate a 12 classe casado e pai de 2 filhos o primeiro de 5 anos e o segundo de 1 ano  somente o mais velho e que se enconbtra a estudar


Calisto sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia apos concluir a 5 classe. Seu irmao mais velho e transferido para namaacha e vem junto com ele, chegado ele continua com os seus estudos e consequentimente ganha uma bolsa de estudo de assistente juridico e e colocado para trabalhar no tribunal da namaacha como assistente juridico, mas como a sua instituiçao não estava oficializada não tinham direito de salario. A educaçao estava a fazer contratos e ele e um dos beneficiados já e do quadro com categoria de adjunto pedagogico trabalha das 7h as 12h auferindo por mês um valor de 5.900.00mt. para alem da educaçao tem sido solicitado para fazer trabalhos de advogacia pelos seus clientes que apesar de ser demorado tem havido sucesso de acordo com o processo em causa. Calisto com ajuda da sua esposa que e funcionaria da saude consegue colectar um valor e inicia a sua obra, não consegue terminar e aproxima se aos serviços da  hluvuku solocitando um valor de 15.000.00mt para dar continuidade da mesma que por motivo de chuvas os tijolos partecem com muita facilidade. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua irma e sobrinho que vivem com ele em sua casa.



Este e o primeiro emprestimo de calisto na hluvuku e kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt  seram usados para comprar material de construçao para concluir a sua varranda que esta a ser consumida pelas aguas das chuvas, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir com a manuntençao e pintura da sua casa.
texts.en:
Calisto was born in Inhambane. He is 38 years old and went to school until the 12th grade. He is married, and he is the father of 2 children. The first is 5 years old, and the second is 1 year old. Only the oldest is in school. Calisto left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, after he finished the 5th grade. His oldest brother was transferred to Namaacha and he came with him. When he arrived he continued with his studies, and consequently he earned a scholarship to be a legal assistant. He found work in the courts as a legal assistant, but as his institution was not acredited, he did not have the right to a salary. The school entered into contracts, and he was one of the beneficiaries. He is already on the staff as an assistant instructor. He works from 7:00am until 12:00pm and earn a monthly sum of 5,900MT. Besides teaching he has also does advocacy work for his clients who, in spite of being delayed, have had success in the cause process. Calisto, with help from his wife, who is a health official, was able to collect enough money to begin his work, but he was unable to finish so he approached Hluvuku and solicited a loan for 15,000MT to continue because the rain causes his bricks to break very easily. Besides his children, he is responsible for his sister and nephew who live with him in his house. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to purchase construction materials to finish his veranda that is being eroded from the rain. He is confident that he will pay off the loan before maturity and request another to finish the maintenance as well as paint his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Delia es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Delia junto a su esposo se dedican al alquiler de maquinarias de construcción a instituciones. Además tienen un taller mecánico en un local alquilado.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una mezcladora.
Los sueños de Delia son tener un local propio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "Golondrinas" (Swallows) Community Bank. Delia is married, is 39 years old and has five children. Delia and her husband are dedicated to renting construction machines to companies. In additiona, they have a mechanic shop in a rented store. Delia needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a mixer. Delia's dreams are to own her own shop and that her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mixer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace más de 8 años tiene una tienda de comestibles en un local que alquila mensualmente, su deseo de generar mayores ingresos la motivaron a implementar esta bodega que en la actualidad tiene una buena cantidad de mercadería, y esto es lo que la ha motivado a seguir adelante, renovando e innovando con los productos que ofrece. Victoria no descansa para atender su bodega, y sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes acuden a ella para comprar los productos de primera necesidad diariamente. Hasta el momento los esfuerzos de su arduo trabajo han dado frutos, por lo que Victoria desea, para el futuro, acrecentar su capital de trabajo. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y está renovando su compromiso de trabajar por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero que Victoria está solicitando será invertido en la compra de más mercadería, en gaseosas, dulces y alimentos envasados.
texts.en:
Victoria, 40, lives with her two children in a rented house. For over eight years she has had a food store in a location that she rents by the month. Her desire to generate greater income motivated her to start this store. The store currently has a good amount of merchandise. This is what has motivated her to get ahead renovating and innovating with the products that she offers. Victoria works tirelessly tending her store. Her neighbors, who are her primary customers, come to her to buy their daily basic needs. Her hard work has paid off. In the future, Victoria wishes to increase her working capital. This is her third loan with MFP. She is renewing her promise to work for the well being of her community bank. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise like soft drinks, sweets, and canned food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena, a single mother with a teenage son, is a fitness instructor and personal trainer in Mountain View, California. She has taught aerobics and yoga classes for several years and started personal training two years ago while studying Biology at San Jose State University.  Serena has invested in a digital camera and computer to build a website for her personal training venture. Now she wants to complete additional training, so that she can offer more services to her clients.

With a $5000 loan, Serena can complete a higher level certification in Sports Fitness, which will enable her to serve her clients better and help them reach their personal fitness goals.

loans.use: Certification in Sports Fitness

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: anna N. est parent beneficiaire habitant la zone de camberene.elle evolue dans le domaine de l'aviculture avec une experience de sept ans.elle demande un pret decent mille frs afin d'augmenter son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Anna N. is a UIMCEC client who lives in Camberene. She has 7 years experience working in poultry farming. She is requesting a 100,000 franc loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur s’est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce de chaussure, il exerce son commerce dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. Il a déjà obtenu de wages un premier crédit qui lui a permis de relancer ce commerce et qu’il a bien remboursé. Actuellement la demande de ses clients est très élevée, pour pouvoir tous et bien les satisfaire il doit augmenter son stock,  il sollicite alors de wages son deuxième crédit pour acheter 50 paires de chaussures.
Il est marié et père d’un petit garçon qui fait l’école primaire. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
In 2000, this gentlemen got started in the commerce of shoes. He operates his business at the local market of Hedzranawoé. He has already obtained from WAGES an initial loan, which he repaid, that enabled him to reinvigorate his business. The demands of his customers are many right now. To do well in satisfying them all, he must increase his inventory. He is therefore requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy 50 pairs of shoes. He is married and the father of a young boy who is in primary school. With the revenues from his commerce, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Maktym's Group

texts.en:
Maktym, 32, is the group’s leader. Her husband is a builder. He works in Russia and sends money to his family. As for her, she deals in clothes. Mainly she sells children’s and teenager's clothes. Upon moving to another city, about four years ago, she was fortunate enough to meet a new neighbor, who suggested she start a business of trading in clothes. Her neighbor even lent her $120 of initial capital to begin.

Now Maktym earns $470 a month. Along with her work she raises four children alone, as her husband is away. However, due to her business, they have been able to furnish their house, purchase domestic products, sell the car and buy out the container where she works. Before fall starts Maktym is keen to obtain a loan to purchase more clothes to broaden the assortment and attract more customers. In future, Maktym and her husband plan to buy a big house and a car. They also want to build a new shop next to their house and breed cattle.

Muktarali is the father of three children. He works in the market with his daughter. They sell seasonal clothes. Muktarali needs to obtain a loan so that he can purchase more clothes: shirts with long sleeves, duffels and warm pants. He is desperate to provide an opportunity for his daughter to go to college.

Kibira, 37, sells manufactured goods: CD’s, DVD’s sunglasses, etc. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have four children. Kibira needs to purchase more goods but to do that, she needs a loan.

Chyngyz, 24, has two children. To provide for his family, he sells women’s, men’s and children’s shoes. He was lucky to buy out a container. He is thinking of doing some refurbishment in his house. Chyngyz needs a loan to purchase more shoes.

Lira, 36, a mother of five children, trades in light industry products: women’s gowns, T-shirts, and shoes. Lira needs a loan to purchase gowns, pants and galoshes. Her ultimate dream is to live in a big house and give her children a proper education.

============================= --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for several stores

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is very patient in her vegetable-vending business. She roams around her village going from one house to another to sell her merchandise. She is glad that, through her diligence, she can generate a daily income of PHP 200. She needs to budget it wisely to meet the needs of her family.

Julieta is 36 years old and a mother who is full of hopes and dreams for her family. She has four children and two of them are already in high school. She hopes that, through her business, she can continue to send them to school.

With this in mind, Julieta is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 4,000 that will serve as business capital. She knows that this amount will pave the way for business development and an increase in income.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena V. (0) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Maninoa, Siumu. She is married and has six adult children. Elena owns and operates a tailoring business, providing children's tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 800 WST a month. In 2004, Elena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,200 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase a new sewing machine. Elena is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Semugenya's Group

texts.en:
Semugenya J. is a hardworking woman with a retail shop in Lweru trading centre. She is 45 years old and married. She is responsible for twelve children between the ages of four and 24 years, some her own and some, orphans. 

Semugenya used to be a farmer but was affected by the drop in price of produce and so changed to retail sales. From her shop she makes 200,000 UGX in profits, mostly attributable to the use of her loan and the quality of her products. 

At the moment, Semugenya is requesting a loan to restock her shop with more goods and to pay for part of her children’s school fees. Semugenya dreams of becoming a wholesaler as well as educating her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more products

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthon P. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell.

Mrs. Chanthon P. is 40 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mol Try, is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmela Constanzia

texts.es:
La señora CARMELA CONSTANZIA J. A., tiene 70 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  es analfabeta, refiere que desde pequeña empezó a trabajar en el campo. CARMELA tiene 5 hijos todos mayores; pero a su cargo tiene 3 nietos que se quedaron huérfanos a quienes apoya otorgándoles sus alimentos y estudios porque su madre falleció y su padre actualmente tiene otro compromiso y no se hace cargo de ellos. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de leche . Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró leche y cantifloras (embase) para vender la leche en su pueblo.

Con este crédito de 300 nuevos soles también volverá a comprar leche al por mayor para seguir vendiendo y así obtener dinero para seguir apoyando a sus nietos.
La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
CARMELA CONSTANZIA is 70 years old and lives in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN LUIS communal bank. She is illiterate and states that she has worked the land since she was a little girl. She has 5 adult children but she is responsible for the wellbeing of 3 grandchildren who were orphaned when their mother died and it is Carmela who must see to their food and education because their father is involved elsewhere and does not take care of his children. She buys and resells milk. With her first 300 sol loan she bought milk and containers in which to sell it in town. With this 300 sol loan she will buy milk again at wholesale to continue selling it and obtain profits with which to continue to support her grandchildren. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can pay for her grandchildren's education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 28, trades all kinds of utensils. She hawks to sell and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Monica buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure utensils in bulk to expand her business.
Monica is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town; however, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Mr. Kheav Boran, have been married since 1983. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment and the other lives at home. The youngest son is in school. Her family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. Her husband is shown in the photo. 

Mach has been selling jackfruit since 1999. She buys the fruit from the Neak Meas Market (fruit market) to sell at her shop in Phnom Penh. Besides this business, she also rents part of her house to garment factory workers. Her husband has been driving motor taxi for two years. 

Mach hopes to expand her business and make it bigger, so that she can generate more income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy additional jackfruit for resale.

loans.use: To buy more jackfruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a new motor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora ELIZABETH tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, talcos y joyas. Este es su primer préstamo de 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de otros cosméticos como: cremas, rubores, deliniadores, desodorantes, talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes, etc. para tener en stock y aumentar sus ventas. Ella sueña con alquilar un puesto en el mercado en donde pueda vender sus cosméticos con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
ELIZABETH, 33, lives in the PORVENIR district of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the CARIDAD II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, lives with her life partner, and has two dependent children. She sells cosmetics like: lipsticks, creams, perfumes, colognes, deodorants, talcs and jewelry. This is her first, 300 new sol, loan which she plans to use to buy more cosmetics like those listed above in order to have sufficient stock to increase sales. She dreams with having a stall in the market where she can sell her cosmetics more often and more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, blushes, eyeliners, deodorants, talcs, colognes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Ilza Izabel

texts.en: Senora D. has a pulpería, a small general store based in her home. She sells commonly used items like rice, sugar, beans and a wide variety of other items. She has had this business for six years and now has established clients that she sells to, either accepting cash or occasionally extending credit to them. Senora D. has a very good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise for resale. With the help of these loans, Senora D. says that her sales have increased and her family has seen an improvement in their income. She and her husband have a six-year-old who is in third grade. Ilza’s goal is to provide a better tomorrow for her family even in the face of the challenges of increasing prices and a poor economy.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Jeisson Jesús

texts.es:
Jeisson V. es un caballero que se dedica a la venta de productos varios en su pequeña pulpería donde oferta diversidad de productos como los comestibles como el pollo y también productos médicos tales como pastillas, medicamentos, entre otros. 

Actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los productos y por esta razón es que solicita el crédito esperando ser beneficiado para así continuar con dicha labor y llevar el sustento a su mesa.
texts.en:
Jeisson V. is a young man who works selling different items in his small variety store. He sells food such as chicken, and also medical products like pills, medicine and more. Currently he needs to buy the products and that is why he is asking for a loan. He hopes that it will help him continue with his work and bring food to his table.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for his store

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and he and his wife live in Gladkovka, Kherson region, a predominantly agricultural area of Ukraine.

Volodimir owns a greenhouse where he plants and grows early spring vegetables and then sells them wholesale in the markets of his region. He launched this enterprise about fifteen years ago. Currently, he has 8,000 Grivnyas (approx. $1,000) invested in this trade. His net profit amounts to 3,500 Grivnyas a month.

Volodimir is requesting an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and firewood for his greenhouse.

Volodimir is very sociable and communicative. He is also a man of integrity and relates to all his competitors with due openness and honesty. Volodimir always tries to achieve all his goals. We believe his natural vigor and perseverance will help this borrower to repay the current loan and succeed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds and firewood for his greenhouse

loans.name: Monserrate Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Monserrate es  una de las socias activas del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche ubicado en la capital manabita una ciudad que goza de clima cálido perfecto para el cultivo de frutas tropicales,  nuestra socia es comerciante  de accesorios para el hogar elaborados en plástico, sábanas y otros utensillos  necesarios para  el hogar que los ofrece puerta a puerta recorriendo las calles de su comunidad dejando a crédito de hasta 10 semanas.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Monserrate podrá invertir en mas productos  como cortinas de baño, basureros, coladeras, tachos para agua,  sábanas, etc. para cumplir con algunos pedidos  que tiene por entregar, la ganancia no es mucha pero le ayuda a salir adelante ya que algunos productos los compra a buen precio.

A futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante pues  a ella le gusta la cocina y  prepara deliciosos platos y ese es uno de sus sueños, espera no tarde en hacerse realidad y para ello está reuniendo el capital poco a poco
texts.en:
Monserrate is one of the active members of the Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche Communal Bank. It is located in the capital, Manabita. This city enjoys a warm climate, which is perfect for growing tropical fruits. She sells plastic home accessories, sheets, and other necessary products for the home. She sells door to door and travels the streets of her community. She gives credit for up to ten weeks. With this new loan Monserrate will be able to invest in more products like shower curtains, trash cans, colanders, water containers, and sheets, etc. to fill some orders that she needs to deliver. The earnings are not much, but it helps her get ahead because she buys some products at a good price. In the future she would like to have a restaurant. She likes to cook and prepare delicious dishes. It is one of her dreams, and she hopes it will not be long before she can make her dream come true. Little by little she is gathering her money to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shower curtains, trash cans, colanders, water containers,  sheets and more plastic products

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina B. prepares kenkey for sale at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Sabina has received a junior high education. Her husband is an internal car decorator. With the income she gets from her sales, she supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more corn for the making of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to enhance her children’s education.

To prepare her kenkey she buys maize from the market, soaks it in a lot or enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn, leaves it to proof until the next day. She divides the proofed dough into two, uses one for her firm half-cooked dough (mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough) and mixes the rest of the uncooked one with the half cooked. She moulds them into balls and raps them in corn husk. She then cooks them again until it becomes soft to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.

She is demonstrating how the corn dough is mixed.

loans.use: Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more corn for the making of kenkey.

loans.name: Rashda's Group

texts.en: Rashda, the wife of M. A., lives in a city famous for its shrines named Borewala, Pakistan.  Rashda, who is uneducated because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses, spends her time taking care of her family and doing household work. Her husband is a mechanic employed in a motor workshop where he repairs all type of vehicles from bicycles to cars.  He is an expert in his work but unfortunately hasn't been able to start his own workshop due to a lack of capital. Therefore Rashda has decided to apply for a loan so that her husband can open his own workshop by purchasing the necessary repair tools.

loans.use: To buy tools necessary to start a motor workshop

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung T. D. is 51 years old. She lives in Phu Man village, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has three children. The first son has a job and has income. She not only grows rice, but also raises pigs to scratch out a living. In 2008, she joined SEDA's activities to gain access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used largely to buy food for chickens, have always been repaid punctually. In the next round, she would like to borrow 7.840.000 VND to invest in her livestock. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family can afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: To invest in her livestock

loans.name: Mina Shakiba Group

texts.en:
Mina is the daughter of S. and the leader of Mina Shakiba group. She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and she needs a small loan for her business of tailoring because she wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business to make more and better dresses. 

So she has a requested a loan and she wants to expand and move her sewing business forward. She wishes she could become a famous dressmaker in the future.

 She is very happy with this small loan  that helps poor people in Afghanistan. She thanks all lenders of AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new  sewing machine

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en: Jenipher K.  is a 44 year old businesswoman who is married with four children in school. Her eldest child appears in the photograph. Jenipher  has a  cosmetics business located in Kikuubo behind KCB Bank, and adjacent to the Hoima Central Market. She has been running this business for over four  years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of cosmetics (lotions, cream, shampoo, soap, etc.) in order to boost her business. Jenipher also owns a pepper farm as well as a dairy farm. On school holidays her eldest daughter helps her in the shop.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetics (lotions, cream, shampoo, soap, etc.) in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Anna May

texts.en:
26-year-old Anna May C. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has a 9-year-old child. To make a living, Anna May owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Anna May has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anna May joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anna May has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anna May is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Anna May from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es: Orfilia tiene 53 años, sus dos hijos son ya mayores e independientes, vive con su madre Petronila, acaba de cumplir 100 años y por ello debe cuidarla más, juntas viven solas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la variedad de trabajos para sacar adelante a sus hijos, es así que en la actualidad sin ya tener tantas responsabilidades, decidió solo cuidar de su madre, desde entonces se dedica a trabajar en varios oficios, como es la venta de paltillos y bocaditos. Asimismo vende productos energéticos y productos de belleza. es así que ha logrado obtener ganancias considerables que le ayuden a mantenerse ella misma y a su mamá. Por el momento continuará trabajando pero lo que le hace más feliz es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza, además comprar dulces y abastecerse de más productos energéticos.
texts.en:
Orfilia is 53 years old. Her two children are already grown and independent. She lives with her mother Petronila. She just turned 100 years old and because of this she must take care of her more. They live alone together in their own house. Since she was very young, she has had a variety of jobs to get her children ahead. Now that she has fewer responsibilities, she has dedicated herself to taking care of her mother and she works at various things, such as selling snacks and sandwiches. She also sells energy and beauty products. In this way, she has been able to earn considerable income to help her support herself and her mother. At the moment, she will continue to work but what makes her the most happy is that she has her childrens' support. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she has always been characterized by making all of her payments on time. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy beauty products as well as buy candies and energy product supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and energy products.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Banco Comunal: Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui.

Lorenza, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
Yo nací y vivo en la comunidad de Yungaqui y me dedico a la compra de bosques de donde sacamos leña y palos para la construcción de casas. Ya son 10 a 12 años que me dedico al negocio y me va muy bien. También me dedico a la agricultura y ganadería.  A un inicio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar y así mejorar mi negocio. En esta oportunidad necesito el préstamo para completar el dinero que tengo ahorrado y con todo el dinero deseo comprar una vaca lechera que cuesta aproximadamente 2500 a 3000 soles.  Mi anhelo es comprar una casa de material noble. 

(En la fotografía la socia está acompañada de su esposo Américo).
