texts.en:
Introducing Lorenza, a member of the Banco Comunal Taytacha Señor de Coyllority de Yungaqui (Lord of Coyllority of Yungaqui Commual Bank – Taytacha is an Incan religious figure). Lorenza is 40 years old, she is married and has five children. “I was born and raised in the community of Yungaqui, and my activity is buying woods from which we obtain firewood and the poles used in housing constructions. It’s 10 to 12 years I have been working in this field, and things are going very well for me. I also dedicate myself to agriculture and cattle raising. It was somehow hard for me at first, as I didn’t have much working capital; it was then that I had the chance to become a member of the Asociación Arariwa: they helped me through some loans and so I was able to get started and improve my activity. In this case I need a loan to buy a dairy cow that costs between 2500 and 3000 PEN approximately. My dream is to buy a house made of noble materials (such as wood or stone)”. (The man in the picture with the borrower is her husband Américo)

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma S. is from the city of labo Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Norma is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services. Norma has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes.

loans.name: Jamlick

texts.en:
Jamlick has a mixed farm in the town of Nkubu in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for the last nine years and has employed one farm hand. His farm produces bananas, milk and coffee which he sells at a local market. He also earns income from his wood workshop in the same area.

His biggest challenges in farming have been the unfavourable weather conditions and fluctuating milk prices.

Jamlick recently completed his previous loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to upgrade his banana farming. The excess income from this loan will help him in educating his children. He says that this loan will also improve his production on the farm and therefore provide him with a stable income.

He is hopeful that in five years time his farm will have expanded since he plans to plant more bananas and even construct a zero grazing shed for the dairy cows. He comments that Juhudi loans have helped to build him as a farmer. He is now able to do commercialized farming whereas before he used to do subsistence farming.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana farming

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 47 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio comenzó con muy pocos productos, un negocio en el cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos, Hoy con su propio negocio, le está yendo de la mejor manera y ese éxito mesurado lo agradece eternamente a sus padres, además sus clientes más exigentes se sienten satisfechos su planes para el futuro son que el negocio siga creciendo y obtener más ingresos. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que lucha y que disfruta de su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, leche, jugos, pan y detergentes. Sueña con mantener siempre satisfecho a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Lourdes, 47, has had a grocery store for over 12 years. She started out with just a few products but it’s a business that is producing good economic results. Today, with her own business, she is doing better and she is eternally grateful to her parents for this success. In addition, her most demanding customers are satisfied. She plans for her business to continue growing in the future in order to earn more income. She has always been noted for being a woman who works hard and enjoys her work. The financing will be used to buy sweets, beverages, milk, juices, bread and detergents. She dreams with always having satisfied customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma B. is from the village of Danggawan, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old and married. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 38 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio E. Hernández es un hombre profesionista y trabajador que ha dedicado su vida en una escuela preparatoria muy reconocida en la ciudad. El tiene una hija que es la mas chica de todos a la cual esta a punto de casarse y formar su propio hogar, por lo que el desea construir un cuarto independiente de la casa para ofrecerle a su hija un lugar para ella y su futuro esposo privacidad. Para esto el necesita comprar material de construcción para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Marco Antonio E. Hernández is a professional and hard-working man who engages in teaching in a very well-known preparatory school of his town. He has a beloved and lovely daughter who is about to marry and form her own family. For this reason he wants to add an independent room to his house, in order to offer his daughter a place where she and her future husband can enjoy some privacy; and to achieve his project he needs to buy some building materials.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita B. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Enriquita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Enriquita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling delicacies for every different meal and also buying and selling green bananas. She also sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Enriquita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Enriquita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Enriquita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Enriquita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Nataliya used to work as a deputy director at a knitting factory. However, it was closed down and she was forced to launch her own business. Now, Nataliya sells men’s suits, pants, and shirts in the central marketplace of her hometown. She offers a nice selection of assorted inventory at affordable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. This business is the main source of income for Nataliya. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnas. She hopes to continue growing her business in the future.

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnas to purchase 50 winter coats for further retail sale.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Noe Arnulfo

texts.es:
Noe tiene 20 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, decidio estudiar esta carrera porque casi nadie estudia este tipo de carrera, y tiene mayor demanda en este pais y sobre todo le gusta mucho. Recibe ayuda de sus padres.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Este credito es muy importante, porque nos enseña a saber invertir y poder administrar su propio negocio.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Noe is 20 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering.  He lives in Esteli.  He decided to study this career because very few people study for this type of career.  There is a great demand for it in his country.  Above all, he likes it a lot.  He gets help from his parents.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.

He wants to finish his career education, work for a time for a company, and then become independent with his own business.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project of making dairy products

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del banco comunal Las Perlas Manantay, del departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el cual inició con un pequeño capital y lo ha ido incrementando estos 2 años y medio en que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su esposo se encarga de atender en su negocio cuando ella se ausenta.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 soles comprará más productos de primera necesidad (1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 caja de leche grande, 1 doc.  Avena, 1 paquete de sal, 1 bolsa de detergente, 2 cajas de galleta, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, ½  caja de conservas).
La señora Teresa está contenta porque tiene un negocio propio, aunque sea pequeño y agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de concederle los créditos.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is a member of the Las Perlas Manantay communal bank, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, and is married with 4 grown-up children.

She dedicates her time to selling groceries. She started with a little capital and has been increasing it gradually over the two and a half years since she has been working with [the field partner] Manuela Ramos. Her husband looks after the store whenever she is not there.

With this new loan of 2,300 Soles, she will buy more staple goods (1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 bag of noodles, 1 crate of cooking oil, 1 crate of small cartons of milk and 1 of large cartons of milk, 1 dozen bags of oatmeal, 1 pack of salt, 1 bag of detergent, 2 crates of cookies, 3 packs of lavatory paper, ½ a crate of canned foods).

Señora Teresa is happy that she has her own business, small though it may be, and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity to access credit.

loans.use: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 bag of noodles, 1 crate of cooking oil, 1 crate of small cartons of milk and 1 of large cartons of milk, 1 dozen bags of oatmeal, 1 pack of salt, 1 bag of detergent, 2 crates of cookies, 3 packs of lavatory paper, ½ a crate of canned foods

loans.name: Cristina Jimoya's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina J. is from the barangay of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Cristina is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristina J.’s Group. 

Cristina is 57 years old, married to Rogelio J., and is blessed with 7 children, all of whom are now adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store, farming corn, and fattening hogs. Her husband is a farmer. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years. She earns an average of PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

On December 15, 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities.  Cristina has successfully repaid a loan of  PHP 7,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 as her 5th loan, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her corn production and for motorcycle repairs. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments,  and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, and to repair motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa is 53 years old and lives with her son in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, inside her sibling's fence. Her son, age 11, attends a local secondary school. 

Tsevelmaa operates a dairy trading business out of a rented stall at the local market where she sells a variety of dairy products to her customers. She started this business in 2008 after living a nomadic lifestyle. She purchases her dairy products from local herders at wholesale price and sells those products as a retailer. 

After years of running her business, she has built a stable operation and has managed to increase her product line. In the future, Tsevelmaa wants to expand her business so that she can afford to build her own house inside her fence for her family. She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
ose Martin de 48 años de edad casado, labora para DISSUR como tecnico en lectura y reparto desde hace 23 años.  Su esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ella labora para el complejo, tienen 3 hijos los cuales 2 se encuentran estudiando en la secundaria y el menor esta en primaria.  
Necesita este financiamiento para realizar mejoras a su vivienda  parte de la construccion del muro del patio de su casa y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 
Suena con darle buena educacion a sus hijos que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Jose Martin is 48 years old and married.  He has worked for DISSUR (Nicaragua power distributor) as a technician in reading and distribution for 23 years.  His wife helps him with the family expenses.  She works for the complex.  They have three children.  Two of them are in high school, and the youngest is in elementary school.

He needs this loan to make improvements on his house.  He will build a wall to the patio at his house.  This will give his family better living conditions.

He dreams of giving his children a good education and that they become respectable people.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es: Doña Nilda Marisel S. G., es casada, tiene 35 años D. edad, cursó el segundo grado D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 D. los cuales estan estudiando, ella es ama D. casa, su esposo se dedica como jornalero, quiere ampliar su credito para criar y vender a pollos D. engorD.. Por esta razon decidio reunir a otra compañeras vecinas para formar un grupo y D. esa manera solicitar un prestamos para utilizarlo como capital D. trabajo,las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades produtivas como son: venta D. pollos, crianza D. pollos y la crianza D. marranos. Esperan que con dicho prestamos mejoren su condicion D. vida y no ser ambulantes como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Nilda Marisel S. G. is married, 35 years old, and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying.

Nilda is a housewife and her husband works as a laborer.  Nilda requires her loan to buy chickens that she can fatten and then sell.  With this in mind, she decided to get together some friends and neighbors to create a group so that they could request a loan to use as working capital.  The members of this group carry out a range of business activities such as selling chickens, raising chickens and raising pigs.  They hope that through their loans they will improve their living conditions and no longer remain itinerant as they have been up until now.

loans.use: Capital for raising chickens

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alcira. La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 2 hijos de (15 y 6), la socia es consultora de ventas ella trabaja con la empresa de teléfonos celulares Claro y la socia poco a poco está mejorando su casa, ella ahora desea el crédito para terminar de mejorar sus vivienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en mejorar sus vivienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alcira is a member of the “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Alcira is 42 years old, married, and has two children aged 15 and 6.  She is a sales consultant for the cell phone company Claro.  Alcira is gradually making improvements to her home and she would like this loan so that she can finish these improvements.  She is requesting the loan to invest in improving her home.

Alcira is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in making improvements to her home

loans.name: Bernadith Cobero's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernadith C. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Bernadith is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Bernadith C.’s Group". 

Bernadith is 35 years old, married and blessed with four children who are now school-aged. To make a living, she is presently engaged in farming and housekeeping activities. Her husband is a band saw laborer. She’s been engaged in this kind of activity for 10 years already. She’s earning an average amount of not less than Php 2,000 a month from these activities. 

On December 6, 2007, Bernadith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a micro-finance program that reaches out to rural communities, Bernadith has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 14,500. She is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 as her 5th loan which will be used for  house repairs and renovation. She joined the program because she is very much interested in the savings, insurance and other benefits offered by Paglaum MPC.  

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to do house repair and renovations.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bananas and other root crops for her food products.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: To buy root crops and bananas to make food to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 60 años, es una mujer extraordinaria. Pues a pesar D. haber enviudado hace 6 años, sigue manteniendo la vitalidad y alegría D. siempre, pues su razón D. vivir son sus 8 hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío D. Casacoto. DesD. niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir D. ella, “me gusta estar en el campo, me siento tranquila”, menciona. Ya tiene 38 años D. experiencia, en todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes hectáreas D. terrenos agrícolas los cuales con el trascurso del tiempo heredó a sus hijos, para no perder” la tradición familiar”. Sus principales cultivos constan D. papa, habas y arveja, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y cuidado, pues confiesa que su principal pasatiempo es limpiar la maleza que crece entre los sembríos. Asimismo cuida D. sus animales vacunos, los que le proporcionan un dinero extra, pues los enseba y comercializa a buen precio. Su principal dificultad es la falta D. capital D. trabajo, ya que a pesar D. no tener familia que mantener, siente que ya no tiene las mismas fuerzas D. antes para poder sembrar en grandes cantidades.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sembradoras D. Casacoto”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. se siente satisfecha por el apoyo el trabajo que está realizando dentro D. su asociación. Rita, invertirá el crédito en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos D. arveja.
texts.en: Rita, 60, is an extraordinary woman.  Despite having lost her husband 6 years ago, she is as lively and happy as she ever was.  She has 8 children and lives in her own house in the small rural town of Casacoto.  She learned farming when she was just a young girl and it's a life that suits her.  "I like being in the country . . . it's peaceful and soothing", she says.  She has run her own farm for 38 years now and she's added more and more land over the years, land that she hopes to pass on to her children so that they maintain "the family tradition".  She mainly grows potatoes, beans and peas.  She takes great care with her crops and says that her main hobby is clearing the weeds that grow in her fields.  She also raises livestock, an extra source of revenue for her.  Her main problem is a lack of working capital.  She's not as strong as she used to be and, even though she no longer has a family to take care of, she wants to cut back on the number of hectares she farms.  Rita belongs to the Sembradoras D. Casacoto community bank and this is her third MFP loan.  She is pleased with the support that she's received from the association.  Rita will buy supplies of organic manure that she will use to cultivate her pea crop.

loans.use: Comprar sacos de abono orgánico.

loans.name: Jimi

texts.es:
El señor Jimi Emmmanuel V. es un joven trabajador, emprendedor y con visión de 25 años, propietario de un puesto de venta de repuestos de motos. El inicio este negocio hace un año y medio con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles todo lo posible a sus dos hijos pequeños. 
El invertirá el crédito en comprar repuestos de motos para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en: Mr. Jimi Emmanuel Venegas is a hard-working young man. He is an entrepreneur, and with the experience of his 25 years, he is the owner of a motorcycle parts store. He started this business a year and a half ago with the goal of helping his family get ahead and provide everything possible to his two small children. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to expand his business.

loans.use: to invest in spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married and has two adult children. 

He owns a small business growing vegetables in green houses. This business is the only source of income that supports Alexei’s family. He has been in this business for 30 years. Alexei enjoys his business very much and is an example of a good and hard-working person. 

Alexei is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase seeds, fertilizers and materials to fix his green houses. Alexei hopes to harvest good crops and take better care of his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and materials to fix his green houses.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 48 years old. She has four children who are 16 to 22 years old. She is a widow. She has a small supermarket in which she sells foodstuffs, beers, juices and water. She has owned this supermarket for 17 years and it enables her to pay her children’s school fees and meet her family needs. She is requesting a loan to buy items such as juices, fruits etc for her supermarket. With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to build her own family house.

loans.use: To buy juices, fruits etc. to sell

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gladys del Socorro  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años. Ella tiene dos hijos de 16 y 11 años respectivamente por los cuales labora arduamente para que tengan un hogar, educación y salud; inicio lavando y planchando, luego con lo que ganaba fue ahorrando y empezó a vender cosméticos y con los préstamos puso una pulpería y comenzó a vender prenda de oro y plata.
Ella con la ayuda de su hija mayor quien en su tiempo libre se encarga de la venta ha ido saliendo adelante.  Su meta es poder trabajar por si sola sin necesidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
43 year-old Gladys del Socorro is a hard-working, industrious and entrepreneurial woman.  She has two children aged 16 and 11 for whom she works hard so that they have a home, an education and good health.  She started out washing and ironing clothes then saved the money that she was earning and started selling cosmetics.  Through loans, she set up a grocery store and also started selling gold and silver jewelry.

With the help of her eldest daughter, who takes care of the business in her spare time, Gladys has been getting ahead.  Her goal is to be able to work for herself without needing loans.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, products for sale, gold and silver jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 58 years old. She has 6 children who are ages 20-37 years old. Her husband works in peoples' homes. M. Gorette has been a tailor for the past 43 years. This business enabled her to bring up her children and to continuously meet their needs. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and other tailoring materials, such as thread, in order to reinvest in her business. With the profits, she plans renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a 39 year-old married father of four children between ten and sixteen years old.  Luke owns a garage in Mazeras.  His business has been in operation for the last five years and has been a success.
 
Luke has been a KADET client, and this marks his fourth loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase a variety of spare parts for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.  His hope and dream is to own a showroom and to become a successful car salesman.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare parts

loans.name: Maria Petita

texts.es:
Maria de 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un salón de belleza donde trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano atendiendo a sus clientes fijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Trabaja cortando, tinturado cabellos, manicuri, pedicuri etc. Gracias a los estudios de belleza que hizo en su juventud, ahora tiene su propio negocio. Tiene muchas aspiración en su negocio por eso quiere trabajar con mucho esfuerzo para su negocio y su familia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas para su salón de belleza como planchas, secadoras etc. En el futuro quiere expandir su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a beauty salon where she works every day, from very early in the morning, serving her regular customers.  She has many aspirations for her business and so she works from 8.30am to 8.00pm.

Maria works cutting and dying hair, giving manicures and pedicures, etc.  Thanks to the beauty courses that she took in her youth, she now owns her own business.  She has many aspirations for her business and so would like to work very hard for her business and her family.  She would like to use this loan to buy tools for her beauty salon such as hair irons, dryers, etc.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her income so that she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy hair irons and dryers

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children.

Najah has been an owner of a store selling shoes for women, men and kids since 2000. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and to repair his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make additional shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to renovate and to repair his store’s ceiling, doors, and floor and to make additional shelves.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 43 years old and married with two children. She runs a well-organized business where she sells household items such as bananas, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and so on. She is applying for this loan through Kiva to buy more items to sell to her customers, and intends to reinvest the profits in her business so that she can eventually earn enough money to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes and so on.

loans.name: Gellie

texts.en:
Gellie is a 55-year-old married woman residing in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She grows and sells rice crops to her community. Gellie is able to sustain her family through her business.

Gellie is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a better living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene, se dedica a la venta de celulares y la reparación de los mismos y su esposa tiene un restaurant de servicio de comidas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar al por mayor de repuestos, cargadores, audífonos para celulares. Ambas actividades de los conyugues son la fuente de ingresos que tienen para cubrir sus gastos mensuales de la familia. Ellos viven en la casa alquilada  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Rene es casado y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en: Rene sells cell phones and also repairs them.  His wife has a restaurant providing meal service.  He needs the loan to buy spare parts, chargers and earphones for cell phones at wholesale.  The activities of both spouses are the source of income they have to cover monthly family expenses.  They live in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  Rene is married and has two children.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, chargers and earphones for cell phones.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with six children, five boys and one girl. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a hand cart business, operating from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other hand cart operators in the area. He dreams of establishing a charcoal selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a charcoal selling business with the purchase of six sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a charcoal selling business with the purchase of six sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fishery Business Association Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fishery Business Association” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isata is the leader of this group. Isata is 39-year-old, married with 2 children attending secondary schools. Isata sells fresh fish and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Isata will invest in her business by buying cartons of fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Los Microempresarios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Microempresarios” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes  se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, corte de leña y venta de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Diana quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo y centro del grupo, usa una bufanda rayada con colores lilas y rosas.
Ella se dedica a la confección de vestuario y desde la fecha del último crédito su negocio ha funcionado positivamente, ya que pudo invertir en su negocio.
Con el crédito de ésta oportunidad comprará  ropa, telas y moldes para confeccionar novedosos diseños. Sin embargo comenta que ella también se dedica a diseñar exclusivos modelos de ropa. 
Sus metas continúan siendo establecerse en su negocio para abrir una boutique de ropa.
Respecto a su vida personal y específicamente sus sueños de tener su casa propia, Diana se encuentra ahorrando dinero para postular al subsidio habitacional y de ésta manera obtener su casa propia.
Diana presidenta del Banco comunal se encuentra muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y con esto generar mayores ganancias. Además comenta que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank called Los Microempresarios has twenty entrepreneurs who work in different fields some of which are hairdressing, cutting firewood, and clothing sales, among others, with all of them located in the city of Temuco.

Diana, who in the photo is at the bottom and middle of the group, is wearing a purple and pink striped scarf. She is a seamstress and her business has done well during her last loan period and now she can invest in her business.

This loan will give her the opportunity to buy clothes, fabrics and patterns in order to make new designs. She also comments that she also works designing an exclusive line of clothing.

Her goal continues to be that of establishing herself in her business in order to open a clothing boutique. Regarding her personal life and especially her dreams to have her own home, Diana is saving money in order to apply for a housing subsidy in order to buy her own house.

Diana is president of the communal bank and is very grateful for the loans granted through Fondo Esperanza, which have allowed her to invest in her business and which has increased her earnings. Furthermore, she says that with the training she has learned how to manage her income better.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In the surrounding area are a string of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and stunning native flora and fauna, flourishing in the nearby parks. It should be mentioned that 50 percent of the indigenous people known as the Mapuche that exist in the country live in this area.

loans.use: to buy clothes, and fabrics and patterns in order to make new designs

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 47 años, casado con Alejandra de 48 años que fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el centro poblado de puerto amargura, LLochegua. Para él no le fue fácil tener un campo agrícola, pero gracias a su empeño lo consiguio, ahí cultiva y cosecha Cacao y Café. Por lo general, trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha es donde más ayuda requiere, es por eso que contrata peones para que le faciliten en la extracción de su producto. Su jornada de trabaja empieza desde las 7:30 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, asimismo sus productos son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, y éstos varian de acuerdo a la cantidad que entrega a sus compradores. Para el futuro, desea ampliar la siembra de cacao injertado, ya que estos dan un fruto de mayor proporción. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Teofilo esta feliz y contento por el grupo que tiene, por que  son consecuentes con sus objetivos. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para limpiar sus plantas de cacao, asimismo comprar más plantas de cacao injertada para sembrarlas.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 47, is married to Alejandra, 48, and they have four children.  Together they live in their own house, located in the town of Puerto Amargura, Llochegua.

It wasn't easy for him to have farmland, but thanks to his determination he got it.  He grows and harvests cacao and coffee.  Generally he works alone, but during the harvest he needs more help so he hires farmworkers to help him remove his products.  His work day begins at 7:30 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He sells his products in the warehouses of his community, which vary according to how much he delivers to his buyers.

In the future he hopes to increase his planting of grafted cacao, since it yields a crop of greater proportion.  This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments punctually.

Teofilo is happy and contented with the group he has because they are consistent with their goals.

With the 2000 PEN he is requesting he will hire farmworkers to clear his cacao plants and buy more grafted cacao plants to plant.

loans.use: to buy more grafted cacao plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est âgé  de 28 ans . Il vit au Sénégal. Il est en meme temps maçon et éleveur aviculteur. Il a une expérience  de 6 ans dans ses activités. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit depuis juin 2005. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons  à revendre.  Son objectif et de maximiser es revenus  dan s la mesure ou son premier prêt lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices   qu’il a utilisé pour éponger  les dettes qu’il avait contracté et constituer un fond de roulement.
texts.en: Monsieur Mbaye is 28 years old. He lives in Senegal. He works both as a builder and a poultry farmer. He has 6 years work experience in these activities. He has been a member of his local branch of U-IMCEC since June 2005. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs so that he can buy sheep for resale. His aim is to maximize his revenues since his first loan enabled him to generate profits that he used to pay off the debts he had accumulated and to set up a fund of working capital.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 37 years old, married, and has four children who attend school.  She lives in the town of Aopo.  To make a living, Elisapeta runs a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confections such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 680 WST a month.

In 2011, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase baking equipment. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with eight children. Marciana has a pig farm that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the pigs. Marciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marciana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33  years old and single. She is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Roselyn owns and operates a food business, selling banana cue (caramelized, fried bananas) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. Roselyn joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients and supplies and invest in the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her business and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoanna es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña Jhoanna tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría y vende cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de un local para poner una tienda.

Sus sueños son construir su casa y realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a member of the communal bank Corazones de Turi ( Hearts of Turi ), she lives in a community pertaining to the Turi parish in Cuenca, a place known as the viewpoint for the city of Cuenca since from this point you can observe a large part of the city; its people are merchants, they raise livestock, they farm, and are characterized as being very charismatic and nice.  Jhoanna is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children from the marriage, one who is 5 and another who is 1 year old.  Her daughter goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  She doesn't own a home so she lives with her mother sharing the household expenses.  Jhoanna focuses on household duties and since she stays at home she also raises and sells guinea pigs.  
This is her 4th loan with the communal bank and her current loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to be able to build and open a store.  
Her dreams are to build her own home and go to college.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. The remaining one is still young. She has been selling fabrics (vitenge), sarongs (kanga), and mandazi (doughnuts) for four years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.  

She requested a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more business stock and covered household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan, which she wants to use to increase her business stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, “Madoma", which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is grateful to kiva for the previous loan which he used to add stock to his shop. He was able to increase his profits, which he used to pay school fees for his children. He is requesting for another kiva loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, rice and other foodstuffs as well as reconstructing his shop. He hopes this will increase his income which he will use to continue paying for his children education fees.
He is very happy and grateful to Kiva and it's lenders for the continued financial support and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, salt, rice and other foodstuffs hence increases income to continue paying education fees for his children

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and has 2 small children. She and her mother run a restaurant that is very popular in their neighborhood. Maria has been in the restaurant since she was very young because her mother always ran similar businesses. Now they are business partners and are having great success. Maria is also a saleswoman who sells shoes, clothes and home products. She sells to many of the clients at her restaurant and she also travels into large markets in the city to make her sales. Maria has not had much luck with the father children. The father of the first left her shortly after finding about the pregnancy and the father of the second passed away two months after the child was born. Although Maria faces the difficult challenge of being a single mother, she is hardworking and optimistic.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in food for her restaurant and other products to sell

loans.name: Rooseweli

texts.en:
Mr. Fredy has 15 years of experience selling breakfasts. Before that, he used to live in the country, and his brother came up with the idea of moving to the city. He started out working for his brother, and little by little he saved his money. With those savings, he was able to buy a home site here in Isla Trinitaria. Along with his wife, he began selling breakfasts at a place near his home. He works from Monday through Friday from 4:30 AM until 10:00 AM. In the afternoon he also sells juice by the glass.

Fredy wants this loan in order to invest part of it in supplies for the breakfasts. The rest he will use to pave the floor of the part of his home where he prepares the breakfasts to sell. Right now, the unpaved floor is soaking up water and there are lots of mosquitoes due to the wetness.

Fredy is married. He is 36 years old and has 3 children who are all in school. His wife helps him prepare the breakfasts. He hopes with this investment that his business will create more income so that he can make his home adequate.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in food supplies and improve his location.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: A beautiful woman who has no cause to regret that she belong to LAPO. She is 38-years-old and married with four (4) children. My numerous customers always give me satisfaction, says Mrs. Rebecca O.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes  for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Baltasar de Quispe is married and has five children. She is a member of the seven-year-old local association Zaragoza and runs a restaurant in the Cosmos 79 neighborhood. There used to be a bus stop outside her restaurant which brought in many customers, but the bus stop has now moved, taking a lot of business with it, so Josefina joined Pro Mujer hoping to increase her capital and replace the lost income. At this time, she needs to borrow money to remodel and expand her restaurant.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Josefina Baltasar de Quispe, casada, madre de 5 hijos y perteneciente a las asociación comunal Zaragoza, con una antigüedad de 7 años, se dedica a la atención de un restaurante en la zona de Cosmos 79. Anteriormente, el lugar donde Josefina tiene su negocio, era una parada de transporte público, lo que le permitió tener una masiva clientela. A sus 35 años, ingresa a Pro Mujer, buscando la forma de inyectar capital a su negocio, que a raíz del traslado de la parada de transporte público, provocó un fuerte descenso en sus ventas y de forma inherente a sus ingresos. Actualmente, Josefina necesita remodelar su restaurante para poder cabida a la clientela que se da cita, remodelando y ampliando su negocio, y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida

loans.use: To expand and remodel a restaurant.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai O., 46, lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is employed as a laborer, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together they can generally earn around $5 profit each day. One of her children works in a rubber plantation collecting rubber sap from the trees and can typically earn about $2.40 each day, whilst the other three are students.

Mrs. Thai O. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so he can use his own motorcycle to operate a business and thus generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business ( a motor-taxi)

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: I am happy to be a LAPO client says Mrs. Taiwo O., a married man with has 5 children, who lives in Lagos State She sells provision, drinks and recharge card of all networks and she has been in this business since 1994 .She is a member of LAPO union. She needs the loan of US$625 to buy more provision and recharge card for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision and drink

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul B. is a father of five children and pays their education expenses from the profits from the business.  Because of small loans from SMT, Abdul still takes some of the business items from the merchants on credit, which does not provide him with good profits. For two years, SMT has been working with Abdul and found him to be honest and hard working.  Abdul is requesting another loan to expand his business and build his own capital.  He would also like to involve his wife in the daily management of the business. Abdul is 36 years old.

loans.use: Abdul would like to expand his business so that his wife can help contribute to the success of the business.

loans.name: Nyenga East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca T.. She is currently in the business of operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of products. Jesca is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a primary school teacher. She has 2 children aged 22 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more products and the loan was paid back on time.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Alice K., Agatha N., Luga N., and Allen N.. Alice K. has a hotel business and wants to buy more foodstuffs and furniture. Agatha N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Luga N. operates a poultry farm and wants to purchase more poultry feeds. Allen N. is currently operates a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair steamer and dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Akuété

texts.fr:
Akuété D., age 27, is single and runs a bar. He has been in this business since 2005 and has his own bar, which is named JUDAS DOREE. His first loan of 300,000 francs CFA enabled him to buy a new freezer to replace the old one in order to improve product quality. During this heat wave, the demand for carbonated beverages and for cold water has increased. To rise up to the challenge, he must restock to meet customer expectations and to maintain continuously the entire range of drinks. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA to buy 38 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Akuété célibataire âgé de 27 ans, tient un débit de boissons gazeuses. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et dispose de sa propre boutique dénommée « JUDAS DOREE ». Son premier crédit d’un montant 300.000FCFA lui a permis d’acheter un nouveau congélateur pour remplacer l’ancien afin d’améliorer la qualité des produits. En cette période de forte chaleur la demande en boissons gazeuses et en eau fraîches a augmenté. Pour y faire face, il doit faire un ravitaillement pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et avoir en permanence toute la gamme de boissons. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000 FCFA pour acheter 38 casiers de bière.

loans.use: To sell fizzy drinks

loans.name: Ni Wayan Winarti

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Winarti is a homemaker who is assiduous in working. Winarti opens a convenient kiosk in front of her house, and sells basic food ingredients and everyday’s supplies. Winarti opens her kiosk from 9 am until 10 pm for her customers, who live in her neighborhood. Everyday, Winarti buys her inventory from a local market using a motorcycle. Winarti earns from $2.50 to $3.50 daily. From this income and her husband’s as a farmer, they can meet their family’s needs and pays for their child’s 7th grade school tuition. With her healthy and productive family situation, Winarti hopes that the loan she is requesting through DINARI can help expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Winarti adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang sangat tekun dalam bekerja. Winarti membuka warung di tempat tinggalnya yang menjual bahan makanan dan kebutuhan sehari-hari. Winarti mulai berjualan dari pukul 09.00 pagi hingga pukul 10.00 malam dimana para pelanggannya adalah warga di sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Setiap pagi Winarti membeli kebutuhan dan kelengkapan warungnya di pasar terdekat dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Winarti setiap hari sekitar Rp 25.000,- sampai Rp 35.000,-. Dari hasil jualannya dan dibantu oleh suaminya yang bekerja di sawah sebagai petani, Winarti mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya dan sanggup menyekolahkan anaknya sampai kelas 1 SMP. Dengan keadaan keluarganya yang sehat dan masih produktif diharapkan pinjaman modal dari DINARI akan membantu mengembangkan usaha dari Winarti.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is a widow and has two grown children, ages 30 and 32. She started her business in order to make money as she did not have any other income apart from her sales and the money her children would give her from time to time. She began a few years ago and since then has sold shoes and bedspreads, but now is focused on selling shoes by catalog. The catalog sales are going very well because each month she has a large quantity or orders and people are always purchasing shoes from her.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid in one month, in order to buy merchandise and fill a pending order. With your help Mrs. Rosario will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 años. Inició el negocio para poder sacar dinero ya que no tiene otros ingresos de dinero más que la que le da sus ventas y la de sus hijos que le dan dinero de vez en cuando. Comenzó hace años y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas, ahora esta enfocada vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

Solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 1 mes, para comprar mercancía y sacar un pedido que tiene pendiente, con tu apoyo la Sra. Rosario podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice D. sells clothing that she sews. She is married but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Eunice and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business sewing and selling clothes.

loans.name: Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs B. Thi Ha is 51 years old. Her husband is a retired military personnel. After retirement, she and her husband saved up a small amount of money and opened a shop selling spare engine parts and repairing engines. At the beginning of 2008, TYM fund opened in her area. She had discussed with her husband that they really should take out a loan to invest in the shop. Her husband is a talented mechanic so they have a lot of customers. In addition to repairing, they also buy old engines to repair and resell which is also a good source of income. She has 2 children who are grown and have stable jobs. Because of the military retirement pension, her family income is very stable. She is asking to borrow 300 USD to invest in spare parts. Their average income is 180 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hà 51 tuổi, chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu sau khi nghỉ hưu vợ chồng chị tích lũy được một số vốn mở ốt bán phụ tùng máy và sửa chữa máy, đầu năm 2008 Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng mạnh giạn tham gia Quỹ vay vốn, để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng. Chồng chị là người có tay nghề cao nên khách đến sửa chữa rất đông, ngoài sửa chữa ra khách hàng có nhu cầu bán máy cũ gia đình chị cũng mua và tu sửa lại rồi bán đấy cũng là nguồn lợi nhuận cao, chị sinh được 2 con hiện tại các con chị đã lớn và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, thuộc gia đình cán bộ về hưu nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 5.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng phụ tùng máy. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Sheila is the owner of a Mama Lishe or local café in Dar es Salaam. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business is a restaurant or café, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don't even appear in the Lonely Planet's budget guide, but if you're looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. As a forty-year-old divorced mother of four (one of her children is still in school), profits from the café are essential to helping her family satisfy their daily needs. Sheila started her café in 2002 and has since been earning a monthly profit of 200 USD, which she uses towards school fees and food for the family. Sheila is requesting a loan of 275 USD to expand her café and help propel her business to increased profits and her family to an improved standard of living. The loan will be used to purchase cutlery, crockery, and more chairs for her customers. Sheila is a hard worker who can be found at her café for long hours every day of the week! Sheila would like to be successful enough to expand her café to other locations.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Tabu's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 23 years old. She is married with 2 children, 3 and 5 years old. She has been a tailor and bites (snacks) seller since March 2008. Everyday she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tabu now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Raya, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Marta Lidia, soltera, con 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años ambos estudian la educación primaria, el horario de trabajo que tiene es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm de lunes a viernes, con 19 años de servicio, está solicitando su 4to. Crédito el que tiene destinado para empezar la construcción de su vivienda, construirá ocho metros cuadrados de arranques donde la Alcaldia de Juigalpa con el INVUR le construirá su vivienda ya que actualmente habita en una casa que paga el MINSA donde funciona FETSALUD, en la que no tiene condiciones, ni privacidad, pues sus hijos están creciendo y quiere darles un techo aunque sea módico, con la esperanza de ir mejorándolo posteriormente ya que siente que tiene las puertas abiertas en AFODENIC porque sus créditos los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, es una persona muy responsable y con alto sentido de honradez y moral de pago.
texts.en:
Ms. Marta Lidia is single with two boys ages 11 and 6-years old. Both are studying in elementary school while she works from 8 AM to 4 PM Monday through Friday. With 19-years of service as a health worker, she requests a loan to start on the construction of her house. She would like to build an 8-square metered house in Alcaldia de Juigalpa with the INVUR (Institute of Urban and Rural Housing). Where Ms. Lidia currently resides she must pay MINSA (Ministry of Health) which operates FETASALUD (Federation of Health Workers) and the conditions there provide no privacy for her growing children. She would like to put a modest roof over their heads, with the hope that things will get better. She feels that doors have opened with AFODENIC and will pay her loan back in a timely manner as she is a very responsible person with a high sense of honor to do what is morally correct to pay her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start construction on her house

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira was born in 1972. She lives in Lukavac, a small village in Bosnia. She is married and her husband is a coal miner. She has two sons, ages 13 and 16. Elvira raises chickens, and earns about 200KM/month (about $132 USD). Elvira is requesting a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy a computer for her sons. She hopes that the computer will help her sons in school and encourage them to pursue higher education.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng U. is a villager in Smao Lich Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Aside from this plantation, she and her husband, Mr. Sim Chea, are incense stick makers.

Since this business is going well, they want to sell door-to-door, so Mrs. Eng U. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike to transport her products door-to-door. Mrs. Eng U. is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are two and four years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport her products

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: N. Grace is the leader of the Kavule women’s group in Mukono. She is a widow with seven children; she also cares for 2 relatives who are orphans. For 2 years, Grace has had a business making liquid soap.  She sells the soap mostly to supermarkets, shops and clinics.  She has also made empombo (traditional chicken) for 3 years, which she sells to different clubs and restaurants. She needs a loan to boost her liquid soap business by buying more powder, as well as to help her in buying more chicken. She is grateful for the loans because they have helped her to support her numerous businesses.

loans.use: More soap powder and chicken for her businesses.

loans.name: Rukmani

texts.en:
Rukumani S. is the resident of Bholdhoka. Bholdhoka is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small business. There are five members, including herself, in her family. She has two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 3 and younger daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. S. along with her husband Mr. Sahadev S., started a grocery shop, nine years ago in their own house. They sell different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.  Now Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for Rs.25000.00 to buy a wider variety of grocery items for her business.She wants to use the increased income to provide better education for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailanie M. lives in Barangay Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Ferdinand, who is a construction worker. They have two children: Micah Ruth, 9, a grade V student and Franshelle, who is just three months old. Lailanie said that though they are poor, they are still a happy family.

Lailanie wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP6, 000, which will be utilized as additional capital for her store. She intends to use the money to buy stocks to avoid frequent visits to the market to save time and money. Her wish is to send her children to school and for them to finish college education in order to have a better future. Lailanie also hopes to overcome life's difficulties by simply striving to work hard in order to achieve her ambitions.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Buena Fe 4 Group

texts.en:
Buena Fe group 4 is made up of 5 people looking to receive their very first loan. Each member is currently living in extreme poverty, and is not living with any of the luxuries that we often take for granted. Each member is hoping to take this first loan and get started on their very own small business. The ideas range from clothing stores to food markets. This loan will give an opportunity to 5 people who have not had many good opportunities in their life, and give them a chance to change their future.

Santa J. is the representative of this group and is extremely excited about this opportunity. Santa is the mother of two young children and realized she needed to do something when she couldn't afford school for both her children. Santa wants nothing more than a better life for her children, and she knows that getting them an education is the only way to do that. She wants to start a small business selling clothing in her area. She plans to buy the clothing from Santo Domingo where she can buy clothing cheap, and then sell it for a profit in her area. She is excited to have something of her own and believes that this is her chance to change her family's life!

Thank you for giving Santa a chance at changing her future!!

loans.use: Buy clothing for their business

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo sells hair extension and is also a stylist. She is 30 years old and married with four children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and lives in the Adeloko Lagos state.

Omo needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more hair extensions, dryer and washing basing in order to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase a dryer and washing basing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio tiene 35 años de edad y esta domiciliado en la compañía de Calle Ybate de la Ciudad de Itá. Esta acompañado de la señora Bernardina de 30 años de edad, con quien tiene dos hijos, Daniel (12) que cursa actualmente el sexto  grado de la Educación Básica y Leticia, de 5 años que va al pre-escolar.

De profesión mecánico,  hace más de 12 años, donde día a día trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le ha sido fácil mantener a sus hijos ya que proviene de una familia humilde y a vez ayuda a sus  padres.  Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de herramientas como: una pulidora, taladro y una soldadora eléctrica, de manera a poder mejorar su trabajo y consecuentemente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio is thirty-five years old and lives on Ybate Street in the city of Ita. He lives with thirty-year-old Mrs. Bernardina with whom he has two children: Daniel who is twelve years old and currently enrolled in sixth grade and Leticia who is five years old and enrolled in kindergarten. Eleuterio has been a mechanic for twelve years and worked consistently with the objective of improving his family's quality of life. It has not been easy to support his children given the fact that he comes from a humble background and continues to help his parents at the same time. He has decided to trust the Fundacion Paraguaya to help him with the purchase of several tools such as: a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine. He hopes that these tools will help him improve his work thereby improving his income as well.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine

loans.name: Yessenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Yessenia de los Ángeles R. tiene  26 años de edad, nació en Managua y habita en el barrio la Esperanza, es casada y su marido es auxiliar de limpieza en un supermercado de la capital, tienen tres hijos una  de 5,7, y niño de nueve meses, las metas para su familia es obtener una vivienda digna que le permita dar seguridad a su familia, ella tiene un año laborando en seguridad interna , y su meta personal es adquirir un buen empleo que le permita obtener mejores ingresos y sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana de su hogar y que le permita un margen de ahorro para asegurarle a sus hijos un  futuro mejor. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y construir una pared externa de un cuarto y sala. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Yessenia de los Ángeles R., 26, was born in Managua. She lives in the Esperanza neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a cleaning assistant in a supermarket in the capital. They have three children ages five, seven, and nine months. The family goal is to get a decent house that will provide safety for the family. She has worked for a year in internal security. Her personal goal is to get a good job that will give better earnings, meet the daily household needs, and allow for a margin of savings to assure her children of a better future. This loan is to buy construction materials to build an external wall to a bedroom and living room. She gives thanks to the institution for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build an inside wall to a room

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren J. lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Their son goes to a local university. 

Davaasuren has a small retail business in clothing. She usually travels to Ereen, China, a border town from where many inexpensive Chinese products are exported, and purchases inexpensive yet attractive clothing for women and men.

She started her business in 2005 with a loan of 700,000 MNT (approximately $500). Within two years, she was able to buy a small car for her family with the business profit. Today, her business has expanded; business capital has exceeded 2,000,000 MNT. She says that she works hard on her business in order to make sure that her son receives a good education without any financial strains. 

She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's apparel from Ereen, China

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia A. is a food vendor. Emilia prepares and sells kenkey. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Emilia buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years.

Emilia is 29 years old, married and has one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. Her husband works with an environmental protection agency.
